name: Medfusion Plus
title: Well maintained
text: The stored health data is well organized, preserved and accessible whenever you want it. This is the sublime app.

name: Medfusion Plus
title: Useful app
text: Tired of managing your family's health data across multiple Patient Portals? Medfusion Plus pulls everything together, keeps it up-to-date automatically and puts you in charge of your data. Great app.

name: Medfusion Plus
title: Top class
text: This is a top app. The high-quality app is used to maintain and access all your family's health data in one place. It is a really good one.

name: higi
title: Happy for the stations, but app is flawed
text: First of all, I find the free screening stations amazing since it leaves no excuse for people to routinely monitor their blood pressure and potentially find cardiovascular disease at an early stage. That said, the service is frustrating. The login at most stations is slow or doesnâ€™t work at all (they should check for appropriate internet connectivity at their stations). My second frustration is that it integrates with Apple Health to read my steps but wonâ€™t record my bp and weight to it. This is really annoying and the main reason for my low score for the app

name: higi
title: App works well
text: There are a number of posts about poor performance, but many of those are several years old. I didnâ€™t experience any large delays in using the app. Apple Health integration is one way - importing step count. It doesnâ€™t send data to Apple Health at this time, which would be a welcome addition so I wouldnâ€™t have to manually enter the data into my personal record (which was the reason I signed up in the first place).

name: higi
title: No Support an Poor App
text: Downloaded the app and tried using my old account and it said my email did not exist. So I tried using my email to create a new account thinking maybe it has been two years and it was deactivated only to get a message saying the email already exists. Then I tried using my email and forgot my password but it did not allow me to do that either. I deleted it which is unfortunate so I lock my blood pressure on my phone and then transfer it to a spreadsheet.

name: higi
title: Extremely poor connectivity
text:
Not a bad app, but the connectivity is worse than ignorant. The 
Stations have poor connectivity, a laptop connected directly to fiber has multiple minutes to connect, the phone app can take 5 minutes to connect. 

Once connected not bad but building a network the equivalent of silly string is not well thought out. 

Iâ€™ve tried multiple stations only a few miles apart and can gain as much as 10 pounds in less than 5 minutes, and the BP cuff can be almost as erratic. Go to your doctors office and get your bp and weight. Go directly to a higi station and you will see what I mean. 

Good idea, but far from the gold standard.

name: higi
title: Great app, but one thing
text: I love using the free higi stations whenever I see one. And the app is great, but it doesnâ€™t connect and share information with the Apple health kit. Which I like using as much as higi. Is that feature going to come back?

name: higi
title: What happened?
text: This app used to share my blood pressure, BMI etc to the apple health app. That was great as it adds to the pulse data from my watch and fitness data to help make a full picture of my health. I do t know if itâ€™s the latest IOS or iPhone X that itâ€™s not compatible with but it stopped working with the health app completely. This was the main reason I used the app. :(

name: higi
title: Unconnected Health Data
text:
The app has been pleasure to use for couple years. Since Iâ€™ve upgraded to iPhone X (10) health app isnâ€™t sharing data this has to be from the higi app because the native app shows higi as connected 

please resolve

name: higi
title: Help.
text:
I like this app.. but the data doesnâ€™t sync with Apple Health? 

I would like HIGI to â€œwriteâ€� data on Apple health. I donâ€™t understand why data such as weight, blood pressure, BMI, etc doesnâ€™t sync. Please fix this!!!

And add more stations throughout Las Vegas besides the groceries stores such as gyms, places on the Las Vegas strip, hotels, etc.

name: higi
title: Great app
text: I used Higi at Rite Aid and signed up there. I checked my blood pressure and weight. I then downloaded the app and entered my user name and password. Immediately my info popped up. Love the this app.

name: higi
title: Weight
text: I went to 2 different machines the weight was different. The scale at my home was different as well. Other than that the app is pretty good

name: higi
title: Not Friendly
text:
So we have the metrics,
Ok thatâ€™s a PRO! 

But we canâ€™t synchronize them to apps like, myFitnessPal, UArecord, etc.

The app really must become more useful and be able to sync to Health, myFitnessPal, UArecord, so we can keep track of our health and progression loosing weight or putting it up! 

Itâ€™s totally useless, if we have to put al biometrics manually! 

So why to use Higi Station? 
For $20 we can get a Scale! And have all the data immediately on our tracking apps!

Hope an update! To show up soon!

name: higi
title: Does NOT Record
text: Just because you logged in and went through the steps does not mean it recorded your data. With higi you still need pencil and paper. Failed 3 out of 7 times.

name: higi
title: Nokia devices wonâ€™t sync
text: I have several Nokia devices (formerly Withings) that sync with the Nokia app. I can not get the Nokia app to sync into the Higi app like it says it will. It comes up with an unexpected error.

name: higi
title: Needs to sync to the Health app
text: Check your Health app and higi data doesnâ€™t show up. This needs to be fixed.

name: higi
title: Horrible!
text: I registered in at Publix Pharmacy.  I got the impression that it would pair with the iPhone app.  I keep receiving a message that I have not entered correct info on the app sign-in.  I have triple checked it.  I DO NOT HAVE WiFi!

name: higi
title: Canâ€™t log in after update
text: The phone number field isnâ€™t allowing me to log in

name: higi
title: Apple Health
text: Iâ€™m tired of having to manually copy everything to HealthKit. Fix the already.

name: higi
title: Higi needs to share with Apple health
text: Higi needs to share the data it receives at the weight station to Apple health.

name: higi
title: Add Apple health app
text: It would be great if PB would sync to Apple health app.

name: higi
title: New update offers spam over metrics
text: Used to be a four, maybe five, star app where you could check into one of their stations to check your blood pressure and weight then open app to track how you're doing over time (known as metrics on app). Had a monthly challenge and a website where you could get a small coupon or donate your 'watts' (basically points earned for 'steps' you've done)to one of two charities. Simple and easy!! NOW, I wouldn't recommend this app to my worst enemy!! Omg, mostly 'spam' when opens up as it goes on about the new communities they want to expand on, talks about the two they have, asks trivia, asks how you doing, blah, blah, blah. The challenge is still there, only they now also do extra ones for each community so who knows if anyone is actually in the community for what the community is there for or just for the chance at a gift card. This makes these communities almost worthless to connect to others in the same situation as you, which may be why you joined. The metrics are now last, and they will even ask 'what do you use the app for' if you email them about this horrible update!! Even if this is free, just NO! My recommendation is keep eye out for the stations & use them plus a small notebook to keep track of your own blood pressure & weight. If you can't find one then, and only then, download app to find a station. Just be aware that it's up to you to notice if the station is working correctly on top of everything else. You have been warned!

name: higi
title: Perf~
text: This app is absolutely amazing. It's like a point-gaining game you play in real life when you check in at a higi station. As a bonus, it watches your health! Great way to motivate someone to care for themselves. There are two things I would want to change about it though, one of them being that the only people you can add are your friends on Facebook? It would be awesome to be able to compete with people around my area as well seeing as not everyone on facebook friends will be receptive to try higi (Yet.) The other being the ability to search for people through their emails because, believe it or not, not everyone has a Facebook but they have higi. But! this is the most amazing and creative app I've seen thus far and if you guys tweaked that problem I'm sure it would be stupendous! Keep up the great work and looking forward to more tweaks of awesomeness!

name: higi
title: the service is helpful but the App need much better improvement!
text: I believe this company is making a huge investment (just GPS all Higi stations around you and the country) and is serious about providing health support .. And that's why I think the app needs better improvement in being more simple and straight forward I giving the info you need or better rewards system ! The  sweepstakes are getting better take all those expensive  and Yapi regards that only Silicon techs can afford to pay for a $69 t-shirt or Organic Shakes for $25 !! N give things we can get enthusiastic like the Membership club ! A fitness gadget .. Maybe coupon reward for Active wear at Target or some nationwide sporting good.  Also .. Some of the Higi stations are way off so ( don't trust too much in those numbers )  and get a scale at home ...

name: higi
title: Thanks for constantly reminding me I'm "obese"
text:
Seriously higi, could you please use a little more compassion when labeling thing on both your app and at the stations. 
When I check in and the results tell me I'm "obese" and then I use the app and the weight chart on the right hand side says "obese" as you look at your progress. 
I'm trying to better myself and labeling the chart in that manner makes it difficult to continue feeling motivated. 
Maybe change it to something more positive to help inspire instead of reminding them of how the populace views them.
Please don't force a label on someone when they are trying to improve.

name: higi
title: Good but needs more work
text:
The app is great for viewing my historical trends of weight and blood pressure. I like that it grabs my account information from the Higi stations. However, for an iPhone app, I hate that it doesnâ€™t store my log-in information. When I stop to do a health check, when Iâ€™m done I hop back in my car and I check my iPhone to see the trend. Every single time I have to type out my long email address and password before gaining access to my stats. My only other recommendation would be to add the ability to email my statistics to my doctor. 

Like I said, itâ€™s a good app, but it could use some more work.

name: higi
title: Could be better
text: I love the higi station already. The app is icing on the cake. While the score is good to give you something to work towards, it shouldn't be a notification when the app is closed. It's bothersome to people who like no notifications and get rid of them. Another way the app could be better is through targeted ways to teach you to get your score better. Overweight? Recipes that have half the fat and sugar that you would use or simply recipe tweaks to change the calories without taste. High blood pressure? Stress relief techniques.

name: higi
title: Not everything is working
text: Heyâ€¦ downloaded Higi a few weeks ago when I found your machines in my local publix.  It was very slow loading for the first week or soâ€¦ now it does not show anyone of my friends on the leader boardâ€¦ the score on the app icon and the score on the actual front page of the app are different.  When I take a picture, it takes a good 24 hours or more for a score to return.   I like the idea of Higi so I am hoping you will be able to fix all of this.   Otherwise, its just taking up memory space on my phone.

name: higi
title: Doesn't stay connected to Fitbit
text: I've been using this app for about a month now. I love that it notifies me when I'm close to a Higi station and it keeps track of my results. However, it seems to have an issue losing connection to my FitBit Flex. I have to go in and reselect FitBit, login and it immediately loses the connection again. I want to be able to compete in some of the challenges, but it's not getting all of my activity that is being tracked in my FitBit. Please fix that and I'll improve my rating!

name: higi
title: Higi app just part of whole crappy higi experience
text: I'm not even sure why higi bothered with an app.  It gives confusing, inconsistent information about Active Challenges.  There's no way to see the stats on the people you follow.  If you're not entering in metrics like Heart Rate, the chart still takes up screen real estate. The  Pulse blog content is not timely or informative.  The web app is only marginally better.  The whole higi version of the challenges & rewards concept is severly lacking.   There's  really not one positive aspect of the higi experience from rewards & badging to interacting with the web and mobile apps.

name: higi
title: It's okay
text: It needs a lot of work to really make me feel at ease with this app. The login system must be dealt with; I had to access the login screen three times before I got to my Higi profile. All in all, it's great to have my Higi stats on hand but it needs better socialization options and a more "user friendly" approach. I can see why the other reviewers were quick to drop it in frustration with the login function: I had more patience. Please make this more functional!

name: higi
title: Pretty good, but...
text:
I'd like to make a few suggestions for updates to make this app a 5 star app in my opinion. 

Firstly, I'm a sucker for achievements. I love that you can collect them through Higi, but its a shame that you cannot view them anywhere within the app. 

Secondly, I'm asked to re-log in way too much when I open the app multiple times a day. Not a deal breaker of course, just annoying. 

Thirdly, I track my weight using a Fitbit Aria scale,  but I also like to run the full gamut of tests at a higi station. (The Fitbit scale does not count BMI Like the station) I would like a way to select which weight data to go off of so I don't have to view differing weights on the same day. 

All that being said, the app is quite nice, I enjoy the challenges and the info it provides.

name: higi
title: A good app that would be great with health kit integration
text: It is an attractive app and so far it's been running smooth for me. I like that you can add in statistics from other apps or devices, but the cherry on top would definitely be health kit integration. As it is, since I want health kit to be my primary database, I have to manually enter it every time I take a reading.

name: higi
title: Awesome app
text: I use the higi Station in my local CVS about once a week but this mobile app seems like it's an awesome way for me to track my food and workouts. Pictures are much easier than calorie counting and keeping track of my higi Score each day is awesome.

name: higi
title: Bring back old version
text: The new version provides far less information. I will not update on my iPhone as I did for my iPad. I miss the body stats. The graphs are useless unless you tap each. I prefer the numbers and a quick glance at the numbers. Challenges tells me nothing. Dashboard even less. What happened to Activity. If you're a FitBit user, seeing your step count is motivating. More steps=more points. Please bring back Body stats and Activity b

name: higi
title: Good idea, needs some improvements
text:
First of all, I like the general idea of this app. It's great and I love the booth in the store I used. However some issues I have that make me consider getting rid of it if not fixed!

1) stop making me log in every time I open it. Convenience factor is huge. 

2) APPLE WATCH CONNECTION?! Why not have the biggest name of devices be listed to connect? I bought it specifically for tracking and I love it. Also have it connect with apple's health app! 

Seriously. It's those two factors that are deciding points in keeping this app and referring friends and family or deleting it completely.

name: higi
title: Doesn't do much
text: Ok, it records my blood pressure, heat rate n weight which is convenient. Activity seems to be how often I check in as opposed to real activity like bicycling, walking n yoga. Community? Haven't got a clue what that means. My over all score is still a mystery unless it's vitals relative to others my age. Seems like this app has potential but needs more development. Not getting much out of it right now.

name: higi
title: Good but...
text: The one thing that absolutely annoys me is that every time you open the app you have to login. Make it so that our email and password are saved so we don't have to continuously relog in. Other than that it seems to be working good.

name: higi
title: Really good!
text: My friends and I are currently losing weight and once a week we use the machine to track our progress and it's so much fun to see the progress we've made! It's only been a month but I love higi!! ğŸ˜„

name: higi
title: Informative and Helpful
text: A good looking, helpful, and fun app. Submitting pictures of my food to get information really helps give me an idea of what I'm actually eating. Keeping a log of my weight and blood pressure is pretty great, too.

name: higi
title: Good concept but....
text: The concept is sound but a few key issues from my experience. The higi machine in my neighborhood grocery store is located next to the main entrance. Not the ideal environment. The app stopped updating after 3 visits even though the website was accurate and the results were emailed to me.  I don't think the badges and odd little incentives are very effective. Clean and simple is good.

name: higi
title: Good Concept, Needs fixes
text:
The Higi stations and iPhone app is a great tool for the Health community. That being said there are numerous ways to improve the experience:

- Allow the app to write data in Health and other health and fitness apps
- Allow communication with healthcare apps to support doctor's visit (body fat %, e.g.)
- Fix bug that prevents exporting data

name: higi
title: Twitter
text: I'm using iOS 8, but can't link this to my Twitter account. Also needs to be updated for iOS 8 health app. I use higi at work every week, and think it is great, when it works, but there are times when the screen won't accept any finger taps.

name: higi
title: Room for improvement
text: Need iOS 8 health integration. Also, during most visits to a higi station, I take my BP more than once. However, in the app, it only shows one measurement per check in. It would be more helpful to show all BP measurements taken. Fix those two issues, and I'd give 5 stars.

name: higi
title: Same issues as others
text:
The metrics crash is irritating. I just downloaded the app to track my stats, after reading the reviews about the other issues that is. All the other complaints appear to be accurate as well.

I will try to update this review when I have more data for comparison.

name: higi
title: Like it a lotâ€¦donâ€™t love it yet!
text: iOS 8 Health app is an absolute next step for this app.  I love all the stuff it tracks for me and how it helps me stay health-focused but I already have too many apps to check.  I need the convenience of the iOS HealthKit integration.  Then I can really love higi.

name: higi
title: Useless, and makes me use the higi station LESS
text: I liked the old check-in cards that in one screen-cap sent to a loved one would show all the day's readings and how they're different from the previous day.  I've gone from checking in every day to 1-2x per month (and photographing the screen at the higi station instead).

name: higi
title: Not synching with Apple Health a minus
text:
I really like the app for getting acceptably accurate data by using the monitoring stations nearby. But not having the data connected to Apple Health is a real drawback. 

I can get all the information manually and type it into the health app on my iPhone. So why bother with the Higi?

I hope this is just an oversight to be quickly corrected.

name: higi
title: Doesn't reliably record data
text: I've logged into my account on the HIGI machine at my pharmacy. I need to learn to jot out the results before logging off and going to this app.  This app is hit or miss when recording your health data. Use with that in mind or look for a different solution.

name: higi
title: Good start...Needs work
text:
Glad the update can let me track my results, but how come the machine can give me Body Fat % but this app can't track those results? Definitely needs to be added.

Looking forward to more updated features

name: higi
title: Good but not great
text: It is a nice way to keep track of health data and encourage activity, but it can be odd to read sometimes. I don't like that I have to constantly re-log in and nothing can be saved, not even your user name email address.

name: higi
text: This app is great when I first downloaded it but now for some unknown reason I can't connect to the server with both the web browser version of the service as well as the app. Please fix because I was doing very well with keeping track of everything.

text:
Hi, For me, everything works great with HIGI. Both at the stores & the App. One suggested improvement, at the store machines, when you are logging in and you hit the @ sign, to give you all the email .com address. It lists most of the BIGGER ONES LIKE GMAIL & SMALLER ONES LIKE VERIZON & COMCAST.....BUT IT DOESNT GIVE YOU OUTLOOK.COM, WHICH IS MY EMAIL & HAS TO BE USED MORE THAN SOME ALREADY LISTED.

PS. One other suggested change, when you are finishing at the machine, the results pop up after ONE SECOND and says something about it ending right away. THANKS, MUCH APPRECIATED...

name: higi
title: Opportunities for improvement
text:
Kudos to the Higi team for building a great platform and an accessible network of stations. The insights from the higi station have helped me understand my body better and improve my lifestyle all along my 45Lb weight loss journey. As a daily user, I wish a few things were different about my experience: 

1. I do not feel comfortable entering my login information in a public place. I could previously scan a QR code and only had to log in on my phone. 

2. I do not feel comfortable entering my date of birth in public. Is Age not a sufficient input? 

3. I wish the phone app would atleast remember my user name if security is a concern. Frankly security isn't a concern for me since my phone needs a pass code. Almost everybody used a pass code these days! I wish it atleast had an option to "remember my password".

4. I wish the Higi app would share data with the IOS health app. It's a widely compatible health tracking platform that has become wildly popular for the same reason. My fitbit app works that way. This makes it so much more convenient to see all my data in one place. Will it reduce my time spent on the Higi app? Yes it will. If the intention is to build a future channel to monetize on ads, I don't really read the articles on the app since they aren't really focused on my goals- maybe another improvement opportunity. 

After thrashing the hard workers on the Higi team with my last comment, here's some food for thought to lighten up the mood- what if Higi worked with insurance companies to collect lab test results and bring it to my phone's health app? Now, that's something insurance companies would pay for. A lot of insurance plans offer free Fitbits to keep people health and thus reduce their risks. I feel Higi can step into the league if they make their case well.

My health achievements are one of many out there, ready to be cited. 

Keep up the great job, don't disappoint. Your users are watching you!

name: higi
title: Metrics Crashes
text:
09.14.15. I just signed up at a local department store & was thrilled that the BP station had an app to keep me updated. I typically use another branded station at a different grocery store. I love the convenience of an email, but having an app seemed ideal. I'd consider using this one more often than the other simply because of the associated app on my iPhone 6. 

The app design looks decent, the interface is intuitive. However, every time I try to check my metrics it crashes. I tried closing the app out and started again, no success. Hoping for an easy fix... I'll try again another time. Thanks.

name: higi
title: Logging in

name: Sharecare
title: NOT A FAN!!!
text: 1st... last year I had no problem whatsoever getting reimbursed through my healthcare incentive plan!  I met my goals easily and as soon as they were met and I spent money at doctors or pharmacy I got reimbursed!  This year has been a NIGHTMARE!  This app is irrelevant to my life!  I donâ€™t drink or smoke yet two of the questions I must answer every day are about drinking and smoking-as if at any given moment Iâ€™m just going to decide to start picking up those two bad habits!  REALLY!!!  If I tell you in the beginning that I do NEITHER of those then they should be eliminated from my list of items to check off of my daily wellness routine!  Also...  I completed my Real age test in February and Iâ€™m still getting emails telling me that I only have so many more days to complete it before the end of the plan year! 1. I am 36 years old not 76.  I donâ€™t take my BP everyday. I donâ€™t check my glucose everyday.  I didnâ€™t check my cholesterol everyday. I do those things once a year unless otherwise directed by a physician. The app actually showed my â€œrealâ€� age as 34 so why do I need to do these things for the app everyday?
2. Why doesnâ€™t it give you the option of syncing to another device than your phone? I keep my Fitbit with me more than my phone. I have tiny pockets and canâ€™t fit my phone in my pocket while working because of that. I do however keep my Fitbit in my pocket. 
3. If this is really supposed to track health why isnâ€™t there a female reproductive tracking system in place? Lots of women suffer from early signs of reproductive issues that worsen because they donâ€™t see the overall progress of the issues due to improper tracking.
Anyways Iâ€™m deleting because I already have a similar app thatâ€™s better. Hopefully one day my company will cut some type of deal with Fitbit and Iâ€™ll just be able to use the app I like.

text: I have been using the mobile app for several years now. Trust me, it has improved so much! I like all new updates. Itâ€™s fast and doesnâ€™t crash anymore. If no one ever submits reviews then donâ€™t expect changes. Thanks Aetna for great app.

title: Needs updating
text: Let me preface this review by stating that I have an iPhone X and I realize that some apps have yet to update the UI to match the new form factor. With that said, this app is still buggy. I really like having an app for insurance but it needs to actually work to be useful. Please fix!!

text: I never write reviews but I am so impressed with this update. The last version was extremely tacky and lacked a lot of things. Love that itâ€™s iPhone X compatible. Only one thing is missing, it shows your medical claims but not your pharmacy claims which is equally important to me.

I login and tried to search a doctor, I click on the left hand side bar to search for doctor, then as soon as i click away on the right side, the app is frozen, i have to restart the app and re-login. Seriously did you guys put in any thoughts for the users when designing this app?

Terrible experience.

name: Aetna Mobile

I only need the app once in a long while and having to go home to look up my ID and PW defeats the point of a mobile app.

How unfortunate.  I would recommend modeling the Aetna app after United Health Careâ€˜s application.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Really bad app
text: If you enjoy freeze ups, poor layouts, insufficient information, and login failures, youâ€™ll like this app. One expects more from a major health insurance company. text: The app is as bad as their company

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Fix your Touch ID guys - weak
text: Weak

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Junk
text: How this was approved is a mystery.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: keeps hanging
text: this app keeps hanging for me

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Critical Functionality (Still) Missing
text:
I recently returned to Aetna for a varierty of reasons; their app was not one of them.  But I re-downloaded it anyway.  It finally allows the user to copy/paste his or her password; for that alone, I'll bump my rating up one from my previous of 1 star.  However, I would really like to see TouchID functionality.  Anthem can do it; why can't Aetna?  Perhaps it could be available in the app settings, but in another bizzare and troubling first for an app, I don't see a "Settings" menu anywhere within the app.  I'm not a developer, but I'm kind of surprised that an app can even get App Store approval without a settings menu within the app itself (I realize I can go to "settings" within the general "Settings" app, but it's just a bare-bones menu that allows you to decide whether to allow the app to use data, and that's it).  In addition, load times for other menus are slower than they have any right to be.

This app continues to demonstrate that Aetna's indifference and contempt for its members by allowing such an underdeveloped app to represent it.  Use it if you absolutely must, but the native website on iOS may be a better alternative.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It's ok but due for an update
text:
The apps ok for viewing what doctors are billing and so that I can prove to them that my previous visit was paid for and that I don't owe anything (the clinic I go to claims Aetna operates "weird" and although they're paying my visits it shows as if they haven't paid - it's a headache). I can also pull up my insurance card; which is good since I never carry it with me. 

The app does look terrible on the iPhone 6s Plus and iPad - I think it looks bad across iOS 9 in general. It would also be nice if Aetna allowed the app to work with the finger print scanner and/or 1Password - having to login every time with the password is a bit annoying; but it's better than allowing the app to remember the password and give anyone who uses your device access. 

Hopefully Aetna will upgrade their app for iOS 9, add the option of having the insurance card in the wallet, and allow biometrics for logging in.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App contains a cat, both alive and dead
text:
This app might be beautiful and perfect on the inside. I'll never know, though, because I can't paste my password. I come to my phone for secure convenience. And as important as convenience is to me, I will sacrifice it before I sacrifice security.

Your software developers probably lie in bed at night dreaming of punching the face of whomever made the decision to block password pasting. They'll understand how embarrassing this "security measure" really is, and, in understanding, they will hang their collective heads in shame. Please, Aetna, allow those of us with 20 character, random passwords the ability to log in to your app; protect those poor souls who are willing to sacrifice security for convenience; give your software developers, those poor, long-suffering souls the means to stand up proudly, look their peers in the industry in the eye, and say: "Today, I did good. Today I contributed to the security of my customers' PHI. Today, my friends, I am proud."

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Customer
text:
Absolute worst website on the face of the earth!  They strategically block you from being able to access most pages/areas of the site required to be accessed for information about how to operate within their rules. A good example: they require you to use their preferred providers for best pricing.  But every time I have tried to access that page, the system has mysteriously "failed", never acknowledging my attempts.  Then out of frustration, I have gone to providers I know are Aetna providers, only to be penalized by Aetna because I didn't access their preferred provider page and get pre-approval!!
And their billing is HORRENDOUS!
Buyer be ware!!  Double check every invoice!!!
By the way, if you write a review, copy it, because if the nickname you choose is taken, they tell you that .... AND ERASE YOUR ENTIRE REVIEW, FORCING YOU TO START ALL OVER!!!  I'm sure, hoping you'll give up.  Copy, and keep trying until you get it through!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Just terrible
text:
Update: they fixed the bad card issue. Of course, they did it by having an app that web you try to log in it warns you that the site you are visiting is insecure and then no going any further. So Aetna app doesn't trust Aetna. Seems legit. 

I need it to just show me my insurance card. That's it. It took about 10 tries to login. Once I get into this dumpster fire if an app, it has the option to show the card. Ok, great. They have so much navigation crap on the screen it can't show the whole card at once. And what it does show is in like 5 point font with no way to zoom in. You had one job app...

I pay you thousands of dollars a year for terrible care. The least you can do us spend some of that on an app that does the bare minimum of functions. This app is awful. Everyone involved in this mess should be sentenced to having Aetna as their insurance provider.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Excellent! Just as Online
text:
I'm not sure what the others are not doing, but I'm able to use every function of Navigator on this app. Easier than the Mobile access provided by Aetna. Love the convenience. Recommended if you have the insurance!
**For those unable to use all features; it will be from 1 of 2 scenarios: Your Annual Profile Validation needs confirmed. Log into Navigator online and follow the prompts to confirm/update the info. Once complete, full functionality of app is restored. Otherwise, if you have multiple plan sponsors linked to your account, the app is unable to accommodate that at this time. Fixes are coming for both!! Stay tuned!! **

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Some problems
text:
I am able to logon with same user ID and password as web site.
However, I have discovered it sometimes issues a very misleading message that your
user name or password is incorrect when the real problem is apparently that the servers
are not responding.  It should always TELL THE TRUTH.  Lazy programming.
I discovered that the web site was having the same problem at some of those times.

I see others have complained that the claims function says they have no claims.
When you go to that function, there are two tabs on the page.
The left one is supposed to be a claims list.
Trial and error indicates it apparently defaults to listing claims that are no more than 30 days old
and I cannot find a way to change that.
So, it really just means you don't have any claims 30 days or less old.
THEY SHOULD SAY THAT!

If you use the "Claim Search" tab, you can select a longer period of time
or specific date range to search and it DOES find the qualifying/older claims.

I have mostly used it for viewing claims after receiving emails about them
so I don't have much experience with other features or lack thereof.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Make ID card legible, fix Plan list
text:
This app is OK. Not great, but OK. While it's a great idea to have an ID card screen, that screen is useless if it's not legible. A blurry scan, no pinch-screen to enlarge ability, can't even view in landscape mode (hello,  developers: you did realize you were developing this for an iPhone, yes)?

You have to choose your specific plan from a long list of about 25 options -- which isn't alphabetized! So one has to read through a random list of every possible plan Aetna offers. 

The app needs an easy-to-view ID card screen -- not a scan but a clear info screen. It should also know/remember your plan when you're logged in. Fix these flaws and I will increase my star rating.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works great
text: This app worked fine for me, I tried all of the options.   The claim reader was really good, you can see exactly what got done, when it was charged and how much.  The doc finder was a little clunky, but certainly usable.  Everything else worked as advertised.  Previous reviews seemed to blame the app when it is the medical provider database which was causing the issue.   They were also unhappy about logging in each time after leaving the app, but given the strict health care privacy laws, I can see why the developers are reluctant to put in a persistent login.  There is not many other things in health care that are this good and free.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Very useful!!!
text:
After reading the reviews I was afraid it will be a waste of time to even download the app, but I am pleasantly surprised how well it works! The information available on my account is very useful and simplified, which make navigating a piece of cake! Some people complained about the availability of info, but when it comes to claims, I would not even think about using an app (that's just me!) And as far as the password not being read correctly, I had no issues logging in...
I would totally recommend this to all of my co-workers and anyone having Aetna as an insurer! :-)

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Small beginning
text:
This app is pretty ok, but not really. For starters, the login is super lousy. You cannot paste a copied user name or password. I have all my passwords generated, and a password keeper, and I don't have time to switch back and forth with those. It doesn't even at least have an option to remember user name. The ADP app at least saves your user name, and allows for a 4 digit pin. It's not like anyone can make any changes to your policy from the app or anything. It's just a decent app for finding nearby in-network urgent care facilities. It would be much better if it utilized the iPhone's Touch ID, like other apps, after an initial sign in after startup, etc. 
I didn't have much success finding a PC dentist either, though I know that there were nearby providers in-network. 
Much to improve on.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: BlueEnigma07 is an idiot!
text:
The app is clean and easy to use. Of course this is Aetna's attempt to start putting out a mobile app and we can expect more and better functionality in the future. Im pleased for now. 

BlueEnigma07, take a breath. Its one thing to be critical. Its a whole other thing to scare people off of something they could benefit from. Every health insurer is trying to figure out how to go mobile without huge CapEx investments. It not going to be the coolest, it just needs to be useful.  This is not a top line revenue generation play for them so don't expect so much. --jerk--

name: Aetna Mobile
title: With a few more imp tweaks could be great
text: I was SO excited that they had updated and improved this app. I go into Doc Find...it wants to use my current location - perfect in case of emergency! The list of inputs...each comes up very quickly - this is great! Until I get to the last one...Plan Type. Omg there are like hundreds....and I couldn't find mine!!!! Ridiculous! This would NOT work in case of emergency! They need to simplify streamline and shorten this list...make it easy to find and identify your plan!! But I also have to give props for the menu available once you choose a facility ( in my test I was looking for urgent care)....there are buttons to call provider, see a map, and get directions - all very useful!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awesome app!!
text:
Come on people, you have to login every time to protect your health information. A must have for all Aetna members.

If you're only getting DocFind after logging in, use a PC and complete your annual profile verification through the regular website. Try the app again once you've completed this step. Also, if you login and are presented with more than one plan sponsor (employer), you have access to multiple accounts (past/present) this will cause the app not to work. Be patient, a fix is coming.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: How to Make it Work
text:
You have to sign in AS THE PRIMARY MEMBER! I was having the same issues as everyone else and left a review thinking it had to do with OS4.
îŒ¶îŒ¶îŒ¶
After much frustration I went to safari and signed in there. I know when I sign in under my login (you know, the profile you set up when signing up w/ Aetna Navigator) I just get my info HOWEVER when I sign in using my husband's ID/login I get everyone's info.
î„�î„�î„�DUH! I came back to the app and BINGO!! All the features advertised!!
I'm only giving 4îŒµ because the dev should have figured this out & noted it in the app's description.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Your time is better spent elsewhere
text:
If this app is any indicator of Aetna's business acumen, we should expect to see them extinct very soon.

It took me 20 minutes to register the account and get through their enduring error messages. About 70% of the time you will not be successful even logging in. 9001 error message for most of the attempts. 

When I clicked on my benefits information I was shown the date my benefits started and that's it. No other information. If you're looking for any information about benefits eligibility, copays, deductible status you won't find it. 

The doctor search functionality had potential however they must have hired a user experience expert from the 80s. The interface makes even that a complete waste of effort and time. And more crashes. 

There's basically no other redeeming functionality to the app. I deleted after about an hour of trying to make it work.

I'd be embarrassed to have this app represent my company and brand. 

I have to wonder if they have any care whatsoever of their member needs. That's a truly terrifying thought.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not that horrible
text: A lot of people here are saying how bad this app is, and maybe I just got lucky, but it has worked SO FAR for me. Since they won't send me a actual card in the mail ( which is insane) I had to download this app to get my is card info. I had to register which was quick, and then I could pull up my card. Beyond pulling up my ID card, I'm not sure how useful the app will be. But it serves the purpose I needed it too. Obviously from all the other reviews my guess is they have a lot of work to do on this app, so they need to make it better. Thankfully it worked for me though.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not entirely useful
text:
Please add Touch ID for logging in and allow me to add my card to passbook. 

 Being able to Login was not an issue as stated with other reviewers. However the app is cumbersome to use. Since Aetna is moving away from issuing cards, this should really be addressed. Having to juggle kids and get an ID card out was bad enough. Now I need two hands and a minute or two to get my card out for Drs appointments. With Apple's authentication and passbook options this should really not be an issue so Aetna has really dropped the ball here. 
If they clean up the UI, add passbook and Touch ID I will update the rating. Until then I would pass on this app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless
text: The doc finder only let's you search using a 5 or 10 mile radius. In any decent sized city this is useless. It does not have a comprehensive map function, so if you want to see where any of the provider locations are on a map you have to click on each one individually. Also, you can't actually access useful information about your plan, such as how much it would cost to go to a walk-in clinic. It's a clunky app that is somehow even worse than their website. For this and so many other reasons, Aetna is obviously a bloated mess of a company that just leaches off of people's healthcare needs without providing useful services that are worth a fraction if what they charge. Shocking.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: What a waste!
text:
Why do I still need to log in on a desktop to view my EOBs? These should be easily accessible on the app. I can't even view all of my benefits on here. All it shows my are my deductible and out of pocket max. Doesn't even say if the policy is based on a calendar year!
As others have mentioned, it's very slow and bulky. An app of this nature should be simple. I shouldn't have to go through four menus to find what I'm looking for. This is not for someone trying to take charge of his/her health!
I'm giving it that extra star because it gives you a minimal overview of your claims and that sometimes comes in handy.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Do trust the review! This is bad!
text: I don't normally write reviews for app, but I really need to write something for this one. Oh boy, where should I start, first of all, the UI is probably the worst I've seen in ages, did some dude developed this from their parents garage? I thought you are billion dollar company?! Hire a good company if you don't have a IT team, seriously! My company just switched from United Healthcare to you, the app experience is day and night, I wish they could switch back just for the app alone. The second issue is the speed, third is the options, fourth is the content...the list goes on and on. A solid one star or none-star if there is an option for that.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Overall Great Tool but No Paste Ability
text:
Overall the Aetna App is a great tea resource. It does a great job showing recent claims and claim detail, provides links to pay via Money^2, and provides excellent information about your plan, i.e., deductible met, coinsurance met, add'l benefits used and available, and procedure estimates.

Now to the reason I only gave it three stars...convenience. The login screen does not allow pasting so you can't use randomly generated passwords from vaults like Lastpass, it has no passbook integration for the health insurance card, and doesn't utilize Apples Touch ID.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Nice app
text: Good to quickly check claims etc. on the go. I find the website somewhat easier to access, but from the phone the app is more convenient. It would be good to be able to quickly see your total annual deductible met so far and remaining coinsurance responsibility to meet annual limits - also if they showed a summary table showing just the totals for year to date services and claims etc on a single screen that would be very helpful- but overall it is a useful app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless
text: The app is more annoying than ever! It has well designed links to useful information about your health insurance policy. When you click on one, the circle thing will spin forever until you close the app, restart it, and try again. If you don't see the circles, the other new feature is a pleasant error message blaming you for a bad network connection even though you know for sure that your network connection is fine. Don't bother logging on to the website. It doesn't work either. Hopefully the customer service people are nice on the phone because that's the only way you can get any info.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Error Message
text:
In search of a chiropractor that actually takes Aetna I called into the phone system. Unsuccessful. I then talked to a customer service rep. who emailed me a supposed list. I tried opening the attached form. Wait for it... Unsuccessful. I thought finally, all hail the technology of an app. I have tried to login to the system. I had to form a new name, create a password and then complete the levels of security steps and tried to finally log in. I received an error message. I went back through all the steps only to receive an entirely different error message. The big reveal... Unsuccessful. 

I am disgracing the #1 by giving this App 1 Star. Sorry #1. Sorry.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Member Payment Estimator Not Mobile Friendly
text: App is great for locating a doctor in your network, as well as a great tool for reviewing claims. However, the Member Payment Estimator is not mobile friendly. Great concept, however when trying to scroll down to select the type of testing/procedure (after selecting specialist/doctor type) the user is limited on viewable and selectable items. A user can't fully scroll down the list. The mobile screen isn't long enough and the screen retracts back to the top of the list.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Suggestions
text:
I'm relatively new to this app, but I can already tell it lacks significant functionality.  With regard to the ID card, in particular, you should consider the following improvements: (1) allow user to send ID card via email or fax to provider via the app; (2) allow user to save the ID card to the iOS "wallet"; (3) allow the user to print the card when connected to an AirPrint printer. 
I'm sure others have suggested numerous other improvements, as the app currently feels very basic.  Hopefully, you'll take these into consideration when releasing the next update.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Junk
text: Like everyone else, Aetna pushed me to download as they're trying to move away from physical ID cards. Some concerns, as doctors offices often make a photocopy of the card, but I guess they can photocopy my phone. Install the app, and the first setup goes fine. The first time I log in at a doctors office, the app won't let me in. Try to change my password through the app: not happening. End up having to have the doctors office call Aetna for my info. An hour later, picking up a prescription, same deal. App is deleted, physical card is ordered. I would try it again if Touch ID and passbook were added. The app is completely useless as is.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not impressed
text:
I just received notice that Aetna isn't sending out ID cards this year. So I got the app. Unlike other reviewers, I was able to log in with my credentials. The ID cards were available, but they display very small and cannot be either turned landscape or expanded to view larger. I've had access to other insurance cards on my mobile phone that display full size in landscape format. It would seem that Aetna could do at least that much. 

Have not tried other features at this time.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Basic App
text: The app is pretty basic with very few functions with the exception of looking up healthcare providers, reviewing claims, or contacting Aetna. The functions this app does include work well and without any glitches that I've found. I am disappointed to see there is no area for Billing management to find your next bill date, amount due, or pay bill online via the app options and feel these are pretty vital functions. This app is lacking a lot, but the limited options it does have works well.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It's Good. Quick and Easy.
text: I just recently had my wallet stolen from me. So I am having my cards replaced. HOWEVER, I do find it very inconvienant that Aetna no longer hands out dental cards. Instead, you gotta print them out yourself or us the number on the back if the card. So annoying. However this app. Is good, quick and easy to use. Had no problems with it. Yet, anyways. So I'm giving it a 5 star rating.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Easy to use
text: This app is a great way for me to track medical claims, my deductible and allows me to see how much I will have to pay out of pocket long before the bill arrives. I'm able to easily managed my families insurance. Since medical information is highly protected, of course it requires you to type in your password, which only takes an extra two seconds.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great idea, needs some help
text: I honestly have no big issues with this app. I can access my info that is needed and everything is here. The current update added a very great feature. With that being said, it is a mobile app and this new feature of the payment estimator is not mobile friendly. You can not scroll through the list ms click an item. Once this is fixed I will really have no complaints.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great app and figured out the Doctor finder only problem
text: Great app with all of the information that they promised.  At first I had the find doctors only button.  I went to the Aetna website, logged in and agreed to their new terms and updated my information as requested when i logged in.  When I then opened the app on my phone, bingo, everything was there.  Hope this helps

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Omg! So loving it!!!
text: Love seeing my claims! My husband son and I have lots of appointments so I can keep track of what's being billed and what we've paid. With a baby on the way its very helpful. Will be using this alot! If I don't have my card, no problem! Got the info right here:) I didn't have any issues with this program. I just downloaded it and entered my log in and got what I expected. I'm so excited! Thanks!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Disappointing
text: The only feature that works is Doc Find. I've been a member of Aetna Navigator for years so I know the problem isn't because I'm not registered. I downloaded the app directly on my iPhone 4 and then again through iTunes, and neither worked (and I did delete the app from my phone and rebooted it before each installation). The "contact us" function also didn't work for me - I just get a blank page for each option. I've deleted this app for now because I couldn't find an app support page to troubleshoot the problem. It's a great idea, I'm disappointed that it didn't work on my phone.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It works
text: The majority of reviews I read slammed this app, saying among other things that the app won't display their insurance card, and they complained that the company won't send them an ID card for their wallet. I disagree with both of those things; the app easily displayed the card, and the company provided me with a plastic ID card to go in my wallet. So far, everything in the app has worked for me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Rx
text: Why no ability to order prescriptions on this app? What's the use if not for that especially for those who regularly order preventative meds? Like insulin and test strips? One must access the full website on the Internet to refill. Very inconvenient. By the way, I had to visit the ER for asthma/ bronchitis. I showed them my insurance card from the app because I didnt have the physical ID with me. They wouldn't accept it because of inability to xerox it. I had to rush to the nearest kinkos to make a copy for them. We should have ability to email it or send to their fax from the app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Making progress!
text:
I checked yesterday and I still only saw "Find a Doctor".  Checked again today and voilÃ , I can see everything!  This is w/ out a posted update.  I didn't do anything differently today than I've been doing for the past month.  Must've been a server issue and not an app issue.

Anyway, I was a very vocal critic of this app but my opinion is definitely changing for the better.  It's almost great.  Just fix the crashes and I'll gladly bump my rating up to 5 stars.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Slow. Errors. Limited
text: I just downloaded this app. I had great expectations for it. I was able to get to the claims section without any difficulty although it was generally slow. Then I tried to look up providers and at first received numerous error messages followed by a very slow response which timed out, followed by correct choices being given but then ultimately timing out with more error messages. I think this app meets need some work, serious work.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works for me!
text: This works great! I loaded it and logged right in to see claims pending and complete. Not sure why others needed to give a plan number every time since I didn't have to even the first time. Maybe a bug was fixed.  As someone who has had to use health insurance all too often this will be great to use from bed when I can't get up. Love it!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Poorly designed
text: This app is poorly designed. Search results for local specialists keep showing me 1) urgent care facilities 2) specialists in states 2000 miles away. Also, the reviews posted on the app for doctors and specialists are partial reviews. To get the full reviews you have to hit the link for another doctor-rating website. Once you get to that site you have to search around for that doctor, which isn't always easy to search for -- why wouldn't it link you directly to the review?  I don't think this app was tested at all-- it's the app equivalent of Craigslist.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Agree with everyone else
text: I don't have the same password issue's but I agree they should fix that for the majority of people posting a rating. I can almost forgive the incredibly bare bones interface and functionality except that it only works for about 5 minutes. After that. everything I click on says sorry, we can't do that right now. Take the profits from just ONE customer and pay some kid fresh out of school to make a new app, one that actually works. We know you can afford it and you're just lazy and/or don't care about your customers.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible
text:
This app forces me to do a "mandatory update" every time I open it. I go to the App Store and it's already updated. It basically only lets me log in when I access it through the "open" button on its App Store listing. 

Also, it doesn't remember my user name, it doesn't have Touch ID, my plan information is not up to date, and it doesn't allow me to send or receive messages. It also loads incredibly slow.

Aetna's website and support is also awful, so this app is consistent with the low quality and bad service we can all expect from Aetna.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Updated App! THANK YOU!
text: Thank you so much for bringing the app up to date with modern app standards. The retina support, Touch ID, Apple Wallet, and offline card support is incredible. The new design is great and the app functions perfectly. Not sure what everyone else is complaining about. This is the update I've been waiting for!! Thank you for listening to us Aetna! :)

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't help Aetna Better Health Members; has bugs and is slow
text: It's very deceiving. But if you have any of the Aetna Better Health Plans, this does not help you. It's a shame since the Customer Service is also quite awful and I was hoping for some redeeming technological advantage with Aetna. They don't even let you email customer service with Aetna Better Health and their site has issues when finding providers. If you are on the commercial side, this may help but it has issues with things like the provider searches and displaying ID cards. I do NOT recommend this app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: No paste?
text:
â€œWe have a new ratingâ€� is your changelog for the current version? Understandable you want to get away from your terrible rating before, but doing so without fixing the problems called out shows a lot of chutzpah.

My previous review, which still applies:

How about letting us paste passwords so those of us who keep long unique passwords per site can actually use the app? Or even better, add paste support and support for password managers like 1password which has an app extension available.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worked fine after web set up
text: I set up my new account online 1st then downloaded the app and accessed it with the credentials I created online. I did this based on the high % of negative reviews and read most of the problems seemed to with account creation and log in ( I assumed directly from the app ).  I like the fact both medical and dental cards are available here in the app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works fine for me
text: I think this app is fairly decent.  I can access my PHR, find a doctor, see a list of all my doctor visits, see my husband's info for prescriptions, etc. It works just as well as the website.  I gave it only four stars because I am still annoyed that you must log in to your account, yet Docfind can't recognize what type of insurance plan you have.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Better but still not good
text:
The new revision to the app is an improvement for signing on. While other apps are using a Pin or your thumbprint, Aetna has been far behind and has finally caught up. 

After that, I find the new configuration difficult to understand much less find a provider. The previous version was much better for that. So for now I will use another program to locate providers and keep checking back on this one. Such a shame.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Confusing
text: This is a confusing interface.  It did not help me find my doctors practice which does accept this insurance but the most worrisome part is when I told it to find a hospital near me it was sending me to several that were an hour away before it hit the 12th hospital which is 2.83 miles away. The urgent care centers are also listed in some type of odd order. If I need to go to the hospital or urgent care it would be nice if they were ordered so that the closest one was first.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not worth it
text: I literally just downloaded the apps. I like to have everything on the go. The app is functional to an extent but it's clunky and needs an update. I have an iPhone 6 and it looks like the app was stretched to fit the screen. It's good for light use (check claims, view your card). I tried using the Find a Doctor or Facility tab, it's not too bad it's just not a clean appearance. It looks and feels like a start up which shouldn't be the case for such a large well known company.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: ğŸ˜’ You call this an update?ğŸ‘¿ğŸ‘‹
text: This latest so-called "update" is PAINSTAKINGLY slow & buggy. Also, the anticipated new "sort by price" ability falls completely short of its intended purpose; the app for some reason only limits the provider results to just 10, with no option to expand the list to see more. So, you're only left with a comparison of 10 providers, which is definitely not how the web version works nor the previous version. You'll lose your mind toggling with this piece of crap app. We expect better, Aetna! ğŸ˜‘

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless.  I can't even log in.
text: This app is worthless to me, simply because I value my privacy and security enough to use a password management tool.  The app won't allow me to paste my password on the login screen, so the only way to log in is to use a short, simple password that I can remember easily and type in manually every time.  In other words, Aetna requires users of this app to secure their private medical information with a password that hackers can instantly crack.  No thanks, Aetna.  I am not foolish enough to use your stupid app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: VERY EASY! Just remember your info!
text:
Log in first via computer if you have never before. Create username/password, then follow prompts. Log out, then back in to make sure. Then the App is good to go....

Also, if you jail broke your phone, haven't updated it, backed it up via iTunes, then that's most like your problem.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Keep trying, but you've got a ways to go, Aetna
text: This app continues to be typical large-healthcare-co low-reliability junk. After every update, I try it again, and end up deleting it. This time, there was a false promise of easy login with Touch ID. Works the first time, and not thereafter. Did anyone happen to test that? Also, false promise of keeping card in Apple Wallet. But no, just a subset of the card info, not the whole card. Clearly the app was designed and updated by people who are not very comfortable with digital technology.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works 1% of the time
text:
How have they not released a functional update after all the negative reviews? I have an iPhone 5 so I can not attest to everyone's complaints about not working on the 6/6+. I can tell you it doesn't work on the 5 as well though. 

I type in the CORRECT password and it says my credentials are invalid. I take the same password to my desktop computer on the Aetna website and lo and behold, it allows me to log in. Completely worthless app, thankful my work is changing insurances so I can delete this one now

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awful App
text: Once again I'm amazed at the complete lack of understanding by corporate IT software engineers. How can you develop an app these days and not provide the option to paste your password??? Obviously Aetna doesn't consider the user and how they interact with their app and the use of password managers before they launch it. Shame on you. This app gets rated 0 stars because of this issue. Until they fix this basic issue don't waste your time downloading this app unless of course you don't care about password security.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Love the App
text: Not sure why there are so many negative comments. It works great. I need to look up my FSA reimbursements frequently and it's so easily done here. No freezing or anything. I read in another review you had to first log in online, maybe that's why there are so many issues.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs a few tweaks for convenience
text: I like the app EXCEPT for the fact that I have to login every time I use it. At least give us a remember user ID option. And I agree with the others who said it is pointless to have to enter your plan info on the doctor search. You can pull my claim history, but you can't pull my plan info?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It's not a bad app if u log on correctly
text:
I kept reading that all u could do was find a doc, which is what I got at first as well.
However once I logged onto the Aetna web site and performed my annual "info verification" I was able to log back into the App and access everything.  Claims, prescription finder, medical card info, find a dr.  It's actually pretty nice.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Clunky and slow
text: First off, the graphics are terrible and outdated on the iPhone 6+. Second, the app is extremely slow - just logging in took over 1 minute on WiFi. Lastly, the latest update says it includes a "payment estimator" for future services. Now I spent over 30 minutes exploring this counter-intuitive app and could not find anything remotely resembling a payment estimator. For the amount of money I'm paying Aetna every month, you'd think they could provide me with a better app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works for me!
text: Just downloaded the app today. All of the features are working with the correct information. I really like the temporary ID card - handy if you are out- of- town w/out your card. Also like the availability of personal prescriptions and dosages - no need to write that down when seeing a doc for the first time. Pretty good medical app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Confusing setup, can't update health data
text:
When you use the app for the first time you can only see find a doc. Needs instruction to confirm data on the Aetna web site which unlocks other features. 

Key feature missing is ability to track your health statistics such as weight, exercise, etc. Please add this !!!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Appears Functional
text: I was able to log in and view my Coverage Card.  It would be nice if the Card could be saved to Passbook, so it could be accessed quickly without having to log in.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't get the foundation right
text:
At a minimum, it needs to allow pasting of passwords—otherwise, I cannot use a long random password that's actually secure. Even better would be integrating with 1Password's API.

Also, it immediately asks for "location access, even when not using the app". Absolutely not. Aetna is an *insurance company*, after all. If they don't want to stealthily track my movements in the background, they should only ask for permission "while the app is in the foreground" and prove it to me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: seems ok to me
text: despite the low rating, i downloaded this app and it seems to work just fine. no trouble viewing recent claims (main reason i wanted it) or using the other features (did not try to make a call or otherwise use 'contact us'). i'm on an iphone 4 (not yet upgraded to iOS 5).

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Wow. Totally useless.
text: Doesn't show your account information, only Doc Find.  Other reviews suggest that this happens if you have multiple accounts (or have had Aetna with previous employers). Like another reviewer said, did they even test this? Time to delete.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great Useful Tool!
text:
This app is perfect for helping me quickly access my insurance info. It has a cool way to view my ID card and works like a charm!

Any of the issues people are having seem to just be flukes, as I have had a great experience with it.  I recommend this for all Aetna users.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Good app
text: I almost didn't get this app because of all the bad reviews. I'm glad I downloaded it anyway. It's very basic but works well. I only encountered 1 error and that was a loss of network coverage. Tried my sign in info again and had no more trouble. Easy to navigate and very handy. It's not like being on a computer but helpful on the go and instant insurance cards!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It works, but not pretty
text:
Had no issues getting the app loaded and my account registered. Took less then 5 minutes. My account information was correct and accessible.  Let's see how it works once I have some claims. 

Not the best looking app for sure. Very simplistic, but straight forward.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: NO PROBLEMS
text: I have no problems with this app. The Aetna website specifically says if you're having issues then you need to update your Aetna profile. There is a link in the 'learn more' section on the login screen then after you pick a device, it's at the bottom. Hope this helps.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Functionally, it works
text: After reading the reviews here, I was shocked to find it functionally sound. My only complaint thus far is the aesthetic of the app. Sheesh. It is ugly to look at. I agree with the other comments regarding the apparent abandonment of this app by Aetna. After using the MyCigna app last year, this was definitely a step down.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Unreliable and slow
text: Doesn't work at all after latest update, times out. Even before the latest update, it took several minutes to load, which I wouldn't mind if it actually loaded every time. The problem is it doesn't load at all 50% of the time. For a healthcare app it doesn't inspire any confidence. If banks can do it Aetna can do, I just don't get why they can't have a reliable app that works.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Super app
text: This app was invaluable while on vacation out of state.  Was able to find urgent care and hospitals within seconds including the closest ones.  Made a huge difference in the health and well being of my family on vacation.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Pharmacy options don't work!
text: I've been a long time Aetna member and use their website to order Rx's (which I would rate 3 stars) and thought I'd try this mobile version. I was able to sign in okay, but when I clicked on the links to refill a Rx and track an order I got a message that said "The URL was not found on the server." I tried the other three menu options for Pharmacy and got the same message. I was able to access my dental plan information.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible application
text: I am new to Aetna and was very excited to see an application that would contain all the information I needed. Unfortunately, I have been unable to register because it will not accept my password notwithstanding that the password is consistent with their instructions as to format. Further, there is no evidence of any way to contact anyone to try to figure out how to make it work. If I could've given this app zero stars I would have. They should be embarrassed.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: C'mon man!
text: You people with all the negative reviews have not done your homework. The app works fine, you have to login on your pc/mac first and then all of the functionality works on the phone. Besides, it's not like you will use it everyday. It works fine.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: UPDATE WORKED!!!
text: Thanks Aetna,  the update you provided has allowed me access to what the description says i should be accessing.  I was going to give it a 2 star when it first came out, but i knew you guys would provide an update that would allow it to work.  IT IS GREAT!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Could use some work
text: I did not have any problems downloading this app or signing in. You might have to register online first for easier login on the mobile app. I was able to look at my card and Claims. The only issue I saw was the most current prescriptions for my son were not available for viewing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Good mobile app
text: App works as advertised. I only wish the member card looked like the real card with all the dependents listed. Like being able to log in and search only for physicians and UC centers that are in my company's plan. This is a problem with the website as well, but what is the point of having to select a health plan when logged in?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Much improved version
text:
I really appreciate Aetna for the new improvements in the app. Touch ID, wallet, offline ID cards, these are some of the much needed features. I hope Aetna will add some fitness & virtual doctor type feature in this.
Keep doing the good work!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Much better! Way easier to log in
text: The look and feel is much better. Happy to have the ID card in Apple wallet because I forget it all the time. Worked well for me but transplant review wins for most entertaining review.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Is there a cure for this app?
text: You would think a company that charges so much for insurance might have some cash to invest in a decent app. Apparently not. 2 stars because I can actually log in and view my ID card but other than that, search functionality is useless, no EOBs, no clear description of plan benefits. Stick to the full website, which itself leaves a lot to be desired.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worst Healthcare App I've ever used
text:
There are a lot of bad experiences out there within US healthcare. This is one of them. The Aetna app constantly shows a loading / waiting prompt in the middle of the screen and at the bottom of the screen. 

The developers of this Aetna app haven't kept up with iOS standards so the app appears off centered on my iPhone 6S with iOS 9.3.2.

Searching for Dentists consistently doesn't work on multiple devices for me. 

Basically this application that Aetna has provided is useless because it is unusable and provides an inconsistent and unreliable experience. One is better served calling or using the website to actually get anything done. 

Aetna, you may as well remove this from the App Store until you have something that works.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: What a joke
text: The app works great once you download it, and sign in for the first time. The if you open it again, once you've signed in, with either pin or thumb scan, an you click the "manage leave/disability" button, you get a  "We're sorry, we can't complete your request. Please try again letter". This error will not go away unless you delete the app and reinstall it. Your online app is more dependable. This app is a waste of time

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Expected better...
text:
I've read other reviews on here regarding not being able to open the app and it not loading... Wasn't the case for me.

I guess I would have expected a better interface as the app UI is very whatever. Also, would have been cool to add your insurance card to apple wallet which they didn't include. 

For a multi-billion dollar company they could have done much better.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great Improvement
text: Concerned about previous reviews, but tested out most functions and they work like I would expect them to. Needed my temp card for doctor visit right after I enrolled, no problem. Glad it's fixed.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Provider Search Hangs Endlessly
text:
I Login, click on "Find a Provider or Facility", doesn't even come up with search parameters, wheel just spins infinitely, gave up after 5-10 minutes with nothing, draining my battery. Killed app, tried several times. Terrible. Was it tested??? 

I don't have time to search for providers at work or at home; during commute time would be perfect, whole point of a mobile app, too bad idoesn't work. It used to, what happened?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs to save login
text: This app makes it convenient to find a doctor while I'm on the move. However, for me to do that, I constantly have to look up my login information, which I usually don't carry around with me. Can you please add a feature to save login names and passwords? It would make for a much smoother experience.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Why log in to find a doctor?
text:
This app is essentially pointless as it works for me.  Only option offered in main menu is "find a doctor" which I'll use once in a blue moon.

Also - if I've logged in - why make me fill out my plan # and other info?  You should already have that on file and I certainly don't want to type that in every time.

Suspect there's just a bug that needs fixing, but this is a biggie and lots of people seem affected.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs a lot of improvement
text: I have the app on my phone and iPad. It does not adjust and size like it says it will. It usually starts with saying no information available and then it let you login and like it says it has no information available. I am new to Atnah and I thought it would be like logging into the Aetna navigator. Why isn't there a navigator app? When I logged in for support they can get anyway to talk to the app. Please fix it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Easy to use
text: This app has been very helpful to view nearby medical & dental offices that accept my coverage. Only sometimes login can be confusing as I often have to change/reset my password since it doesn't recognize current .

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needed to Gina's an urgent care...
text: I found one online but feel crappy so was having a hard time getting the address to my phone (don't judge) so used the app, logged in and it zipped the address to google maps and I was good to go.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Need an update
text:
Unable to login. It doesn't recognize the user id and/or password. I know it's correct cause I'm able to login with the same info on the computer.
Once login issue is fix need to update with the ability to email ID card and the the option to select individual names

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Much improved
text: All the old complaints from the last app version have been addressed. You can now login with Apple ID, you can see you clams, and out of pocket max/deductible for the year. Also the app in general is much faster and more user friendly.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Decent start, needs some modern day updates
text:
Mobile app, is not horrible, but needs some updates
- Overall user experience needs work. Navigation system is very rudimentary 
- Performance, even over wifi, is very slow
- Lacks Touch ID (thumbprint) login capability
