- Member Card access should integrate with Apple Wallet

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Finally
text: Was easily able to look up how much an alternative drug option would cost me without waiting for hours on the phone. Haven't tried to use it for anything else, but for this purpose it's effective.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: 0 stars
text: I downloaded this app so I could submit documents for my leave from work due to oral surgery. It fails the upload every time. I have tried taking direct pics, uploading saved pics, reinstalling app, tried on wifi and data, cleared cache, restarted my phone, et cetera, thinking maybe it was my phone and not the app. Nothing works!! Waste of time. Why have features on an app that don't work?? Worst app experience I have ever had.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works fine!
text: This app works GREAT, not sure what other users had issues with. I logged on on my computer first, then logged on here and was able to view claims, status, deductibles and everything. I LOVE it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Always errors out. Do not update.
text: I updated to this version in hopes to gain a better experience, but every time i log in i get a "999" error that "something went wrong". Deleting and redownloading did not help. Contacting customer support did not help as they said "try again later". Please release a functioning app. This app does not give me confidence is the ole "private companies can provide better solutions then government ones" mantra.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awesome
text: Worked terrific. Was fast too. Then again I have good service, a good phone, and good wifi. Don't buy bootleg phones, and either move outta deliverance country or use decent wifi, before whining about an app. It's rating is skewed by buffoons.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works and looks good
text: It works for me and looks and functions better than old version! I like the mobile location based find care,  swipe, touch ID and PIN features.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Easy lookup of claims and providers
text: I also like having my member ID numbers available (dental and medical). Now I don't need to carry mine or my children's in my wallet. I just have to remember my login info. The PHR was not available for me. Either I need to set that up or my plan doesn't support it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Will be a Great App
text: As I am the first to write a review, I am guessing this is a brand new app.  There are some kinks to iron out, such as slowness and buttons not responding until after a few punches, but overall it is a pretty good app on its ways to being a great app once the glitches get fixed.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: User friendly. Easy to general account information
text: This app is a handy and easy to use tool when I need to obtain current EOB, deductible, and coinsurance information for medical and dental accounts. HSA feature is nice too.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: This app is useful for tracking baby claime
text:
If you are going to have a baby, this app is super useful, to track the claims. For example, track the California disability claim.

 Otherwise, this app is useless, because it shows no info on normal Doctor visit data.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Any rating over 3 is fake.
text: The app is painfully slow, it's not iOS native, and most recently doesn't work. I log in, agree to terms and services, and then am told it doesn't recognize my user name and password. I reset my password minuets before hand to be sure I remembered it correctly. Goes to show insurance is about money, Aetna has enough from me alone to hire decent programmers. This app looks like it was completed by high school interns.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Please allow me to paste my password
text:
Awful decision removing the ability to paste passwords. I use long generated passwords and it is very frustrating needing to toggle back and forth to enter my password. My bank and 401k apps do not have this restriction... they also have two-factor authorization.

The description of the changes: "we have a new rating" led me to look at previous ratings. Only then did the description make sense.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Can't log in
text: We are new to Aetna and I had high hopes when I saw there was a mobile app. The mobile website along with the app will not let me log in. I have logged in on my laptop with no issue. I am also in awe with the other reviewers about not being able to paste my password. My software developer husband will have a great laugh when I tell him about our new health insurance company's mobile app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Manager-Projects
text: Aetna mobile app made so easy searching find a doc. Great Job! everyone for the new version...that made user friendly search. Hoping to see more new functionalities added.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Exactly what I wanted...
text: I do not understand the negative review comments. I just actioned all the options offered via this app, and it is quite comparable to the standard online version. I am satisfied & I recommend it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great app
text: This is a good app, everything seems to work.I don't understand why people are complaining about not being able to paste there password. Are u that lazy? That's a lame excuse to give a bad review.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Good app - no problems
text: After reading many negative reviews I was hesitant about downloading the app but I'm glad I did because I was able to login quickly without any problems, check for providers & review my claim history.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Aetna mobile
text: This is great!!! I love the quick options, I have absolutely no problems either- if your having issues maybe it's your carrier, device or wifi... Just sayin!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works fine
text: For those of you having issues you must first log on using a computer first to verify your info then you should be able to use the app as advertised

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs some tweaks
text:
As an Aetna employee, I can say this makes things a bit easier, but it still needs improvement.

I'm sure it's privacy concerns that's prohibiting it, but it needs to have a saved login. I don't know about you, but I don't leave my iPhone laying around. 

The whole app, not just I'D cards needs to be tilt sensitive.

They should also build in access for
us to check our HSA balance, just like you can on the Aetna Navigator.

It's good, but it's only the first cut at it. Hopefully they make it a full replacement for the site.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works fine for me as of today
text: Works fine for me as of today. I just downloaded the app in spite of the reviews. Could access my ID and everything.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Wicked!!!
text: Truly a great App.  I just upload today and the screens I have viewed are truly amazing.  I am currently at the doctor's office and the ID card view is awesome my wife cannot wait to upload this app on her phone.  Great job Aetna!!!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Winner of the worst application ever.
text: Have you managed to find the worst application on the App Store? Well think twice, this one is worst than that one you thought first: if you try to find an urgent care and are REALLY on an emergency, it's easier to die than to find the right urgent care through this application. Definitely giving this app one star is giving it more than it deserves. Worst insurance application ever.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Ridiculous-No Paste function
text:
Aetna is encouraging weak passwords by not allowing the ability to paste. Password managers, such as 1Password, can generate long complex passwords. But w/o the ability to paste some people will just opt for a simple password they can remember.

It looks like they just "updated" app to restart the star rating. 

Just fix the ability to paste the password and/or enable Touch ID. We can live with the UI from 2008.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Rudimentary
text: For a large health insurer, Aetna has not invested much in this app. Not only are you forced to re-enter your user name and password every time, you only have access to the most basic info such as provider lists and your claims. No geo mapping, no wellness/prevention info, no push notifications to get an annual checkup, just a lost opportunity to take your company from good to great.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: No issues so far
text: The app hasn't given me any issues so far. Shows my ID card and enables me to search just fine. I gave it only 4 stars because it is very basic in its interface. Nothing special. But gets the job done.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Love it!
text: It's everything I see when I log into Aetna on the computer. Will save me time when I'm insisting I've met my deductible at the check out desk. Can show them right from my phone.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: We Were All Gonna Die Eventually Anyway
text:
It's pretty haunting to download this app. That's right, the same people who built this clunky, bug-ridden, unusable app make health care decisions for millions of people every day. 

I could definitely foresee a scenario where I need an organ (let's be honest, it'll probably be a liver) and don't get it bc Aetna's organ delivery app crashes on the driver. Aetna should be ashamed of themselves for ever taking this app live.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Brings Up Wrong InformationğŸ™�ğŸ‘�ğŸ�»
text: After the latest app update, when trying to refill a prescription, it displays my husbands Rxs instead of mine.  I tried twice to report this bug from the app and both times it failed.  The first time it said "Unauthorized", the second time it said my request couldn't be completed. I used to love this app but after this update I'd rate it 0 stars.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worked just fine
text: Just downloaded and logged in using the same login I use online.  Don't know what those who had such problems were doing but it worked just fine for me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Just ok
text:
Does some things ok but e major drawback is you have to log in every time you open the app. 

My phone is mine, it already has a password just to get in. Apps need to have the option to save login info and automatically log in when you open the app or they are cumbersome. I for one choose not to use apps like that.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: It works
text: For those who wrote it doesn't work, you must register on Aetna Navigator web page and have an Aetna medical plan.  I was able to view my past claims, find a doc, etc.  Great App!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs a scroll
text: Overall decent but when viewing letters or images it's almost impossible to scroll he image. Additional options are needed for those items as well like; print- forward- mark up; etc...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Amazing Update!
text: This app finally gets a makeover and its well worth the wait. I had a smooth login, was able to add the card to the Wallet and find providers.  Very Intuitive and modern design. Good going Aetna.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: I like where this is going...
text:
Super happy so far with the update. It makes the whole app feel cleaner/more organized and straightforward to navigate. 

I enabled Touch ID and have had no issues with that so far! 

I am also happy that I will now be able to see my 'health history' finally. 

In the future it would be great to add the ability to refill perceptions! Also the app appears to be a little slow, or lagging. I am sure with time and updates this will be fixed!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Okay but could be better
text: I like the fact that you can see the claim status very easily.  However, why can't I see my pharmacy orders?  I have to use the regular computer to check prescription status - wish they would add that feature on.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: New design rocks
text: Love the new layout. Easy to navigate to what's important for me. Light years from the old design and much easier to use with Touch ID vs passwords that I always forgot.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Better Experience
text: Better experience then previous version. Nice to have ID card always with me on my phone!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: No excuse for this piece of crap app!
text: Hard to believe that the OLD app from last year DID MORE than this one and it was a piece a crap! This one is almost totally useless. Can't get to my card info, can't get to aetna pharmacy, can't get to anything I could actually use AND for doing nothing it's hard to navigate!! Who did they PAY to make this? I could make something better in an hour!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Slow and painful
text: You start out by entering your Aetna user/pass; you can't do anything until that is entered. Then try a doctor search. Every menu is sent from the server while you wait. There's one menu with roughly 70 choices to select your medical plan - don't they already know that?  Not very user friendly.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Good for basic use
text: Good for what I use it for, the basics like looking up claims. The one tic is the required log in every single time. Accidentally close the app and need to get back in? Gotta re-log in. Every time. Eh, minor inconvenience, fairly satisfied overall.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Same as website
text: Pretty much the same ease of access and info you can get on the website. Only difference is being able to find doctors with gps.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Endless circles
text:
It won't let you log in after creating an account..
Then you call the member line and it refers you back to the site that doesn't work. How cute.
 Nice job Aetna. I'll be switching back to my other provider ASAP. Thanks for nothing and great start with a new customer. I'll be sure to let everyone else know how terrible your site and service are so they can avoid the headache.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Can't paste password
text:
I have a complex password in a password keeper app. I can neither paste my password nor refer back to it to enter it manually since navigating away from the login screen blanks the password when you start typing more. And no fingerprint logon either. 

I would accept just being able to paste. This is ridiculous. If I can't logon then the app is unusable.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Completely poor app
text: Not only does this app lack Touch ID, you can't paste your password into the app. No way that I will sit here and type in my fairly complex password one character at a time. I use a password manager in a desktop browser but this app doesn't work with it even with manually pasting in the password. Worthless app. Hire an app developer that knows what they are doing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Helpful
text: This app performs as I expected and need it to. I can search for and see claims, find providers, etc. everything I would do on the web.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Spectacularly bad
text: Though clearly not abandoned, Aetna clearly has this app on very limited life support. It looks bad, barely functions, and provides very poor performance. It has the most limited amount of functionality necessary to stay in the App Store, but this is clearly an app that Apple should remove for not being maintained properly. Use it if necessary but it will be horribly disappointing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Feedback on Mobile App
text: User friendly app that is easy to navigate.  Useful features that are helpful to a member.  Great design and functionality.  Love it a lot.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works well for what I need
text: In spite of a couple of negative reviews, I find that the app provides the information I need, and is quick, and easy to navigate. UI is not as important as core functionality.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Slow interface and slow info retrieval
text: For such a large company, this is a really poor application with little thought about how its users would ACTUALLY use this app. Login takes over a minute (TouchID would be a huge improvement). Browsing is non-touch intuitive. Needs a huge re-vamp. Should use the company that made their "Shape-up" application.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: No auto-login
text: This app is just a wrapper around the mobile website. Bookmarking the Aetna website in Safari accomplishes the same thing as using this app. Using Safari is better in fact because then you can at least have Safari autofill your saved password. This app makes me log in every time with no "remember me" capability. This app adds no value.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Virtual ID Card's About The Only Use
text:
Login takes abnormally long to complete.
I get "An application error occurred" if I try to bring up my "Personal Health Record."
I can't view any health claims and I can't order refills on any of my Aetna Pharmacy prescriptions.
On the whole, a rather useless app.  Guess I'll keep it in case I forget to bring my ID card! ...until I need more space on my iPad for the next version of Temple Run...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Fabulous
text: I don't understand all of the negative reviews. This is exactly what I need. It gives an abundance of information that I would normally take me forever to gather. Thank you Aetna!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Claims not shown
text: From the mobile app I cannot view my claims. I know there are at least 2 and my deductible reflects the claims that have been processed, and does match the full site for accuracy but the claims are not shown. Not past or present. Not very useful when I can't see where my accumulations came from

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doctor search is broken
text:
Doing a search for "all PCPs" with the "Family Practice"filter on gives me zero results,even though the count beside the Family Practice option shows over 1600 hits. 

Tried different filters, even increasing areas of search. I am positive that there is at least one Family Practice PCP within a 50 mile radius of Houston, Tx. 

Basic functionalities guys.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Love it
text: Not sure why people can't log in, I did it the first time.  Great way to view claims, look at history, and even insurance card.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works perfectly Fine
text: App works great on my IPhone 4S I search Claims urgent care and even look at my insurance cards if I leave them at home

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Giving credit where it's due
text: The new Aetna app (3.0) is a substantial improvement over the old app. It looks and feels like a 2017 app. Much more usable, touchID support, so far so good!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Link for payments doesn't work
text: Error message comes up if you want to check your payments for disability. It's the only link that doesn't work so far that I noticed. Other than that it's fine.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Complete Trash
text: The mobile app is complete trash. Instead of building an actual mobile app, they just launch you into a mobile version of their website. Also, you can't search for doctors based on your own plan. You know how else I can search for doctors in my area? Google. This app is pointless. May god have mercy on the soul of whoever greenlit this trainwreck.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works as intended
text: Not sure why this is rated one star. Downloaded, entered login info, took care of business, and that's it. Worked perfectly.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: The new version is great
text: Love the cost info that is now included. I can actually price things out before seeing my doctor!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Limited
text: This app has very limited features. It would be incredibly useful to have access to pharmacy benefits like reordering prescriptions from mail order, checking the status of an order, and estimating costs (and formulary status). Without these features, this app is not super useful.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: All right but no refill prescriptions
text: The app is alright, it does find doctors and hospitals. However, I don't understand why you can be able to price a drug but you can't order medications or refills. It's kind of silly to forget about including such feature.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: searching for a doc?
text: Don't bother because this app will not help you. Trying to find a doctor in my area that accepts new patients. The only things I can find are hospitals or chiropractors. Trying to find a gynecologist? Good luck. Better search by pregnancy... not all who need a gynecologist are pregnant. Was this made by a man? Less options does not mean easier or better.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Can't paste in password field.
text:
I told them about this months ago and someone responded with a bunch of nonsense that showed they didn't even understand the problem. Do they really want us to use some easy to remember password that is easily crack able?
Why we can't use this app to replace our member ID cards with our fingerprint as a login is beyond me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Passbook Support
text: As another reviewer said, this app would be so much better with passbook support. I would love to go to my doctor's office and show them my ID card quickly and easily on my phone without signing into the app...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Nice for what it does
text: I just use this to looks up claims and it works well it should have the option of saving the user name at least if me bank app does that why not this one!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Too slow for mobile
text: This app requires a login each time and the login can take minutes or just time out. Once (if) you get it it offers many useful features but again navigation is very slow. The app could be really good but it's just too slow to be worth using on a mobile device.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Mine works fine
text: Had some issues about a month ago but works fine now.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Does not work
text: As many others have said, this app can only find a doctor for me.  The mobile website does not work for me either but I have no problem logging onto the standard Aetna website, but I do have to select between 2 plans that I have had. Maybe this app has a problem with users with multiple plans.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Decent app could be better
text: I like the app overall, but it would be extremely helpful if you could click on a bill and it would show you if it was paid or not.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Don't Bother
text: I wasted 90 minutes just trying to log on, without success.  Finally gave up and uninstalled.  All I wanted was to have my ID card for a Doctor visit.  Ended up printing a hard copy from the full website using a computer.  I expected a large insurance company handling healthcare data to have better technology than this.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless App without paste password or Touch ID
text: My password is complex and not memorized for obvious reasons. Not being able to either paste the password from a password keeper or use Touch ID to complete the login makes this app completely useless. Why make it so hard? Other personal information apps have solved this quite easily and elegantly.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible app
text: The UI on this app is really bad.  You guys really need to update it to iOS 8 because having a back button on screen is old.  Was this done by outsourcing?  It looks and feels like it's been outsourced.  And there is a beg where you try to get member payment estimation trying to select the diagnosis, you can even scroll down further than a screenful.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: A useless, broken app
text: The only reason you'd want to use an Aetna app is to check claims, and you won't be able to do it despite what this app tells you. Choose a member name or date range from the drop down menu and it obscures the screen without any way of confirming your selection or getting out of the menu. This is a horribly designed app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: This is so handy!
text: I can see claims, find a doctor! All from my app! I can even have my ID card in case I leave it in my other purse, so handy in the go.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Missing Aetna Rx home delivery
text: Would be nice to order prescriptions online, and have ability to check status of order. That'd really the only reason I use the desktop version of the site. Won't use app but will keep checking updates for this feature.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs Passbook support!
text: Although the app isn't feature-rich, it isn't that bad and is useful for viewing claims, but this app desperately needs Passbook support so health insurance cards are readily accessible.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Ugh- please fix for students!!
text: I agree with Kain below. Shouldn't have to pick the plan it should know based on the login but regardless WHERE IS THE STUDENT HEALTH PLAN OPTION?  Students are very likely to use this app but it's practically worthless since the doc find and clinic/urgent find doesn't have the option for those who are on a student health plan.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Helpful tool
text: I don't know what the complaints are about. I've experienced no problems so far and this app has been a lot of help!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: ID card available on one phone, but not the other
text: Still not working properly, even after update of July 14.  The Aetna ID card cannot be saved to the Apple Wallet using an iPhone 6 Plus, but it can be saved on our iPhone 7.  On the iPhone 6 Plus it gives a "network error" message when I try to pull up the ID card.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Easy to use but...
text: Very easy registration and user interface...would be nice to have the option to push your health insurance card to your mobile wallet or health app!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Disgraceful for a company this big
text:
Lame web-page design that has to be connected to show anything. 
Login can't use biometrics. Login can't remember anything. 
Fails to get data constantly. 
All I want us a way to access my ID card data easily so I don't have to carry the card in my wallet. This app fails to deliver even that basic need reliably.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worse than the website
text:
What is the point of an application that shows inaccurate information, will not save a password (my bank does!) and give relevant information?

Stop marketing your app until it actually behaves as one. 

This only gets a star because I could not submit this review without any stars. Total Σhit.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works Fine
text: I just signed up for AETNA. I was introduced to the mob app. Downloaded on my i4, no issue. Checked each function and worked as expected.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works but limited usefulness
text:
About all the app does is allow you to show someone a copy of your insurance card.  Several other 'features'  are either not implemented or just swap you to a web interface.

Prior to Aetna my insurance was from Group Health of Washington.  The GHC app had many more features.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awful Update
text: Completely useless now. Claims information is gone and coverage section returns an error. ID card is now just the Aetna prescription drug discount card. I sent an email in the feedback section and in typical Aetna fashion have not heard back. (Even deleted the app, shut down and restarted my phone, and then reloaded the app -- still useless!)

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Couldn't be worse
text: This is my second review ever in the App store in years however I just had to put on the record what a complete failure this App is. One has to wonder if they are even trying. For such a large company it is unexcusable. Don't download it is useless and also so poorly designed I suspect it is also likely a security risk.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Cannot paste password
text: I use LastPass to handle my passwords. I cannot paste my secure password into the entry screen. I then tried showing the password onscreen in LastPass, then typing out the intentionally forgettable ascii gibberish four characters at a time. When I returned to enter the second four characters, this app had wiped the first four I already entered in the box. Go fornicate yourselves, Aetna devs.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Lots of bugs
text: Used to be usable, the current version can not even display text correctly, for some reason it tries to show me Spanish text (I have nothing Spanish on my device), which would have been ok if it did correctly. This app needs a huge bug fix. In its current form it is not usable.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Deleted
text: I spent several days just trying to log in using the same login name and password as on their web site - never a problem on the web site, a chronic failure on this app.  I give up.  Deleted the app and think Aetna should pay attention to all the reviews here that say the same thing - their attempt at an app is a failure.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Works perfect!!!
text: It does exactly what it says. I think it is better to see my claims in this app than using the website. Great job!!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Bravo!!
text:
Now it is working. The new vesion has fixed the problem with more more one plan active. Now we can see all the options. Thanks for the Fix! 
Please add the FSA balance information.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Much needed update
text: Before, the app absolutely sucked. This is wonders now. I can actually use it. Thanks for the update guys. Keep up with the refinement

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Moronic password policy ensures your data will be stolen
text:
It is beyond stupid to require a manually enter password every time you want to use an app. Creating a TRULY SECURE password is a nonstarter here, So this app is forcing us to choose totally insecure passwords for our health information. Thanks Aetna! Thanks Obama! Idiots…
The app SHOULD save a 90 character randomly generated password, and link it to your fingerprint!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: 101 Error
text: 101 Error: We don't recognize you based on the user name and password you entered. Please enter your information again. - Despite the fact that the app still shows me successfully logged in, the desktop version of the site works fine, and the register path within the app says it already recognizes me...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App does not work
text:
Application has poor coding and server side implementation and in this era of smartphones and mobile apps, it seems implausible they would not work to improve this application which would mean more satisfied customers and more profit for the firm.  I reported it and followed up on a customer satisfaction survey for it with a poor rating.  

Aetna get your act together.  

get

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't work after update
text: I have had this app for over a year and liked it. Since the last update I can't change any of the search functions. It's stuck on medical. I can't change to dental or pharmacy. The choices are there but the screen stays on the choices instead if updating the search. :(

name: Aetna Mobile
title: You will never be able to login so don't bother downloading this app!
text: Have tried to use this app for many years now and for some reason whatever password you choose will never work. Tried it all wrote it down etc no luck. First app that wanted to make me go back to the stone ages and get something in the mail!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: None
text: Just downloaded app, and the only function I get like several other people here is the doc find. Hopefully this is only a bug issue and will be resolved with the next update to this app. If not, I WILL delete it. For the most part this is currently useless.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs one more feature...
text: I like seeing my pharmacy clams. This app doesn't allow that in the current version. Hope to see an update real soon!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App on life support
text: Despite $65B in annual revenue Aetna has decided not to invest in mobile. Much like their website this app is behind the times. Not optimized for iPhone 6, 6s or 7 screen sizes, doesn't use Touch ID. Seems like this app exists so they can box check mobile.  It's a mobile world Aetna, embrace it, hire a mobile team and update monthly, build something native.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Can't find a doc
text: No problems for me logging in as previous reviewers have mentioned but every search tried to find a doctor is coming back 'sorry no results'. Doesn't appear to have any field to enter location by zip or city as they have in the browser version. I give up!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Love Aetna Mobile!
text: Personal Health Record and Claim History right at your finger tips! Love being able to pull kids info while at the doctor's office. Great job Aetna!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Better Than Nothing At All
text:
Pros:  
Can get coverage and card information if you don't have it handy
Can find a provider while mobile
Can check on claims
Can get contact information

Cons:
It should offer the option to save the user ID. 

The type of coverage should be saved so that when you need to find a provider it doesn't require scrolling to the bottom to select. 

Map function didn't work on my device

An HD version would be nice.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: They mean it when they say search!!
text: Are you serious?!?!? You expect someone to look through 500 names? Why type in an individual name if I then have to scan through 500 of them to find that Dr? Come on Aetna! Disappointing! Great idea - just not ready for prime time!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Getting better and better
text:
I have used this app through several upgrades. It used to be a little challenging to navigate, but now it is very easy. In the past I wouldn't have recommended the app to my elderly mother because it would have just confused and frustrated her. Now I feel like I can recommend it to her and she can successfully use it.  

There are people saying that they are having problems with this version, but I am not seeing them.  I am still able to use touch ID. It just needed to be enabled in settings.  I'm not having any crashing problems. It is much easier to get through the prescription refill process.  It used to timeout when I was emailing my doctor, but it doesn't do that anymore.  I love that I now have the option to receive a text when my Rx is ready at the pharmacy. 

I love this app and the improvements. I'm looking forward to seeing what they will do next.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Need Self Reporting Ability
text:
This is a good app.  I can get my lab results as soon as they become available. I can re-order my medications quickly and easily. 

What would really be nice is the ability to self report health data like weight, BP, blood sugar levels, cholesterol levels and so on.  Iâ€™m trying to lose weight so I periodically weigh myself. Instead of some other app why canâ€™t I keep that data here?  I go to the Stanford blood bank and they compute my cholesterol level and take my BP.  Why canâ€™t I keep that data here?

The data I enter could be tagged as â€œself reportedâ€� so a medical provider would know if the data was my measurement or if it was taken by a professional. 

Providing this capability could be a plus in a patientâ€™s health care.  Imagine an overweight patient with a blood sugar and cholesterol problem. Instead of only having data points from when they see a Kaiser professional (primary physician, physicianâ€™s assistant, nurse, dietician, etc) the health provider has as much data as possible.  This could help reveal trends in health related behavior and thus better allow the provider to tailor treatment. 

Mobile computing could take health care to another level but health care providers like Kaiser are only scratching the surface.  Hopefully someone at Kaiser will see these comments and will consider the enhancements I have suggested above.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A LONG way from even an average app
text:
As a QA lead, I recognize apps that are poorly designed and implemented; this app fits that description well. Some of the major problems: exiting the app via the home button does NOT log you out, securely closing the app; going down several layers (such as looking at test results) requires the user to go back-back-back-back to a page where one can access the menus to sign-out; on my iPad 12.9, I MUST use the app in portrait because thatâ€™s the way it was coded; this app is somehow split off from other functions that should be accessible. There are many other issues needing work.

Kaiser should get someone familiar with QA and UI design to update this app. It has not had a major update since November 2016.

8/8/18- Touch ID broken on iPhone. App resets Touch ID to OFF when user signs out. iPad app works properly.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Can be convenient but needs some work
text:
Biggest complaint is how slow the app is. Always with that spinning wheel. Also the message function is not very user friendly.

One specific fix needed is for the pharmacy function. A doctor orders something for me to go to mail order and when I checked it said â€œrefilled onâ€� a certain day. Great, so Iâ€™m waiting for my prescription, it has been 2 weeks (which is not all that unusual). I called today to be told that it had never been filled. I guess there is a flaw in the app and it says refilled but what they really meant was written on that certain day. Just something small but couldnâ€™t find a way to directly report the issue without having to give out my personal information. Big companies like is often troll the web for all comments so weâ€™ll see.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Signing in is a pain - Support is worse
text:
Every time I have to reset password because the system â€œforgetsâ€�. Try resetting password thru â€œforgot password, and 7 out of 10 you canâ€™t because it wonâ€™t pull down the â€œRegion tabâ€� for you to select your region. And because you didnâ€™t select a region, it wonâ€™t let you go further. 
Call Web Support? Be prepared to spend 10 minutes just to verify yourself, first thru a stupid voice recognition system which then does not pass on the info to the Rep. Then you go through the whole verification process again! 
Then after you state the problem, quiz them. You have to repeat three times for them to begin to address the issue you called for. By this time youâ€™ve already spent 10-12 minutes! Then you get â€œboiler plateâ€� email with lots of apologies but no solution!
Other than that, the App is getting there!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Reschedule function horrible
text:
I used to love this app.  I am highly irritated I rescheduled an appt.   apparently I did not hit the final confirm button.  So why would they delete the original appt if I never confirmed the new appt?  So I show up to my appointment and nothing shows up.  This is horrible from a user experience , It should show me or tell me that nothing was booked or removed.  I took time off work and pulled my son out of school .   The nurse looked at the appointment and she said it looked like three appointments were booked at the same time and cancelled at the same time .  Definitely a defect with your reschedule function that should be looked at and fixed.  
I noticed that I am now able to reschedule a minor injury appt online which was never available and this is what type of appt it was for. Perhaps the issue is with the logic that has to do with non standard office visits ?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Looking Good!
text: I have used this app since it was released into production. It has served me well and it continues offer new and more convenient features. They kind of sneak up on me. Lol. One reviewer reports that Touch ID doesnâ€™t work as expected. I saw the same issue but after deleting the app, manually signing on and turning Touch ID on, it stayed on. I was prompted once to lift and rest a finger. From that point, all my finger prints work as expected. Yes, all. I use many for easy positioning. App support is responsive. So, try this first. NOTE: The app had been updated BUT may not have synched correctly with my hardware after iOS 11.4.1 was installed. This is what I suspect.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Awesome!!
text: Not sure what the fuss is over... I love this new version much more than the previous version. It's easy to navigate, and everything is at my fingertips which I love. I have a busy life like everyone else so that is an important factor. I can easily message my doctor or any other provider I've been referred to and easily refill prescriptions. It was mentioned in a previous post that the Rx refill doesn't alert you of when it is ready for pick up.... that would be a great feature to add. Overall, great job!!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Message function and random issues
text: A main issue I notice is with the messages within the app. I am not able to reply to messages I have received from my doctor. I have to compose a new one each time in order to respond. This causes us to lose the previous messages for context because it also only allows 100 characters when composing a new message. Also, the punctuation is messed up when sending and receiving messages. My doctor probably thinks Iâ€™m an idiot because of what the app does. For instance, instead of an apostrophe, it will put a question mark (haven?t). The app has other random issues that others have mentioned.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Use this app quite a lot.
text: I use this app regularly. It was most useful when I was pregnant and had to manage so many appointments. Also, having the results from my labs. Now that my little one is here Iâ€™d love the ability to add more than one member ID. Then I could add my childâ€™s information and keep up with her appointments, as well, without having to log in and out. Also having baby's member ID on my phone as well would make it fast and easier than trying to pull them from my wallet while sometimes dealing with a fussy/crying baby.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Good App to Have on Phone
text: Super easy to use and makes sending messages to your doctor, checking up on lab results, check out upcoming appointments, and taking a look at your medical record pretty convenient. However they really need to work on the messaging part cause after I send my messages the format isnâ€™t correct. Such as punctuation not being formatted right. Otherwise the message is sent and everything works great! Whenever their last major update was really made the app waaayyy better.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Useless mobile pharmacy app...
text: I donâ€™t know with the other sections of this app but ordering from here is so hard. It tells you to check the board for your name as soon as you order it to pick it up from a designated pharmacy of your choice but once you get there, they will say it takes an hour to process or sometimes it will take at least 2-3 days before it gets here from DOWNEY,CA. Itâ€™s a mobile app and it should be more convenient than this...you canâ€™t even edit your old prescriptions and take them out of the list. Then after the hassle from the app comes the sometimes rude and arrogant people upfront...

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Almost there
text:
I love the app, it helps me see my appointments and keep track of things.

My only issue so far is that it doesnâ€™t specifically show me where to go for an appointment...

For example, I have an appointment at 6:30am at the Fontana location in Radiology to get scanned. I can see on the appointment page the location with regards to the hospitalâ€™s address, but the hospital is divided into 4 buildings, 1,2,3 and their overnight building. Plus the outlying speciality buildings. There happen to be 4 Radiology units here. So if I have an appointment in building 3 on the basement level in Radiology, but show up to the 3rd floor Radiology unit in building 2 it might make me very late. I have good mobility, imagine if someone with poor mobility faced the same issue.

My suggestion, add the specific building and maybe the floor needed for checking in to the â€œlocationâ€� portion of the appointment page.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great stuff!
text:
I was really apprehensive about getting this app at first because of how few stars it has, but I went for it anyway and am glad I did!

I have been with Kaiser for two years and probably use this app at least once a week for one these reasons:
-Member ID #
-See a list of medications I've taken in the past, what I am currently taking, the dosages, and dates.
-Refill prescriptions and have them sent to my home
-Set up appointments
-See test results as soon as they're available

Improvements I would like to see:
-Have an offline mode with stored info so that I can view it if I'm on the phone

This is one of the first reviews I've given just because I saw it had so few stars but it's been incredibly helpful for me and I know it will be for others. Overall a great app!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Fantastic care, fantastic app!
text:
This app is fantastic for managing your own medical care, obtaining results and communicating with your doctors.  It is easy to navigate.
Kaiser Permanente provides great care and their newer notification by email or text are really helpful.  I do just about everything online.  I am always able to get a quick appointment when I need one and everyone is always super friendly and doing their best to help me.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Please keep improving, and it desperately needs it
text: Been using this app for about two years now, and itâ€™s not been easy. Making appointment is easy on the app, but keeping it is a challenge. I have had several appointments canceled on me and no notification. I also always request a text message reminder for my appointment but to this day have never gotten one. Why bother offering a text message reminder if you never follow through with it? It is nice to see messages from my doctor, and access to the Kaiser network is also convenient. But all in all, this app needs serious improvement for it to be usable.

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

text:

I called customer support and they werenâ€™t able to answer the question of IF itâ€™s even possible to access the premium payment option from the app. Instead they just referred me to the regular site through a mobile browser...if that wasnâ€™t an inconvenience in itself, then when you go to the site, you still canâ€™t access your premium bill pay! 
They make you click â€˜view full siteâ€™ which I did, then had to log in again, which I did, but it then just kicks you back to the mobile site home page.

The customer support reps donâ€™t have any other answer other than â€˜go on a regular computerâ€™... 

so much for hoping that Kaiser had finally stepped into the new millennium (let alone the cellular internet data era).

I guess once ghetto, always ghetto...

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

text:
My doctor is super responsive via their messaging, that has saved me tons of money on what would have been office visits.

Kaiserâ€™s billing is a bit of a mystery, like all health care.  I just landed on a page in this app where I was filling a prescription, and made it to the final Purchase page with the price stated as â€œN/Aâ€�.

To me, that is insane!  Where else in the world can you checkout without being told the price youâ€™re paying?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Annoying! making appointments is a waste of time!
text: Itâ€™s frustrating to try to make an appointment on the app. When you put in the dates on the calendar provided it tells you there are no appointment available for that time. It would be more helpful and less time consuming if it just shows on the calendar the dates that are available, opposed to having to keep starting all over from the beginning and having to put in different dates every single time just to keep getting told that there are no appointments available!

name: Kaiser Permanente

I also agree that not having the Touch ID is frustrating because that made logging in quick and easy when standing in the check in line. A positive - I was able to fill a prescription easily using the app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Ok when it works.

That's a shame as some of the other doctors are needed to approve medications or answer questions that your regular doctor has no clue about. It really only covers the most basic functions.

Viewing appointments and ordering prescriptions is very easy and so nice to just get them mailed to you. Great job with that.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: App about as good as southern cal Kaiser care
text: My biggest pet peeve about this stupid app (same goes for your website) is your pharmacy system. It could be so convenient, if it were accurate and worked. There have been numerous times when it says my prescriptions are available for refill (meaning it's not on the list that says it's too early for a refill and won't allow you to even try) that I've requested a refill, and not only has my physician authorized the refill and the pharmacy I'm to pick it up at notified me it was ready for pick up, and I've taken the bus (I can't drive due to medical condition) all the way to the pharmacy only to get there and find out "oh sorry it's too early to refill that prescription". I get it, with the prescription drug abuse epidemic you have to be careful and strict and I'm fine with following any and all rules regarding that. But you need to link your website and app with your pharmacy rules so that people aren't told via the app it's okay to request a refill and their doctor okay that refill and the pharmacy tells you come pick it up, then you waste your time because when you do, oops sorry too soon. That's so ridiculous. And honestly 3 days before a medication you take daily is due to run out is when patients can request a refill? 3 days? It takes 3 days or longer just to get your doctors approval most times and then another 2 for it to be filled. I've run out of medications I take daily too many times because of this "rule" and I say "rule" because you never know if the pharmacist who is working follows that rule or not. Some do, some will fill a three month prescription a month early or a one month prescription 10 days early. At least be consistent so patients aren't suddenly told of a rule that supposedly isn't new but in the 13 years I've had kaiser insurance has never been enforced until recently. When I ask if it's new, nope, always been the rule. Huh, then you've got a whole lot of staff who don't follow your rules and that's an issue. The "past visit" info is a joke (it literally tells you nothing other than the date of your past visit) and the "medical history" is also a joke since it tells you any chronic illnesses you have (great thanks didn't know that already) and what medications you take (and never updates so apparently I've been on antibiotics for years now). 99% of appts you'd make you have to call to make anyways so the appt part is mostly useless as well. So all in all if you want to know where a Kaiser facility is located or need to email your doctor (which is the only reason I gave a star, this feature is useful, as long as your doctor actually checks and responds which 2 of mine do amazingly, and one takes several months to hear back if I do, but not the apps fault) then this app might work for you. Otherwise it's just a huge waste of space.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: What happened :(
text:
I loved this app when it first came out. I could refill prescriptions, see all my test results, send/receive emails, and make appointments. Then recently all of my prescriptions showed there were no refills and that still hasn't changed. If I try to use the RX number it won't go through either. I have now started to just go into the pharmacy, request my refill and wait. :-( I spoke to the pharmacy and they told me their system changed and they realize it doesn't speak to the phone app. That was around the start of 2016 that I heard that. Now we are at mid 2016.... Is a fix in sight?

I thought that was the only problem, but now I am having problems with test results. I can see every test done in 2015 and older. I just had a bunch of 2016 bloodwork done and it showed up at first, but then I realized that after I looked at my results the tests disappeared. The 2016 data just seems to be gone. Even when I view an old test that shows a history of all other results it only goes to 2015. This was a disappointment. Hopefully the appointment and email features continue to work. I keep looking for a new app. Please fix this!!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Pretty good for a healthcare provider
text:
Sadly, I am no longer a Kaiser member due to a change in employers (I love Kaiser). Overall, the app is pretty good but not great. It provides access to your future and past appointments with after visit summaries, lab results, immunization records, messages from your doctor, an electronic representation of the membership card and much more.

Some of the functionality just seems to be a web page embedded inside the app, some features look native.

What would make the app delightful, and 5 star worthy, are the seemingly small details and features. Below is my feature wishlist. I know, it's not always easy to make this sort of stuff happen, especially in the healthcare environment where HIPAA compliance and the bureaucracy that comes with it can slow down the easiest tasks. 

1. The app doesn't particularly look great on large screen iPhones.
2. While the electronic membership card is embedded inside the app, it would be even better if Kaiser provided an Apple Wallet membership card.
3. HealthKit integration: I wanted to import my medical record into the Health app. Unfortunately, the app doesn't provide an easy way to do so. I tried to import the health summary XML file that Kaiser provides on its website. Sadly, the Health app was unable to read it.  I have successfully imported HL7 XML files from other providers, so I know it works.
4. Move more of the interface from webviews into native views.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Cumbersome appointment scheduling feature
text: The only scheduling the app allows is with the user's primary care provider; no other associated physicians are available through the app. This is in contrast to the messaging service where all associated physicians are shown. In order to schedule an appointment with that primary care provider, the application asks if the user would like to schedule a "non-physical appointment within two days" or a "non-physical appointment in the future." As if those two options aren't both in the future, it then prompts for a date range regardless of which option the user chooses. This actually happens twice for the "in the future" option. Why ask the user if they'd like an appointment within two days then ask for a date range again? The final step is the most aggravating. If the user's specified date range doesn't return an available appointment slot, they have to completely start over. Why don't you suggest a date or time, or show the available dates in the first place? Scheduling has been this way since I downloaded the app about a year ago. KP, fix this please.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Bug report
text:
Updated:  I'd love to see this be a 5-star app and  it IS better than nothing BUT IT's a long way from what it could be.  It's very good for communicating with my doctors (given the HIPAA limitations on using regular email for that purpose) but it has a lot of problems in other areas (e.g., I can't use the appointment app to set an appointment with my oncologist who's been treating me for 5 years, only with my primary).  I have a sense that the app was released without any end user usability testing. 

My previous comments are still not addressed or even acknowledged: Newest release still shows "no new" messages/test results on opening menu screen when there are new of either type. Overall the app is a 3-4 but misleading and could cause patient to miss important information.  (Even if the programmers seem not to care, I would think the KP lawyers or the Office for Civil Rights might.) This problem has persisted since this new-ish UI was rolled out maybe a year (now 2 years)ago.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Prescription refill bug
text:
After choosing the pharmacy in which to pick up your prescription, it does not load the next page or otherwise offer you a button to move onto the next page. Fix your bugs, Kaiser!

I am reiterating my original complaint. They will let you choose the pharmacy. They give you a select button with which to select what pharmacy you would like to pick up your prescription at. Then there is no next button. There is no logical way to get onto the next page. There are only three buttons available, none of them The next button, nor any other button to get it onto the next page. The only three buttons available to you after the select your pharmacy to pick up your prescription page is: "back", "cancel" (I assume that the "cancel" Button is essentially the same as the back button in terms of results), and then there is the "search" button, with which to search and select the pharmacy from. 

Please fix your bugs, Kaiser!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Pretty good app with minor glitches
text: Love that there's an app like this so my doctor is always at a hands reach. No more needing to call in to make an appt, you can do it straight from this app and it was so easy. Very nice that you can email your doctor too and you can even see your prescriptions and test results. Now the downside to this app is that it's kind of glitchy and was not tested adequately before launch. I can't scroll down my emails, the status bar that shows the time and battery life does not disappear, when setting an appt, it will show the location I need to go to but disappears after and I can't search for it any longer, not even in the appt status which will only show the general location. Make sure to screen shot where you have to go if you're new before confirming your appt. Hope they get these fixed but still usable regardless if you have the patience.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Good insurance; bad app
text:
I love my Kaiser insurance. But the app seems like it was designed, then never tested. Two examples:
1. Probably the first reason most people want the app is to make a doctors appt. But there's nowhere on the Dashboard to do that! For two years I thought the app didn't allow you to make an appt. I just discovered that there IS a way, it's just not listed on the Homepage Dashboard! You have to go searching thru about 3-4 steps to even find where to begin. Then, it doesn't really work...
2. When you finally get into "make an appt," you can choose either "make an appt within two days" (with whatever dr. is available, I assume). It even tells you the two dates you have to choose from: today or tomorrow. But when you try to do that, there is no way to make it with anyone other than your PC dr; then it says, "no appts available on those dates." Right! That's why I am willing to see any dr- so I can get in, in less than three weeks (the wait for my PC). 
So bottom line-- there IS no way to make a short-term appt within the next two days. Which leaves you with two choices: (a) wait three weeks to see your PC, or (b) go to ER.

There's gotta be a better system, Kaiser! Seriously, sit down with an average client and have them try to negotiate this app! 

I think I need to just delete it again and go back to using the phone....

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Fix the timeout, clutter, and steps to use options.
text:
Got timed out and kicked off in the middle of a message to my doctor, then timeout again every time I tried to log back in.  Had to delete the app and reinstall.  Of course my message content was gone!  I also don't need two screens of clutter about emergencies and 911 just to send a message.  Put that on your logon page if you think someone is not smart enough to know when to call 911 and get on with the message.

Also, too many steps to use options.  Users should not have to go thru so many steps for simple things like messages, prescription renewal or looking at lab results (pc version too).  And for prescriptions, WE LOG ON our account so why the extra verification steps.  A prescription renewal should be a checkbox list to click on the ones we need, not have to fill in a bunch of Rx numbers and click continue multiple times.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: So slow, SO counter-intuitive
text:
If you are trying to email your doctor, good luck with this app!  Simply finding the email page is hard enough but once you actually compose an email it is nearly impossible to find the "send" button.  It is not located next to the text, which you have just written (that would be the "logout" button.  Why would anybody want to logout WHILE COMPOSING AN EMAIL?). No, you have to scroll way down, past your own text, past the precious emails from your doctor, and at the very bottom you can click "send", after which you are sent to a page that doesn't clearly tell you if the email was sent, or if you can view your sent email.  Do do that, you have to go back about 7 pages, then find a separate folder called "emails to my doctor", and then make sure you scroll down and wait for the spinning wheel to let you proceed.

Kaiser, why can you not simply have a INBOX and an OUTBOX?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Lost all functionality
text:
This app used to work great, but since a couple updates ago, it's unusable. Previously to schedule an appointment I could just list my doctor and it would give me a list of available appointments, I'd pick the one that worked for me and ta-da, done. Now it gives you a calendar and asks you to pick a date, and then tells you it can't schedule an appointment for the listed reasons (no reasons listed). I'm assuming it's because there's none available that day, but who even knows. It only takes a few attempts of choosing dates at random before I accidentally click "done," close out of the entire appointment scheduler, and give up. 

Likewise, the pharmacy has been completely broken since the last update. It shows my list of prescriptions, but there's no way to add them to the cart. So again, completely useless. This app went from being super easy to completely useless.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Inability To Paste Password Kill Use
text:
Like others have mentioned, the ability to paste a password into the login field is important to me as I use a password management program. Not having this ability is a non-starter in terms of using this application especially when the other option is changing it to something  easy to remember and making it easier to crack.

Update: they have resolved the password issue as of the latest version of the app.  There are still a couple annoyances in the app now that I am logged in:

1. The addresses for facilities on my iPhone 5 don't fit in the box within the app meant to contain them and are sometimes unreadable. 

2. The regex for validating email addresses when submitting prescriptions isn't the same as the main site.  I like to use gmail's '+' operator within my email address for filtering. The main site account settings allow for this character but the prescription part states the email is invalid. As I have to change this every time I refill a prescription this gets annoying.

3. The error message for issue 2 is incorrect. The message is an invalid telephone number when the issue is an invalid email address.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Yey
text:
New Review: A well laid out and designed application with simple features that anyone can understand and use. The application is so well done, the iOS dev team should also tackle the design and function of Kaiser's website. The latest update has restored the paste function on the log-in screen. Lastpass & 1Password user are welcomed back with their impossible to remember passwords (Yey for HIPAA).

Old Review: I use LastPass and 1Password to manage passwords i have no intent of remembering. My kaiser password is 20 characters log, populated by symbols, numbers and letters. I'm unable to sign in because the app doesn't support the paste function in the user and password field. Please fix. Thank you.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Recurring, unresolved issues
text: I was very excited about this app when I signed up for Kaiser. I have friends who are members that rave about it. I have three major gripes. Since becoming a member in January 2015, I have not and continue to be able unable to schedule an appointment through the app, and tech support has not been unsuccessful in figuring out the source of, and resolving that issue. Secondly, I love the email feature but often times I cannot reply to my doctor's messages. Lastly, it's a chore to refill prescriptions as the app often stalls during that process. I have reinstalled several times and downloaded all updates, but the malfunctions remain the same nine months in. It seems like this app is optimally designed for NoCal members but the SoCal region (I can't speak for others) appears to be neglected.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Easy to use!
text:
This app makes it so easy to manage appointments, email your doctor, order prescriptions and view test results. 

You can easily cancel appointments and make them. All upcoming appointments can also be added to your calendar too. Like most apps it has a location finder for facilities closest to you and you have a map view or list view. Once you find your location you can make it a favorite, add it to your contacts or map out directions. 

I decided in the new, colorful theme and really like how clean it looks. This is an excellent app that's so easy to use and provides all the options I need on the go.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Works fine for me
text:
I always have a little bit of dread when I open an app and it requires I update to use it. In this case, the update was completely transparent. The app works just as well as before, which happens to be pretty darn good.

I've had no problems emailing my doctor, or viewing old test results (some prior reviews said they couldn't do these).

I am using this on an iPhone 6 Plus, and I find a perfectly easy to read and use, and I feel like the app makes fairly good use of the real estate. It could compress things a bit more and fit more information on the screen, but it's good enough.

The app works fine for me. As for the general comments of Kaiser services going downhill in one or two of the reviews, I have found it pretty much just as easy to get appointments with my PCP or specialist as I ever have been able to in NorCal, where I have been with Kaiser for 13 years. Maybe it's a regional thing.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Test a little more before releasing
text: Honestly I never thought Touch ID would see the light of day for KP, so GOOD JOB. However, the implementation is very jenky. There is an awkward pause between it reading my fingerprint and going into the app, with no indication other than the small activity indicator in the status bar. There needs to be some other indication that something is happening. Second, Iâ€™m able to paste my password into the field when setting up Touch ID, but the Submit button will not become active. If you allow pasting, then make it work. Lastly, what is up with the weird pill-shaped Agree and Cancel buttons when completing the Touch ID setup process? Doesnâ€™t match any other design pattern in the app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: It used to be good
text:
This app was useful when it first came out. Appointments were easy to make, messaging the Dr was easier, and managing prescriptions and refills were easy. However, the app seems to get less useful with each update. Now I can no longer make an appointment for same-next day, they're always for one or two weeks in the future which is not helpful at all! I can't even hit reply to a doctor's message without composing a new message altogether (again, useless). The only thing I use this for is to look at my existing appointments, tests results, and prescriptions. 

I hope there are updates to IMPROVE this app in the future. Until then, this app is getting 2 starts.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Love this app/saves money and time!
text: I use this app all the time to message my doctor check for prescription availability and to check test results. My doctor is amazing at getting back to me when I email himabout issues I am having or questions I have about prior visits. This alone saves me so much time where another doctor or company don't do emails and you would have to schedule an appointment to go in. I highly recommend getting this app and using it effectively with your doctor and the Kaiser network.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A For Effort
text: This app works slow as molasses and has been for years now. The quaintly is extremely poor all around, from the looks of the app, to the way information is uploaded and downloaded, I believe we all spend a lot of money on our premium a month for Kaiser to spend a lot of the money they get towards updating this app big time. I am just saying, sure a lot of you can agree? So let's see this app improve in speed, on sending and receiving messages from your provider(s), if you upload a photo or your doctor uploads a photo to you, that you are more than able to see the photo both ways. Come on now Kaiser, yet with the program and get it right. Cause my Bank of America app is far better than yours.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Shovelware
text:
This is just a port of the website to the iPhone (not the iPad). Since the website is not very easy to use, this app is even harder. For example, to refill a prescription, you can't simply view a list and tap one. You can't do that on the website and you can't do it here. You have to view your prescription list, manually copy the prescription number(s) you want to fill, then paste them into the reorder part. So there's no need to use this. Just use the website.

A side note: There are several variants of the term "log out" used in applications. I've never seen this one before: "sign off". It takes me right back to the Golden Age of Radio, it does.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Terrible app and service
text:
This app is awful! Just like all of the kaiser systems!
It doesn't allow you to make specialist appointments and they do not provide any phone numbers to the offices! Instead they only provide their one kaiser phone number that is absolutely ridiculous to use and spends a HUGE waste of time keeping you on hold for 28 minutes (on a good day) just to get a real person! They then spend another 5 minuets making you re-answer questions the automatic system already made you provide just to be able to talk to that person! They then transfer you to  the specialists office who's  receptionist then re-asks all the same questions again! then FINALLY(usually 35 minuets later) they schedule the appointment!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Website unavailable
text: I downloaded the app thinking it'll be convenient to access my medical record. Then I prompted to reset my password. Once done -- it said, "website unavailable". I thought it was a glitch so I tried numerous times and got the same error message. Maybe they're updating their website or maybe I'm trying their website during off hours. But come on, I should be able to access my account anytime. This is ridiculous and useless. I guess I gotta go the old-fashion route and call them. Which isn't much of a bad thing. But I'd like to have the convenience of utilizing this app. Which is not the case currently.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Love the app! Thank you KP!!
text: One of the best apps on the App Store. Has some minor flaws, but I'm sure all of those things will be addressed eventually. Would be great if your Membership ID was in Passbook or in Apple's upcoming HealthBook so you don't have to log in to view it. I can do mostly everything, appointments, reminders, results, messages, refills, update profile. It's also great with phone numbers, locations, and all other kinds of information. All Kaiser members should definitely have this app! ğŸ�¥ğŸ‘�ğŸ‘Œ

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Thanks!  Feedback on minor issue
text:
Wow!  I got my lab tests back, and made an appointment quickly and easily.  App links quickly  to an amazing collection of great health information with the doctors Homepages

Had trouble sending email to my doctor.  The session expired, while I was writing, and all my hard work typing the message with one finger was lost. 

If there were a 'contact developer' link, I would comment there, instead of in reviews. That is another suggestion for improving this great app!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Same App, Worse Graphics
text:
The App entry graphic won't load on the iPad, and although the interior page graphics are more modern than before, it moved from the 70's into the 90's.  They should check out Yahoo Weather for current styles.  It looks like it was approved by doctors, instead of artists. 

They should also indicate where the check boxes are, versus a "done" button, or use one or the other consistently. 

The larger type is a nice touch.  It shows they recognize the age of the clientele. As a health care app it is so far ahead of the others there is really no effective second place.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Fair-crashes when trying to order prescriptions
text: Like the email and health record features they are easy to use and very helpful. Other features need work. The prescription renewal crashes when you order. Also the prescription doesn't tell you that you cannot pick up a prescription on the same day until after you finish placing your order. That info should be given up front. What is the purpose of digital member card when  Kaiser staff says they need to see your actual card, They could ask for I. D. If they want to check your identity.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great!
text:
No idea why there are so many complaints about fingerprint access in this release, it works jus fine, as it has since they implemented the fingerprint login. Sounds like user error to me.

Love being able to manage my whole family's medical needs via the app - can see past visit documentation, make appointments, email my doctor/pharmacist, check my lab results, and refill my medications, each just a few clicks away from the dashboard.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Can ya let a patient know
text: I decided to try the refill prescription function on the app. After submitting my request, or in other words checking out my items in my cart, I got redirected to a web view of the homepage. Didn't get a confirmation, but I assumed it work. I thought I'd get some type of confirmation the day after that my meds were ready to pick up. I did not get an email, alert for my app, or a text message. I had to call the pharmacy to find out. Since I use the app, it makes sense that I would receive an alert that my meds were ready. I guess that makes too much sense.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great app needs some more improvement
text:
I really like that app and the UI is nice. Would be cool to have a few more themes but the fact that there is a choice is awesome. 
I wish that I could stay logged in and unlock it with a passcode. I also wish it would notify me when there are new messages/prescriptions etc.  I've missed many messages from the message center and I would love to just get a notification from the app. That would be five stars for me. 

Thank you for making a great app

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Can't see my kids appointments?
text: I love the idea of the app but I can't seem to find information for my kids? Neither is over 18 and I figured out how to make appointments for them, but I can't seem to view their appointments. I just moved to Modesto so they don't have records through Kaiser, but I'm not sure how I'd view their records either? I haven't used the web page in years but I remember it being easy to switch from my record to my sons and I think the app should be able to do that too. Maybe it's just me, or you can but I haven't figured it out yet?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Worthless
text:
This app is incomplete. I tried to make an appointment and it says I must answer questions, but there is no question there.
I tried to enter a reason for visit and that bounced me back. I one time it allowed me to enter a date then asked for another date. No appointment available but didn't give me any options to continue. Just start over. It should have suggested a future date or a different Doctor. Some idea that might result in future success. 
Kaiser is getting too big and multilayered bureaucracy too complex. I will call or email my Primary Care Physician and get in appointment in two days.
Don't waste an hour with this app like I did...for nothing!!!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: It's the best!
text: Not too sure why others say you can't view messages and lab results. This application is truly the best. Besides the extensive viewing of lab in depth results, you can view everything. I love being able to reschedule appointments or check last minute as to where my appointment it. Quick e mails to my doctor to change prescription has been a life saver numerous times. Thanks Kaiser for being a one stop shop!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Good app! Can it remember my password?
text:
I use secure passwords, so every time I use the app I have to go dig up my password. It would be nice if there was an option to remember it. I know health care providers like to treat my asthma prescription as if it were the nuclear launch codes, but as a practical matter it means I wonâ€™t use the app very much.

That said, once logged in, the app is excellent. The information is presented clearly and in my opinion is much easier to navigate than the web site.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Good for a glance
text: I have an iPad and this app is meant for iPhone. Double sizing does not take advantage of the iPads capabilities. It only works landscape. It is good for reordering prescriptions but when I had to report a weeks blood pressure I had problems. It took me four times to learn that tab sent me to the next dialogue box with no ability to undo. I eventually used the web site to accomplish this task. When you have upgraded this for the iPad let me know. The iPad could be used to to take advantage of your wealth of on line information.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Something very wrong
text: This app has all the benefit of a video game.  Every time I try to order my prescription by mail, nothing happens and the meds show up again as "available to fill." Three times so far I've gone through the order process, even including notes requesting they send the meds or tell me why they won't.  Nothing.  Email my doctor, nothing.  I'm not in a Kaiser area while they're open, so mail order is the only way I can legally obtain these.  Meanwhile, my health problems are coming back without the medications.  Is it the app?  The pharmacy?  The internet?  Using this app gets me nothing but frustrated.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Needs a quick fix
text: I'm liking the app so far, but just discovered that you are unable to update your credit card due to a missing field for card type. There should be a drop down for choosing Amex, VISA, etc.   It wouldn't let me proceed and I had to use the website to update it. Also it would be nice to see when you have a message waiting in the message center. Other than those quick things, it looks solid so far.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A wonderful app
text:
