Doesn't let you schedule appointments. Errors out saying you can't do the select action (paraphrasing). On the future visits that is. Didn't bother with the same day appointments.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Copy + Paste
text: This app is great for getting all the information I need about Heath status. However it would be nice to be able to copy information so I can copy an address and paste it in google maps, or copy a test result name so I can look it up in google to know what it means.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Incredible
text: What an advance in medical technology.  To have my medical record available on demand like this and the ability to access the vast resources at KP is outstanding. Keep up the ground breaking work!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Messages won't open?!
text: I've been using app for awhile now but ever since last Apple update, I can't open messenger! It just crashes on me. Please fix this ASAP! I really rely on this app to take care of my medical needs. Once you get that fixed I'll move it to 5 stars!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Easy to use and convenient
text: This app is pretty basic and useful as an on the go basis. Booking appointments is very convenient as well as sending messages.  The UX is easy to navigate. Haven't utilized the pharmacy section yet, but so far so good.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great app
text: Works perfect with my iPhone 5 with iOS 8.02. I like it better then their website. Everything from communication with my doctor to refilling my prescriptions.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Can't log-on / No response from tech support
text: I've sent several bug reports to Kaiser's Technical Support email and after *one month* I received a reply back stating they would like to review log files while I attempted to sign in to the app.  I replied to the email, but never heard back again. How can Kaiser support an application when they reply to emails after a month or not at all?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Wish it would save password/login
text: Pretty good overall, but I wish it would let me stay logged in if I have a secure password on my device. It's a real pain to have to provide my password each time, especially if I use a long, secure password.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Patient
text: LOVE this app. Was able to view info, correspond with my physician, make appointments all from my phone on the fly. Access to all family's information.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Constantly crashing
text: I don't even use the app anymore. I just deleted it tonight because it constantly crashes, freezes, or says it can't perform the action I'm asking for. If they make some upgrades and smooth out the performance, I'd use it again. For now, the mobile site works better.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: good promise, poor execution
text: This app is very slow and even on a wifi network I get a lot of requests can't be processed messages and then get kicked several layers up in the menu hierarchy. While not fantastic itself, their website is better.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not A Very Written App
text: Compared to online computer App, this App's Messages feature is not very useful. In messages you can't go from reading your doctor's message to writing a message without exiting their message to write yours. After you write a message you don't know if it has been sent or received.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Love this app
text: I really love the convenience of this app. I do wish other items such as referrals were included. A copy posted would save time money and paper.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: HUGE improvement!
text: Much better than past apps. Super easy to book appointments, refill prescriptions, etc.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great App!
text: It has everything I need to manage my entire family's medical records! It makes it so easy to keep track of everything regarding our health!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Full functionality of the app...not there yet!
text: I can only view and sent messages, my test result, health concerns, and reminders. However, I cannot view past or schedule an appointments on the app. I have the iPhone 6 plus so I am not sure if that is the issue. I really would like to use that feature.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Improvements needed
text: Love this app , the only thing that makes it less than perfect is its inability to have notifications when we get email reply from dr or appointment reminders! Pls include these basic app abilities

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Good idea but too many bugs
text: This could be great but it takes a very long time to send messages since it freezes every couple of seconds. Also, labs are not in order by date requiring searching. Also keeps asking for preferences so that doesn't appear to be remembered.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Amazing!
text:
The new application is insane! Time it takes to book an appointment went from 15 mins on the phone to 30 secs on the app. I am the happiest person today! :)

Thanks kaiser!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Love the new layout but...
text: Love the new layout except when I went to double check what department I was supposed to go to for my appt, it doesn't show on there. Only gives the date, time and doctor. Please add it :)

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Re-Install the APP - It will work
text:
I, too, couldn't get the app to work. Couldn't log in, etc. I deleted the app, and re-installed. The user interface is WAY different! And - NOW it works. 
KP needs to tell folks to re-install the app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not worth your time
text: No open appointment times 6 weeks from today. No number listing to call. Googled facility and found a number.  Called and got appointment 3 days from today with time choices.  Even though number was wrong the  recording gave me new number and transfered me. App needs lots of work and if you like punishment us it. I recommend not installing.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: New upgrade crashing
text: With the new iOS upgrade, the app has been crashing when in the message section. The others work fine.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Works great!
text: Overall it's a very useful app for staying in touch with your general physician or even specialist. Also it's great for making appointments or looking up your medical records.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A Good Start
text: I like the access to the services that KP Has on their website,  but some new features like wait times would be great.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Love it!
text: The ease of use is just fabulous!  Just refilled prescriptions by scanning the list and selecting the ones I needed.  Much faster than the refill phone system.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Don't refill your prescriptions with this app
text: Go online and do it, I requested a new inhaler yesterday, and when I checked the status today it said no request had been received. On top of that when I tried to go to the "refill screen" it kept sending me to the "check prescription status" screen. Don't try to refill prescriptions with this app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Useless app
text: I have tried a couple of times to order my medicine, and it couldn't even process my order correctly. Then when it said partial order received, I tried to order it again to no avail. Both times I had to call the pharmacy. Big inconvenience.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: I am a fan!
text: I was happy and excited to find this app. I am able to access my medical info, make an appt and locate facilities in seconds. Well done KP, keep up the good work!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Soooooo slooooooow
text: I agree with above comments regarding buttons not working, but the most frustrating this is how incredibly slow this app has become. The previous version was actually somewhat useful... Not sure why they needed to "fix" it... and of course this older version will no longer work because of the update. A HUGE step backwards here.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great app
text: I use this app a lot, especially since being pregnant. I can access my lab results and keep track of my appointments. I like that it makes it easy to communicate with my doctor as well.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Awesome! Simple and brilliant!
text: So easy to use. This is such a huge improvement from the last version. Love the colors and page effects.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Convenient and easy to use
text: Great app. Easy access to your medical information. It is also user friendly.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great start
text: Would be nice to be able to merge an appointment with the iOS calendar. Many apps can do this. Medication schedule reminders would be great. Setting up mail order would be nice. Like I said. Great start.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not usable
text: Good idea for the app, but when I tried it out & majority of the features were working, requiring that I contact member services for everything. The only feature I was able to use is to see my member info. Other than that, I couldn't email my doctor, see appointments or medications, etc. The app is pretty much useless for me.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Sign In Needs Fixing
text:
App only recognizes one of your fingerprints instead of all associated with your phone security. To top it off, if you use the wrong finger, it will lock you out and prevent you from even typing your password to get in. I need to be able to access my account first and foremost. This app does not achieve that. 

Needs to be fixed.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Used to work better.
text:
The latest version has issues with the pharmacy refill process. 
Worked on my iPad but failed spectacularly on my iPhone.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not really working
text: Everything I click on says there is a system error... I'm using my iPhone 6plus... I was really excited to see there was this app but the only good it does is that I can click on the phone icon to call.. I set up an appointment and it doesn't even show up on my calendar

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Needs Work
text: It's too slow. It doesn't allow you access to your personal profile, so you cannot update any other personal info. Also, it doesn't provide billing info, such as deductible or co-pay charges. I always have to call or visit member services.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Thank you :)
text: It's a little bit slow but a pretty good app overall. Can't complain, helps me keep track of appointments and refills ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‘�

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Need update
text:
Since last update this application is a piece of junk. 
It's extremely slow and to book appointment you have to go through many screens and on the and the message is ERROR !!! 
Why there is no longer option to see another doctor if my is not available for a whole month?

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Map feature not useful
text:
I have not tried to login yet but the map feature made me wonder if it is worth even trying. It took a couple of minutes for the app to become minimally responsive.

One major criticism of the map filter is that it does not list Kaiser's Urgent Care facilities. The Map Search does not pick up keywords so searching for 'urgent' sent me to Urgench, Uzbekistan! 

The filter allows one to choose Amenities or Other Services but does not give a second menu to further refine a search. 

Their website locator is not great but is better than this so no reason for this app to waste space on my phone.

name: myCigna
title: Pretty good but...
text: I really appreciate all the features and conveniences of this app. It enables me to track HSA transactions as well as all claims. I also like how it helps me keep track of deductibles and out-of-pocket expenses. However, one thing that I want to be able to do within the app that I canâ€™t seem to do is go back to review info from the previous year. For example, we had a significant medical emergency in our household on Christmas day. While I am able to view claims as they are processed from that health event, even after the start of the new year, I canâ€™t view the overall deductible/out-of-pocket expenses tracker for 2017. I now only have access to the new trackers for 2018. I would appreciate being able to still view that info from 2017, for a few months into the new year anyway.

name: myCigna
title: Garbage, just like DenyTillYouDieCigna
text:
This is just another layer in a policy of obstruction to make things as difficult as possible to get DenyTillYouDieCigna to pay for or do anything you pay dearly for them to allegedly do. The app is clunky and makes it near impossible to find anything medical service. You wonâ€™t be able to find a doctor much less a medical center or one of their many obstructionist locations. Just like DenyTillYouDieCigna, nothing works. Avoid this app and avoid anybody in bed with DenyTillYouDieCigna. You will end up paying for everything yourself, while still paying Cigna and having to fight for your life every grueling step of the way. This app does nothing to help and provides you no information that is helpful. DenyTillYouDieCigna is the poster child for *everything* that is wrong and broken in the American healthcare system. 

Avoid this app and any reason to try to use it and be greatly disappointed.

name: myCigna
title: No Longer Works
text: The app no longer works on my phone. After I put in my user ID and password I receive a login error alert. They canâ€™t process my request at this time to try again later and to contact customer support. I have tried again at different time and still getting the error. I spoke with customer service and they told me there is a problem with the app and they are currently working on getting it resolved. But they donâ€™t have a estimated time when it will be resolved. I have been having an issue with the last couple of months already. When they app was working it was easy to you and I was able to keep track of all of my information. But now I have to login through the desktop to view my information. I hope they can get the issue resolve.

name: myCigna
title: MJM
text:
Love this app! My favorite part is that it makes it so easy to review recent claims: I can choose parameters for what I want to review. For example, I can choose to review only medical claims for me in the last 30 days. Or I can review only dental claims for my daughter within the last 90 days. I can further specify only paid claims, or those that were denied, being processed, being appealed, or have been adjusted, etc. I also love that I can "Live Chat" if I have a question. 
Three suggestions for improvement: 
1. Make "Live Chat" available 24/7 (or see #2)
2. Allow me to send a message/ask a question to be answered by customer service via return message the next day. 
3. Allow me to see status of requests for pre-certification/preauthorization. For example, after my doctor submits a request, I'd like to be able to see if it was received, if it's under review, whether or not the request was approved or denied, and the reason for that decision. 
Thank you Cigna!

name: myCigna
title: Close but just not all there yet
text: Cigna is a pretty good insurance company and their app is held at about the same level. Pretty seamless but gets caught up in itself once every so often and trips up. My biggest reason for giving this app 4 stars (& writing this review) is because the In/Out-of-Network doctors is not current & hasn't been for months and months, if not years. Multiple times I've called doctors offices to get an appt only to be told that doctor hasn't worked there for a while or no answer at all. This is more with Cigna keeping their directory updated more than with the functionality of the app, though.

name: myCigna
title: No fingerprint
text: I like the app but I use strong logins so I would use the fingerprint option if it would work. Even though you select it it does not work. The copy and paste does not work. If I were to want security I would except strong passwords, copy your strong password to enter and except fingerprints as authentication. I maybe wrong but you are making difficult to use strong passwords and make it frustratingly easy to just give up and use the easy passwords used for the accounts that does not really have personal information and with no security exposure because you can return to app later and not consistently having to reset your password. Just my thoughts. Letâ€™s see whatâ€™s your thought in the future with the performance of this app.

name: myCigna
title: Love the convenience
text: I find this app to be one of the top 5 apps ever created. Almost everything I need to know about my insurance is right here. Love the convenience of looking up providers and tell my doctor what facility I want to use based on coverage, it has saved me thousand of dollars on procedures.  One thing I would like to see added is physician credentials - for example where did they go to school and when, it is important to me because not all doctors are created equal and education matters a lot! Good job Cigna keep it up.

name: myCigna
title: Awesome app
text: With hospitals and independent medical providers it would be very difficult to know what you owe any specific vendor and any time. Before I used this app I was constantly stressed wondering g what was paid what was not how much I owed. Now when I get a bill like today I go in the app do a comparison and send them a check. I love this app. I have had extensive medical bills for two years now and am totally on top of this due exclusively to this app.

name: myCigna
title: Scaled-up on iPad
text: I like having all these features available in an app, which I can access via Touch ID, but on my iPad it is just a larger version of the iPhone app. My first time using the app, and I was chatting with a rep about finding an in-network provider. Iâ€™m happy with all the features available, and only thing I would ask for is a iPad version - since I prefer doing banking, medical, etc on my iPad - which stays at home - versus my phone which is carried outside the home.

name: myCigna
title: Nice options yet you only get errors when you select them
text: This app is driving me crazy. Have the options/links donâ€™t work. You just get error messages of ouch, something went amiss, try again later. I donâ€™t have time later. Itâ€™s ridiculous to offer drug cost and not be able to access a single drug. I canâ€™t even select my PCP without getting an error. I canâ€™t add the ID card to my iPhone wallet even though thatâ€™s an option...you get an error. Everything I try to select I get an error! Get it together Cigna IT! Troubleshoot your work for crying out loud! Fix it!

name: myCigna
title: So easy to use
text: Busy, working mom here! It's so hard to find the time to manage my family's affairs, which typically means waiting on hold for long periods.  I actually downloaded the app & changed my kids' pediatrician in a matter of minutes while burning time waiting at the dentist office! I appreciate the ease of which I was able to do this & the capabilities within the app that can save me precious time!

name: myCigna
title: Thank you Cigna!
text: With an unexpected medical problem and a great deal of stress and worry, I downloaded this Cigna app. What a HUGE help it has been to check every part of my insurance, from coverage amounts to claim payment dates. Thereâ€™s even a â€˜walletâ€™ where I can track the many prescriptions Iâ€™ve been given from different doctors. Now itâ€™s all in one place and I feel like Iâ€™ve got a handle on my health care.

name: myCigna
title: Excellent Representative
text: I spoke to your Pharmacy Representative Michelle today and she was very knowledgeable, professional and had excellent customer service skills.  Michelle recommended that I put myCigna on my mobile phone.  Michelle also walked me through the process, was very patient and explained the entire process of retrieving my benefit information.  Michelle has commendable customer service skills.   Margaret Spells

name: myCigna
title: Missing 1 Key Feature
text: This app helps so much and is so easy to use. The only thing keeping me from giving 5 â­�ï¸�s is that I cannot ask for a new scrip whenever I have 0 refills remaining. Inevitably I have to call to have a person take the order by phone. I honestly donâ€™t have time during my workday to make personal calls so it is always a hassle. Please give us this ability in a new version!!

name: myCigna
title: Awesome
text: This app is awesome. I love having everything at my fingertips. Anytime I have a question or think something is billed wrong I can instantly see it on this app. It has saved me money when the doctor was trying to charge more then they should. I was able to show them they were wrong with the information on this app.

name: myCigna
title: Amazing App
text:
Canâ€™t begin to tell you how much I appreciate been able to access all the information about my husband recent prostate operation, received so many bills and felt lost, put all the paperwork together from Cigna, and FINALLY went to the APP and bingo everything was there EASY to find and all my questions were answered was able to take care of all our side of the billing.
GREAT JOB, love this app and THANK you so much for making our life so uncomplicated.

Was the easiest I ever had refilling my prescriptions very friendly right to the point, and I will be using from now on.
Thank you never thought it took me just a couple of minutes and done.
Great App
Beatriz Rowe

name: myCigna
title: Convenient all the time
text: I landed in the hospital within a week of changing to Cigna and the app made it so easy to find in-network care. In needing to line up doctors for follow-up care, the app again made it so easy to find whom I needed. I can see my balances and claims all in one sitting. (In many cases, I find the app more intuitive than the main website!)

name: myCigna
title: Best Medical App Iâ€™ve Ever Used
text: This app reminds me of the convenience and information rich app from Geico. So easy to use. Everything you need is at your fingertips. Itâ€™s also great when you children are out of the house because you donâ€™t have to keep up with making sure they have their medical cards. Right on the app. Thanks Cigna.

name: myCigna
title: Useful app - useless support
text:
The Cigna app works great - when it works. You can see a lot of info about coverage and access your cards and provider list. 
Unfortunately- if things go wrong, support for the app is clueless and in some cases only looks to transfer you to some other department. When I called in the first time the agent transferred me right away to Cigna medical customer service before even understanding what issue I had. The second agent was better, but his solution - delete and reinstall the app. Sad.

name: myCigna
title: Great app!
text: Love the app and will give it 4.5 stars.  The only suggestion I have is to have a feature where the doctor info can feed from the EOB straight to the Contacts without re-entry, then have option to edit or delete if it was a one time visit or you no longer use that dr.  Otherwise, it is extremely well thought out and easy to maneuver.

name: myCigna
title: Easy to check my balance on the go
text: Love being able to see my HSA balance quickly using the app and Touch ID. I often check it right before using my debit card at the pharmacy or when Iâ€™m about to pay a bill so love having that info at my fingertip anytime anywhere.

name: myCigna
title: Love it!
text: This app is by far one of the best apps I have on my phone. Itâ€™s not one I use often because I donâ€™t need to but I love the layout and I love how easy it is to use! All of the information you need is easily accessible and I really appreciate how itâ€™s not overly complicated or crowded. If I could give it 10 Stars, I would.

name: myCigna
title: Rest easy with this app
text: Every doctor visit is a mystery, a game of cluelessness until you received the monstrous bill in the mail . The app offer a comprehensive guide of provider , your coverage and even an estimation of your procedure at the doctor. Itâ€™s a piece of mind that will let you be able to plan and budget accordingly.

name: myCigna
title: Makes Using Cigna a Snap
text: So much easier than going through the website. All of your information is right there in a clear and easy to use format. I am Plant Based and donâ€™t need much health care, so I have not had any claimed yet, but they will be right where I need them when I do make a claim.

name: myCigna

I love everything about this app,
The only thing I donâ€™t like and donâ€™t understand is the amount of paper work I receive every time I receive my order!! With my personal information plastered on it, you need to find away to cut down on the paper work!!!

name: myCigna
title: Disappointed

name: myCigna
title: Insurance made easier

name: myCigna
title: User Friendly
text: This app really make looking at your insurance coverage fun and easy. The ID card feature if awesome, so I never have to carry the car with me and I can print it from anywhere. Tracking deductibles and pay out cost are also calculated in this app. Iâ€™m satisfied ğŸ˜�

I am no longer able to access any claims and every time I go to my prescriptions it crashes the app!! Give me a break

name: myCigna
title: Solid and stable app
text: Iâ€™ve been using this app for about 4 months now and have had no issues with stability or access. The information available through the app is pretty inclusive and only occasionally pushes me to the Cigna website. I like it.

name: myCigna
title: Most Useful Health Care Application
text:
I've been with several carriers and this app is beyond its time. I am only speaking to the application and not the provider of course. Took them ages to establish my coverage while I was still paying for it.

name: myCigna
title: Love having access to information

name: myCigna

name: myCigna
title: Cigna App
text: It certainly is a lot better than the web page. I think it has pretty much everything at the touch of my fingers! I would like to see what is pending on my prescriptions though. Automatic refills would also be nice...well maybe auto notification at least!

name: myCigna
title: Love Cigna!

name: myCigna

One recommendation: maybe consider adding the feature to reserve a doctor appointment for preventative care purpose, such as annual physical, etc.

name: myCigna

name: myCigna
title: Very Pleased

name: myCigna
title: Great app to track you benefits and costs
text: The app is super easy to navigate. Love getting a quick snapshot of my deductible and maximum out of pocket expenses. Love easy access to EOBs. Especially love being able to pull up our insurance cards right on my phone.

name: myCigna
title: Informative

name: myCigna

name: myCigna

name: myCigna
title: Couldnâ€™t be Happier
text: This app is hands down the most useful on my phone. The built-in features and chat functionality usually help me answer complex questions in minutes. It makes me want to stick with Cigna!

name: myCigna

name: myCigna

text: This app is awesome! Login with Touch ID, then itâ€™s 1 click to see your ID card. Someone being picky about an ID card from an app? Ask them for a fax number! You can fax your ID card to them from the app!

name: myCigna
title: Convenient easy to use app

name: myCigna

name: myCigna

text: This is a great app thatâ€™s easier to navigate than the desktop website. Four stars because Iâ€™ve found the deeper you go in the app, youâ€™re more at risk of the app crashing on you. A little buggy, but beautiful interface.

name: myCigna
title: Easy to use

name: myCigna

name: myCigna

name: myCigna

name: myCigna
title: Cigna App
text: Great app!! It puts all of my insurance info right at my fingertips. It also allows me to see what claims are pending or have been paid/ processed and how much I am responsible for so that I can budget for the Drs bill before I get it;  Allows me to see how much of my deductible or maximums I've reached; Allows me to see exactly WHAT is covered under my preventative plan for both medical and dental; Allows me to see what a specific medication will cost me via mail or at my nearest pharmacies, etc. so I can decide where I want to buy it;  Allows me to search for a lab and the cost of a test or procedure to me so that I can decide if I want to have it done at a lab, Drs office, hospital, etc.; also really love that I can enter specific health info in my "wallet" if I want to keep track of my prescriptions, allergies, immunizations etc.  I'm a little leery of ALL my business being on the app so I really just input my immunizations info on there.  As a travel nurse I need to keep up with my immunization record, influenza shots, etc and it becomes a pain having to search for the info all the time.  VERRRRY COOL and TREMENDOUSLY HELPFUL app!!

name: myCigna
title: Insurance made Easier
text:
"My Cigna" by a standard PC was convenient and easier, but with this app, being on top of your plan from every aspect has been made even more easier!  I love it.  

I can keep track of all my medical care, cost (if any), doctor's names and telephone numbers, and benefits. At a touch of my phone or iPad I have access to my questions, incentives rewards, and much more.  If for some reason my question has no answers here, I have telephone numbers that hook me up with the right specialist who can help answer my questions. Do you seek advice from their RNs on call?  It's there in the app. Phone numbers to assist you. Are you on vacation and need to go to Urgent Care or a doctor?  The app assist you with that too. Can't remember you doctor's phone number, or the spelling of their name?  Good news, it's all stored in the app to make life and those times of illness or accidents a bit easier so you can focus on getting better.

There is even a simple consent page with gives you and your spouse reciprocal access to the other's information.  For me that alone is invaluable.  

 Bravo Cigna!

name: myCigna
title: Too many mistakes to depend on as a usable app
text:
The only part of this app that I found to be usable, is a listing and address book of pharmacies in my area.

Using the "price a drug" area has been very misleading, and is often dead wrong. This specific area will commonly tell you that you can fill a 90 day order at a local pharmacy; this is almost never correct.

The drug mail order status area has too little detail.  For instance, a drug may be "in process" for many days. A phone call is required to find out what the problem is, completely negating the ease of use of this app. 

Also, the mail order status area will often list tracking numbers. I have found that some tracking numbers have no status for more than a week. I can only assume that a specific prescription was set to ship out on a certain date, but for some unknown reason is not sent.

I have also sent in prescriptions to be filled, only to find out a few weeks later that I had to call in and "release the order" for no reason whatsoever that could be explained to me.

These are just a few of the few dozen problems I have run into trying to use this app. I am very glad their customer service number is 7/24.

name: myCigna
title: Very Convenient.
text:
Overall, this is a great app. I simply wanted it so I could easily review my family's claims. I, too, had the issue with my password not working, but I reset it and it works fine now. There's a feature I haven't checked out fully yet, but seems very helpful -- Health Wallet. This feature allows you to store specific health info for each person on your plan. 

The ONLY inconvenience I've run across so far is this... When there are multiple charges on one claim, the app shows the discount for each charge, but does not add them up in the end. I either have to pull it up on the computer for that total charge or pull out my calculator and figure it out myself.

name: myCigna
title: Physician rates CIGNAHEALTHSPRINGS - heâ€™s back
text:
Update: Am I the only one having to battle Part D Medicare Drug Insurance? Almost a year later (v.i.) in formal written (forget useless phone calls) appeals, grievances, state insurance commission complaints, appeal to U.S. Senator for help, complaint with CMS (the official Medicare â€œcustodianâ€� and ombudsman), my case has yet to be resolved. CIGNA HEALTHSPRINGSRX owes me thousands in DIRECT MEMBER REIMBURSEMENT for out of pocket expenses.  I hold approvals for reimbursement â€” basically promissory notes â€” but the battle rages.  Next is a court battle.  

 I suppose negative stars are verboten... The CIGNA app won't let me sign in. Customer support by phone gives friendly reps, a "ticket" #, NO action. For weeks, appealed denials change the reasons for denial -- prior authorization required or NOT, drug not on formulary when clearly shown on website.  Appeals continue.  State insurance commissioner next up. (Impossible to rate 0 & still submit review.)

name: myCigna
title: Good app, getting better.
text: I'm not sure where all these reviews are coming from. My app has always worked fine. Was always able to login etc. login errors only occurred when I was in a little to no service zone. Ability to export ID card to Apple wallet would be good, as well as Touch ID. It would also be helpful to improve the incentives area. On the website, you are taken to a site where you can connect your wearable devices, earn points and incentives that way. But there is no way to check your progress / sync with your device through the mobile app. Because of that I'm sure most people don't even know that feature exists.

name: myCigna
title: Settings>Restrictions>Websites: Always Allow >Add a Website
text: If you get a never ending loading page look behind the cycling circle for the dark grey text on the grey background for the web site that is attempting to load. I keep my websites restricted and often am prompted in such situations by a legitimate app going to a legitimate site to add this to the exceptions list of web sites allowed. I was not prompted as I simply just added the web site to the exceptions list found in: Settings>Restrictions>Websites: Always Allow >Add a Websiteâ€¦ I hope this helps some people would were having issues with the app. This so far is the only manual work around that other apps have taken stride by the afore mentioned automatic prompting to â€œAdd a Websiteâ€�.

name: myCigna
title: So Helpful
text: This app is great! Tells you everything you need to know. You can see how much money you have spent and how much you have left. You can also list all medications, allergies and medical conditions on there for quick references. It also is a digital card so you will always have your medical card on you at all times. Sometimes you might need it unexpectedly. Another great feature is that you can look up dr offices, emergency rooms, urgent cares, lab etc on here too that are in network. This app is really easy to navigate and figure out. Enjoy it. Hopefully you don't have to use it as much as I do. â�¤ï¸�

name: myCigna
title: Frustrated!
text:
Haven't been able to get past login screen. Enter my password and then...nothing. Deleted app & then added it again. And...nothing. Not helpful when you're on the go trying to access information when not by your laptop or a computer. ğŸ‘�ğŸ‘�

Just called the 800 # provided on the app for tech support. I submitted a complaint and advised them of the issues and notified them about other reviews and complaints I read on the App Store. They gave me a srvc ticket # and "should" hear bk fr them in 2 business days. I wasn't expecting it to be resolved tonight but at least they're aware of the problem. Who knows if they'll take my complaint seriously. The cost of health insurance is ridiculous...the least they could have is a functional app to minimize the frustration.

name: myCigna
title: Helps me keep track of everything
text:
I have many health issues, and this App makes my life a lot easier. 
The Pros:
-The app keeps me up to date on  my Copay and deductible limits for me and the family. 
-Cigna covers my LTD claim as well, and with this app I have access to all of my coverage through Cigna. 
-everything I want to know is easily accessible, I can find doctors who are in network, and more importantly those that aren't. I can also see when a check has been cut for my LTD, no need to go to multiple sites.
-It helps me to keep Cigna on their toes in regards to mistakes made by them or my providers rather than being notified months later with a bill. 
Cons:
-Updates take longer to post.
-It has a tendency to freeze up or not allow you to sign in which generally happens after changes have been made and you have to contact mobile support to fix the glitch.

Overall I think the app is a great tool, much easier than the full site and I use it several times a week.

name: myCigna
title: Convenient but needs more
text: Love the ability to house my insurance card and quickly email or fax the information directly from within the app. However the prescription ordering needs work. There is nothing in place to alert you if there is an error with your order. I placed an order in early December and when it didn't arrive a few weeks later I went back to the app. It was only then that I noticed there was an issue with the order. It would have been great to get an immediate notification from the app that there was an issue. Also would love Touch ID.

name: myCigna
title: Unstable
text: The context and tools of this application are helpful when you do not have to input a lot of information or change between categories often. I find the application is slightly unstable in that entering contacts, checking claims, reviewing coverages, the application freezes during the process. At times, it will come around and other times,  you are forced to quit the process and application and start all over again. Connectivity is another issue, with connection in poor reception area, the application will stop responding even when you have moved into a stronger reception area - this is also frustrating and needs to be addressed by the developers.

name: myCigna
title: Cliff Notes for Health Insurance???
text:
My understanding when given our new health insurance was the online site was for basically selling the policies and such. The app was represented as "for the member."
Over 6 weeks passed as I struggled to locate a new team of doctors when relocating from out of state.  After calling the member number several times, they directed me to the website for physicians and services in my area. My complaint is definitely not the agents at Cigna, those ladies I spoke with went over and above to straighten out a problem and point me in the right direction. 
This app on the other hand is basically cliff notes of general info with no meat and certainly no potatoes!

name: myCigna
title: Access and fax your insurance cards
text:
Having all 4 of my families insurance cards quickly accessible in an app that can then instantly fax any of those cards from INSIDE THE APP is priceless. They just saved my wallet a quarter inch of space. I have had no connectivity issues so far. Aetna and Bluecross, at the time, had no such app- this is considerably better than those providers. User eXperience and UI seem to be given heavy thought. It is very intuitive.

People seem to either give it 5-stars or 1-star.

name: myCigna
title: Works
text: Does what it is supposed to when it is supposed to. Used this for checking claims when the hospital called to collect on something insurance was still processing. I could tell them what was being paid by insurance and details regarding the payment. Helpful when I added my infant and his insurance card wasn't in hand yet so I pulled it up on the app. Not a Cigna fan in general but this app has made it much easier. Now if only I could get what I need timely from their customer service dept.

name: myCigna
title: Extremely useful and easy on the eye
text: This app truly takes me light years ahead of where I was prior to using it regarding my knowledge of my own health insurance. The most useful part to me is the ability to track how close I am to meeting my deductible. Also, extremely useful are seeing any claims (paid/processed/...) as well as having my entire family id card's. I took one star off because the wallet button caused the app to crash twice the two times I used it, but it doesn't have as much useful info on it so it hardly matters.

name: myCigna
title: Worst app ever!
text: Cigna had to fax my Dr for an authorization for a script refill.  I found out 10 days later that the dr either never received the fax or never responded to it.  I called Cigna and was told a letter was sent to inform me of such via snail mail.  I said it could take 2 or 3 weeks to find out the Dr hasn't responded during which time I would run out of meds!!  I was told I could always check the app where I would have seen the letter.  I checked and not true.  Tech support told me they post no letters in the app.  Right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing there!!  Also, the app shows we have 0 orders in the the last 90 days, when we have lots of orders!  Terrible app, terrible customer service!

name: myCigna
title: Decent & Unreliable
text:
Decent:
Surprising amount of physician and medical procedure information is available to the user once one learns where to find it in the application. 

Because the app requires users to log in with their unique name and password, one would expect to be able to see "coverage specific information" to their plan, unfortunately that is not the case; only the more general coverage summaries are available.

Unreliable:
The app is clearly maintained by developers with little experience in large database/mobile app integration. 

When the application does connect it can be very slow, very sloooow. Sometimes inbox will have a message that a section of the app may not be accessible at that time - probably due to upgrades and API development - to be expected given the infrastructure size and various databases being integrated - it's going to be a long haul to get this all working.

Frequently the app can NOT connect at all.

name: myCigna
title: Excellent app - easy to use
text:
For a health insurance company, I was expecting this app to be terribly confusing and not work half the time.
To my surprise, this app functions extremely well and, in some ways, is much easier to use than the website! If you just want to check a claim or balance or even get your card info when you're in an medical facility, this is an extremely convenient option!

I'm very impressed with this app. Too bad car insurance companies are so far behind, Cigna is on the right track!

name: myCigna
title: World Class Cigna Service
text: Cigna is offering world class service to their customers by investing in a multi-dimensional, multi-functional app. Every feature on the mycigna website is readily available on the app, and it all functions quite well. I've never had any technological issues, and I log in at least once a week to search for an in-network provider, check my HSA balance, or review an explanation of benefits for myself or another family member.

name: myCigna
title: Glad to have remote access... but...
text:
A great app for CIGNA customers - and certainly helpful - whenever they stop "tweaking" it and changing the types of data available. Last month's tweak disabled our ability to view our out-of-pocket spending, and while that returned today, it's now impossible to view our Wallet. 

Love that there are so very many sorting options (now that our spending options have popped up again), since sorting by open claims is far easier than skimming through still-processing older claims. It's also a blessing to be able to jump to EOBs on the run - especially at a hospital or doc's office. 

BUT...

Would you just please stop changing key items weekly? Set one day a month to make significant updates - please! It's hard enough to keep up with a critically-ill family member's insurance situation without relearning the app so frequently!

name: myCigna
title: Love it!!!!
text: I really love this app it is easy to read and understand and very helpful finding doctors around the area. I love it the only thing i don't like is that I am not able to see claims from my children since the account is mine and there is no option to see the other people under the same insurance, in another apps you can see all members claims once you log in. Specially if my children can't create an account because they are not old enough. But besides that I'm very happy with a app :)

name: myCigna
title: Login Fails
text:
I have been singing a member for a few years now and this app used to work fine. Recently and trying to login and it gave me a error message and directed me to contact the service department. I contacted them and after a lengthy call was told to wait for response from them. They responded by telling me that my account is still being "Set up" and that I would not be able to use the application until that had been finished. 

This makes no sense as I've been able to use the application in the past and able to log into the website fine. When I informed the service associate of the specs they failed to respond and have left me in limbo.

name: myCigna
title: Love This App
text: It has been very helpful to me lately as I have had many problems with my family claims.  It's been nice to lookup and keep an eye on.  However, since last update, in the app only, I no longer have access to my entire family's history.  I can only see mine, even though it states I have shared access.  Online I am fine.  Also it would be nice to have access to EOBs through the app...maybe in a later version.  Please correct the app so I can see my entire family and have the shared access it shows I should have.  Thanks.

name: myCigna
title: Good, not great
text:
The dental app process provides all the information one needs. It is not hard to use.  However, it could be great if it was not quite so segmented.  Have to go to more places than required to get some basic information.  There should be a summary type page that give all the YTD information regarding processed claims.  Than, should I want details, let me drill down.  

Overall, still a very good app and an easy way to get information.  I will use it because it does the job!

name: myCigna
title: Plz fix the app and reduce the call wait time
text:
Could someone please fix the app? It crashes about 50 percent of the time. Touch ID is very buggy and it requires me click on the password bar to activate it.

It takes at least 3 - 5 seconds for most things to load. The find doctors feature is very difficult to use. It took me forever to add my doctor to the list. I had to scroll for minutes. I could only sort doctors by their names.

I was trying to understand how my HRA account balance was calculated. There's little to no explanation. Actually no explanation why withdraws were made. I decided to call the support number since there were a number of withdraws I just didn't understand. 

The support line is probably the most exasperating part. It used to be super responsive, but I had to wait for 30 minutes before I could speak to a live person. The service person is helpful and nice as always, but the path to get to him was not an experience I want to go through ever again.

name: myCigna
title: Designed to Fail??
text: Just another weak link in the chain.  I'm not sure if this app wasn't tested or is written by an isolated department, but its points of failure are many.  From login, to chat, to storing personal information, to coordinating referrals, to getting accurate information on providers...this software is unreliable!  If one were to follow "conspiracy theory" it seems that CIGNA wants you to fail with this tedious and unreliable process that can damage your information that you've saved elsewhere in the CIGNA system.  Maybe CIGNA doesnt want to pay you and this is a way to mess things up so badly that their process is too difficult to follow or you just give up.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!!

name: myCigna
title: Ok Sometimes
text:
Crap. Every time I try to sign in it tells me sorry try again later. Try again and it logs in. Just stupid! Prescription ordering sounds like a great idea and it would be if I didn't end up having to call Cigna for over half the prescriptions I need to order. Too many say 'Order can't be completed' with no explanation of why. Calling Cigna is even more frustrating than the app, I know, hard to believe. Wish this app just worked, like the Walgreens app, which always worked great for me. Can't use it anymore as Cigna wants to have control of everything. 
Make it work or let me order my prescriptions from Walgreens, please.

name: myCigna
title: Up to date information!
text:
I was looking for my current claims and they all were there including those from five days ago!

Best of all I'm able to store my 12 prescriptions so I don't have to keep writing them down every time I see a new doctor or go to the ER.  So many other great areas within the app I am blown away. I have never had an issue accessing especially from my phone great job!

name: myCigna
title: Comprehensive & Awesome!!
text: Not sure why so many bad reviews. In my opinion, this app is awesome!! It contains everything I thought to look for and more, from claims tracking, HRA account payments and balance, a copy of my ID cards and coverage information. It stores my doctor's info, my health info and much more. This app is quite comprehensive, is quite intuitive and works quite smoothly. It deserves 5 stars without a doubt!!

name: myCigna
title: So much information!
text: The app used to lack in what it was capable of and here in the last year they have really stepped up their game! I love that I can pull up medications right in the doctors office to check them against my coverage so we can decide if a medication is affordable before I leave instead of leaving with it and having a shock at the pharmacy making me have to do a return visit!

name: myCigna
title: New Claim & Prescription Refill
text: I went to Google like normal to get on Cigna website to order a refill, like I have in the past and it said to view the app.  I went crap, I just wanted to order a refill not download an app.  To my surprise, it downloaded fast and I signed on to the website. I am so very impressed with the ease of access to claims, refills, etc.  Thank you for making my life so much easier!

name: myCigna
title: User friendly
text: I really like this app. I've not encountered issues with finding participating doctors but our family doesn't have to go a whole lot. I have used this function and found it helpful. I find it very user friendly and I LOVE being able to monitor claims and deductibles for my family. And thanks so much for having Touch ID! That's always a plus for me.

name: myCigna
title: My incentives
text: I agree with everyone else, the interface is awesome. I haven't explored too much but I have found it difficult to find a doctor. I'm trying to just find a PCP for regular check up! In addition, each time I've tried to check out the incentives it hasn't worked and keeps coming up with the same error message. This has happened on the webpage and through the app. Once these issues are resolved (or there is a how to use video) it'll have 5 stars!

name: myCigna
title: Looms promising:needs work.
text: Layout is very nice, easy to use except I get the feeling it should be able to do more. Nothing auto-populates with your plan information or identification information, no future or past appointment history comes up, no indication of home clinics. I feel that this should be available, perhaps it's a HIPA issue tho. With some work this could be a fantastic app. For now it's a pretty shell: barely functional.

name: myCigna
title: This app does a whole lot to say so little...
text: There are only several functions on this app, track your account balance, check to see if claims are paid and see who you can or cannot make an appointment with. Other than that trying to look up useful information like is a hearing aid covered leads you down an endless loop to know where. I cannot even look up doctors I have used in the past for special needs because their records only let you go back so far.  Sorry I only need a bone dr when I break something and I can't say I see that guy every year...

name: myCigna
title: Good App - Could Use a Few Improvements
text:
It is a nice and handy app that gives you quick access to most things that are on-line. It is nice to be able to view Claims and Refill a Prescription via the app.

I ran into one issue with the app. It would not let me log in even though I was using the correct information. I was able to log in via the web site though without issue. I needed to use the Forgot My Password link in the app and "re-create" my password and then it started working again.

I would also like to suggest that they come out with an iPad version of the app. I would think that there would be one for the iPad by this time. It would also be nice if Touch ID was enabled for signing into the app.

- Merg

name: myCigna
title: Highly useful App
text: I love this app! I can use it anytime anywhere and get claims information, benefit information or anything that I'm looking for at the time. I can go in and check my out-of-pocket maximum and deductible amounts while I'm at the doctors office. That way I don't overpay anyone nor do I underpay. Everybody should use this app because it is really helpful and easy to manage!

name: myCigna
title: Best Insurance App Out There
text: This app is great. It's probably the best insurance app out there. Minimal crashes, incredibly up to date information, and very easy to use. This app provides very useful, decision making, information like: an individual and family deductible tracker, provider directory, flex spending tracker, stored insurance cards, and many other useful features.

name: myCigna
title: Canâ€™t add doctors from directory to built-in contact list???
text: This app might be fine for on-the-co checking of coverage and paperwork, but why on earth would I enter anybody in the â€œCONTACTSâ€� list by hand? I have all my doctors in my regular address book already, so either this app-specific list should allow importing of iOS address book entries, or better yet, have an â€œADD TO CONTACTSâ€� button for each of the doctors in your searchable directory. Right now, I can search for a doctor but canâ€™t save my favorites/search results.

name: myCigna
title: Last ver was better
text: This new version does not show claims as well as the last version or the online web page. It makes a big deal about how much they saved you but you need a calculator to figure out how much you still owe the doctor or lab.  The old paper EOBs showed it better.  Also having issues with it needing to think about pulling up claims. It has hung on me three times so far.  Here is hoping that version 1.6 is better.......

name: myCigna
title: New feature, please!
text: I do love this app as it allows me to easily keep up with claims and charges. However, it would be beneficial if there was a tab for the pre-certification process, so users could easily go into the app and find out where they are in the pre-certification process, as well as find out if there is any missing information that is holding up their approval.

name: myCigna
title: Horrible app
text: I downloaded this app after the website was not working which shouldn't have shocked me that the app doesn't work either. Every time I try to log in it gives me the message to go to the web page or to exit the app. Also the web page doesn't work either. I cannot pull my ID cards, look at claims or find doctors/dentists because the tool bar is missing. We have this company through my husbands work. But I am very disappoint. This app and web site need to be fixed immediately if they want to keep their customers.

name: myCigna
title: Seriously?
text: Seriously? This much function at my fingertips for insurance, what a convenience!!!!!! It's about time! Just downloaded it and browsed through the app and so far I'm giving it 5 stars. Hopefully what I experienced in the few mins I viewed it, it holds up to the functionality of what it appears to be able to.

name: myCigna
title: canâ€™t log in, poor support service
text: concept is great and I was excited to get this but I was never able to log in. Always the same message telling me to call a support number, which I finally did today. After about and hour on the phone and bouncing to 4 different people I was told it was a known problem and the fix was to send a â€œticketâ€� to mobile app support.  Well that â€™s who the was supposed to answer the number I called in the first place. None seemed to know what was going on and worse no one seemed to care. This is crap.

name: myCigna
title: Great App
text: I only have long term disability through Cigna (thank god for that) but this app really helps tremendously. I can track when my monthly payment has been sent. And was able to see when they stopped paying me, and never told me. I like not having to call them to see when my money has been sent.

name: myCigna
title: Same experience as Kikie Horrible App
text:
Just like Kikie, the mycigna web site didn't work. The menu bar was solid blue and my only available options were to view what the site should do and to change my password. So I downloaded the app which is even more useless as I can't log in. All I get is a something went wrong message. It isn't a password problem as I tried a slightly different login password and got a message saying the user name and password combination were in error. The problem lies elsewhere.

Doesn't Cigna test any of their tools?

name: myCigna
title: Outstanding app
text: This app is great!! Eliminates controversy with the doctors office because all the info they need is in the app.  I will never have to worry about what is covered everything is there. BEST YET!!!! The only recommendation would be to tap the drug info from the cost side and tap into the drug contact info in the personal side Hope this makes since!  Great app

name: myCigna
title: Lots of room for improvement
text:
Need finger print login, like the banking APPS. Information need better organization. You can see you medical card, but just a few numbers not a nice graphical card that resembles the printed card you receive.

Every time one visits a medical  office they are asked for the medical card. Need to be able to supply this via the app.

I just started using the APP and it apparent there is a lot of room for improvement.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Does the job, and developers fixed crash issue within a week
text:
Works well to get to most info. One quibble for the one missing star - login & touch ID are still a little flaky, and sometimes have to login and enable Touch ID all over again. It seems to be somewhat related to the app's state when last exited. Killing off the app between launches seems to prevent it. Also it pops up a "Your session has expired" error with a confirm dialog, instead of just prompting for fresh fingerprint as other apps do.

Previously...
Not sure what happened, but after latest update  (4.1) or crashes after login on loading screen. IPhone 6s using touch id login.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Useless
text: None of the information in this app is up to date. I had to switch my primary care physician 3 times because the information on the app was incorrect. I also used the app to find the closest urgent care facility when my wife was feeling ill. Only to get there and be told they only deal with workers comp claims. This app is completely useless. Donâ€™t trust any of the information and call to verify before making any changes or driving to a location that is supposed to accept you as a patient.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Works fine, but lacks basic feature
text: The app is intuitive and allows you to view your cards, but it lacks the ability to rotate your phone horizontally to view the ID card in full widescreen. This should be adjusted so the doctorâ€™s office can easily scan from the phone.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Doesn't crash for me.
text: First time user and was hesitant to download due to all the negative reviews but no crashing for me and it's been really informative and useful. Bill pay would be kind of cool but I use my bank's bill pay anyhow.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Way easier than the desktop website
text: Use this to get everything done instead. Fantastic job UI/UX Team. I found all the immediate help I needed easily and change from one shoddy doc to a better one

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Clean and simple to use
text:
I can hardly remember what the layout was before because this new version is user friendly and easy to navigate. 
Also fast

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Nice app!!! Missing apple wallet add-in...
text: The app is easy to use!!! Looks great and never crashes. Only problem is you canâ€™t add your medical card to Apple Wallet. Iâ€™ve used BCBS of IL in the past and you had the ability to add the card to your wallet. Would be really nice if this app had it.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Best health app
text: Iâ€™ve had 4 different providers in California. This is the best app by far and so far theyâ€™ve blown away the competition in every way.  If you download the app you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Facial Recognition
text:
There is a serious problem with this app. For those of us with facial recognition turned on for login, itâ€™s almost impossible to log out of the application as it immediately logs back in if my face is nearby. 

Every other app I have that uses facial recognition allows me to log out and then I have to choose to login again to use it again. 

Pretty dumb if you ask me.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: I love this
text: I love the app because Iâ€™m able to view my claims and have my ID cards available at all times. The customer service every time I call thru the app is always amazing

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Pharmacy
text: Canâ€™t access pharmacy from I phone or tablets. Get error message.  I have to use laptop or desktop. It worked in January but after an upgrade I havenâ€™t been able to get to the pharmacy page.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Could be better
text: I wish we could pay our bill through this I just switched from having anthem which I liked a bit more just because I was able to pay and schedule payments

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Keep on saying update required
text: The app was great while it was working but now it's keep on saying update required. Clicking on the update button takes me to the App store but the app store shows I am up to date. Going to reinstall and try.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Nice app
text: Makes it easy to look up benefits, find a doctor, get your ID card, review claims, etc. Does everything I need, and no glitches yet. Nice they added in Touch ID log-in.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Ability to pay premium using app
text: Iâ€™d like the ability to pay my monthly premium using the app. Calling, mailing a payment or paying online takes longer and sometimes isnâ€™t convenient. Thank you for considering my suggestion.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Could be Better
text: My gripe is that I canâ€™t pay my bills from the app. Also, I have purchased vision and dental thru blue shield, but since they are linked to separate plan numbers, I donâ€™t see any info in the app about them.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Intuitive, helpful, and easy to use
text: Thanks for creating a helpful app that I understand

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Password/login issues constantly...needs fix
text:
The mobile app or mobile site consistently has logon issues. I use strong passwords generated by the 1Password app. 

Despite creating a strong password for my Blueshield acct, and The Blueshield app and mobile site, accepting the newly created password, login always always says its wrong ALL THE TIME! 

Its not user error as i copy and pasted the correct password on the desktop site and no problem logging into Blueshield.

Something weird is going on.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Not allowed to paste your password in.
text: Seriously why?

name: Blue Shield of California
title: App does not process commands
text: Canâ€™t even get through the first screen of registration as none of the drop down menus function correctly. Restarted phone and had same issue.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: App is improving
text: I like the new functionality

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Easy App
text: Easy to use, beats waiting 30 on the phone.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Ron
text: Very easy to use and fast to get around in thank you

name: Blue Shield of California
title: iPhone X : when you log in the main page screen...
text: iPhone X : when you log in the main page screen shows for 1 second and logs off immediately. Also why cant we make payments via e-mail the app?

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't make payment through the app

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Kind of Pointless
text: Every time I try to search for a doctor or urgent care, it says no results. Even I change it to a 100 mile radius. I end up having to use the website anyway, so the app is really a waste of time.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Summary of Benefits in Spanish
text: The 10 page Summary of Benefits link opens a doc thatâ€™s only in Spanish. Is there an English language version available?

name: Blue Shield of California
title: The one useful function doesnâ€™t work
text: Even while connected to WiFi, the app does not show any doctors near me. I deleted it and will stick with the website (which is also more trouble than its worth).

name: Blue Shield of California

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Payment
text:
I love to know my clams, but more useful will be to be able to pay your bill. 
Otherwise I almost never gonna use this app.

name: Blue Shield of California

name: Blue Shield of California

text: Keep up the good work!

name: Blue Shield of California

text: I really wish Face ID was integrated.

name: Blue Shield of California
