text: Birthday will not accept any data entry

name: Blue Shield of California
title: app crash
text: The app crashes on tapping an annotation on the map.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: The Blue Shield Miracle
text:
I used to be able to get to Blue Shield's full site on my iPhone. This is no longer possible. No matter how I try I am continually rerouted back to the app. You can't pay your monthly premiums from the app, so I have to make a trip to the library where they have regular computers.  Blue Shield has been unresponsive to my emails regarding this or any other issues. Diagnosis: Coma. 

Addendum: A day after I wrote the above review I discovered that the app won't let me in! Blue Shield must have taken it off life support. Called death of Mr. App at 7:44 am.

A day later while resting in the morgue Mr. App came back to life! It's a miracle! Can now view ID card, view plan summary, view claims, find urgent care and find a provider, but alas he still won't let me pay my monthly premium or transfer to the full site. Maybe in his next reincarnation he will be endowed with these features.

And then behold in the following weeks a transformation of unbelievable dimensions occurred. It was possible to transfer to the main site and pay my premium!

And I was happy and celebrated with dances and song while feasting on the best cuts of meat and delicious wines with all my friends and neighbors.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: CrapApp? Less crappy.
text:
After signing up on the web I downloaded the app on my iPhone. I tried a dozen times to sign into my account and it kept telling me my user name and password didn't match their records. Finally it allowed me in and showed the correct ID numbers. But when I try to do anything all I get is an error message. They have a lot of fixing to do on this app.

Update:  not so crappy now. Everything seems to work ok, for what it does. Main thing it's missing, for me anyway, is a link to Blue Shield's mail order pharmacy, which is the main thing I wanted it for.  So I can't get a quick update on the status of Rx refills. Not a biggie. I suppose the app would be useful when you're out of town so that you could find participating doctors or hospitals.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Doctor Information is hard to find
text:
Ok it's really annoying that you log in, the page shows what your plan is , then when you do a doctor or facility search to find a doctor within network, it lists every doctor, not those that specifically take you plan( even though it seems like it is searching for doctors within your network) 
You have to then do a separate search within  that search to see what plans that doctor accepts. So if you are not careful, even if you get the doctors name from the app, they still may not take your insurance. What is the point of that? The whole point of the search is to find doctors within you coverage network!

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Lousy Application
text:
1. What is the point of telling users to create secure, difficult to guess passwords and then not permitting the users to copy from a security application and past into the app? This just makes people go to simple, easy-to-type passwords.

2. After finally getting logged in, why tell Medicare Supplement customers they have to log in through Safari? Edit your app description in the store to indicate it isn't usable for Medicare patients.

Bad planning and programming.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Doesn't allow you to paste your password
text: Given the age we live in and more importantly the recent data breech that Blue Cross Blue Shield just endured it is extremely important to use complex unique passwords for all of our online world. Including our health insurance accounts. For that many of us turn to other programs to remember these passwords. All other applications I use allow me to access my password application, copy the password, and paste it into the password box. This app doesn't allow you to do that. So I'm stuck flipping back and forth between my password app and this stupid app trying to transcribe my unique 30 character password for this account. Huge inconvenient waste of time.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: App is So very Slow
text: The app is pretty cool as far as healthcare companies go. However, it is very very slow. After you put in your username/password (why can't this be remembered or use Touch ID?) and tap the blue 'Log In' button, it takes you to the main screen w/ 4 green boxes, but the 'thinking' pinwheel literally takes 1:08:60 until you can actually use the app. After it finally loads and you tap, for example, the ID card button, when you go back to the main screen it again takes 1:00:30. It's not network speed. It is far too slow and needs to be fixed.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't paste a password or use 1password
text:
The app is actually quite good once you log in. But, in what has got to be one of the worst advised security measures ever, you can't paste a password and there's no integration with password managers. So you're forced to use a weak password for your most sensitive data or spend many minutes typing a complicated auto generated password.

For the love of god fix this, at least integrate with password mangers. This feature has been available in iOS for 6 months and not using it shows an active malice towards your users. It's infuriating that I have no choice other to than to keep using a company that is so careless.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: This app DOES allow you to paste password at login
text:
Almost didn't bother downloading the app due to a review below that claimed the app prevented pasting passwords into the login field. I just successfully logged in with no problems whatsoever. I pasted a long, complex password from my eWallet app. I'm using an iPhone 6s on iOS 10.2 

So far the app appears to be very well designed. Haven't vetted it thoroughly but wanted to clarify the above information.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Horrible login experience
text:
I use unique passwords everywhere. I can't remember them all. So I use a well known password app to help me maintain those passwords. Now, I am trying to use your app on a mobile device. Why do you assume I will be in front of a computer to look at my password to enter it in the password field of the login page? 

I should be able to copy my password from the tool I use and paste it into the login screen. Unfortunately, if I switch back and forth, you clear out the field as soon as I try to start typing again when I come back to your app. This is a horrible mobile experience.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Works well if you have half a brain
text:
This app. Is very useful for reviewing your plan, ID card, finding a doctor. All the links work well. 
I was able to sign in without a problem- navigate all the tabs to find the vital information I was looking for. 
My only suggestion to the developers of this is a link to a payment/ billing system. It would also be nice to include a billing/ payment history tab as well.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Still very slow!
text: Update after update, once you put in your login and password (neither of which the app will save) it takes up to 1 minute, even on the fastest wifi, to finally log you in and let you access your info. Once you do, navigating around the app also is quite slow. Surely they can do better. Also, time to...get with the times, and create an ID card that can go into Apple Passbook.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Sooooooo sllllllooooooooowwwww
text:
1) The app takes forever to load anything. I usually just need to get to my ID card, and this takes upwards of 30s - 1min each time,
2) I can't paste my password in the Password field, which makes it impossible to use in a secure way with a password locker (I have had to use an easy to remember, generic password against the advice of pretty much everyone)
3) Please support Apple Wallet/Passbook. I usually just need to get to my ID card, and launching the app is painful. If I could just store the ID card in wallet, it would save me a lot of time.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't make payments?!
text:
There is no functionality in place to make a payment in this app. This is a HUGE oversight, especially since their online payment is jacked up and doesn't work, and their phone line just hangs up after a recorded message saying there are not enough agents to take your call--not even an option to hold! 
Paying through the app is the most important functionality for me, because I would like to pay my bill please. Since when do insurance companies not make taking our money a #1 priority???

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Love this redesigned BSCA mobile app
text: Great job BSCA mobile appDev team, really cool app view insurance card in app and Touch ID enabled and I'd love to see pay bill feature re-enabled with integrated to PayPal or apple/android pay/credit/debit card features, also I'd love see SSO enabled for dental/version app features, thanks for delivering this mobile app.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: QT
text: I think the users who report all of the PW issues might not be using the right phone or are trying to use shortcuts. I have an iPhone and the app works great. I put a PW 'key' on my phone to remind me what's ps is & I just type it in. Not all 'shortcuts' are a good idea. I'm just saying....  Otherwise, I love that my info is at my fingertips.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Missing navigation
text:
Upon opening the app for the first time, I was asked to either create account or sign in. I thought I had an account so proceeded to choose sign in. After the login failed I attempted to go back to create an account - which proved very difficult as there were no breadcrumbs for me to go back or options in the hamburger menu.

Closing the app didn't work either.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Loads Forever
text:
The app loads forever while logging me in, then loads forever once I get into the app. Once I finally get in, it works pretty well and the update is nice. 

Three stars for the speed and for the app icon. In the App Store it's really nice, but once I download it, the icon is a black background with a white key. It's ugly and I don't like it. No clue why it's different than what it shows in the App Store, but I want it fixed.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Beautiful in Function and Design
text: This app truly has one of the best design/navigation layouts. Navigating through the site and transitioning through the features is quick and easy. Much improved over the previous version of this app.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: I'd give this app 0 stars if I could If you're going to make a Blue Shield app, don't make a BS app
text:
All I want to do with this app is pay my bill. Should that be so hard? Well the "pay bill" only leads to a page where I can actually do it half the time because the other half my "information is unavailable" 

To top it off u have to sit here and with a good 10 minutes for the app to even load the home page. 

If you're going to make a Blue Shield app, don't make a BS app

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Great app
text: This app is very user friendly. I really like the Touch ID feature since I have so many social media accounts and tend to forget my usernames and passwords. Also really like how convenient it is to check my past claims.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't pay dues on the app anymore
text:
Before the update you used to be able to pay your bill. Now I can't, I have to go to the website. That was one of my favorite things. Kind of annoying. PLEASE ADD THE ABILITY TO PAY MY BILL AGAIN! 
 However, I love that I can now view the entire insurance card and easily order a new one when I lose mine.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: If you have Blue Shield of Ca you need to get this app
text: I think it's great that I can carry my health info on my iPhone. It's great when it travel for finding an place for urgent care.  It's better than my last health ins. that didn't have anything like this. I can't wait to see it get better and better.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Does not work... Crashes every time!!
text: This app simply does not work at all.  Within several seconds of logging in, the app completely freezes with the dial in the middle of the screen spinning around and nothing else working.  I closed the app and logged in again 3 times and the same issue happened each time.  Please fix this ASAP or pull the app because it is completely useless as it is right now.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Serious flaw makes it unusable
text: For anyone with a complex password, this app is essentially unusable as it DOES NOT allow the user to paste the password from the password manager, and it does not support logging in using the fingerprint sensor. As such, I either have to create a weak password that I can remember and easily type in, or not use this app on a mobile device.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: A complete embarrassment
text:
This is truly one of the most godawful apps I've ever used. I would rather breakdance naked over shards of broken glass than ever log into this monstrosity again. Can't paste in my password, making it insecure. Doesn't save my login name. No Touch ID support. No way to display your ID card or save to Passbook. Design is grotesque and responsiveness is awful.

Fire your entire team. Hire someone who actually owns an iPhone. Try again.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Thinking that anger tends to follow user error
text: Works fine for me, i can view all my claims and providers i have used. It takes a little long to load the initial page. Using an iPhone 5c

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Good, but needs some improvement
text: I like your app but "Remember me" feature doesn't work. Fix it and everything will be perfectly fine.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: To be bad at everything, now that's a skill.
text: It is not enough to be one of the worst health care providers, but now they have to be the worst software developers too. Disabling cut and paste for login credentials...really? Now users can't use complicated passwords and tools like lastpass to manage their login credentials. Guess, I'll never really know just how bad the app is as I am not about to manually enter a 20 character password to login and find out.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Redefines "App"
text: What is the point of having an app if much of what one wants to do online (like anything bill related) is redirected to website that doesn't work with mobile device? The rest of the functions are as iffy as the actual website. I suppose it could be excused by saying that Blue Shield is so devoted to excellent health care coverage that they don't invest in having a strong and functional mobile app/Internet presence...but, um....

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Don't waste your time
text:
This app hasn't worked from the day I downloaded it.... Once your log in, it takes up to 5 minuets to "update" information then gives you a message "information can. It be updated at this time"... Try to look where you are on deductible, nothing ever comes up...   

Update this app soon so it works correctly and the ability to use Touch ID..

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Improvements necessary
text: This app is a bit useless, can they please add a 'card' file so I won't have to carry my insurance card around with me. I'm not sure why this app always log out of my account and why it can't save my user ID like someone will steal this information from my phone? Come on Blue Shield fix this app and improve it asap...

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Keeps getting better!
text: Great to have TouchId added. Makes the experience much better. Love the little sayings upon login. This app keeps getting better. Nice job!

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Fantastic Upgrade!
text: Great new design and interface. Now I can manage my claims, get my ID card and find my doctor  without having to use my laptop

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Worked well for me
text: I didn't have any problems with getting a list of doctors in my area or bringing up my claims or the copy of my insurance card...and my iPhone 4 can be pretty slow sometimes. ðŸ˜Š

name: Blue Shield of California
title: worst app ever
text: half like options you click on take you to website that doesn't give you options for what you clicked on - click pay bill & nowhere is the option to actually make a monthly premium payment - nor can I find anywhere on website from mobile - incredibly frustrating

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Little to no help for Blue Shield subscribers.
text: This app sits there and spins.  Finding a provider is almost worthless in my experience.  I spent another hour on the phone with customer service reps who were about as helpful as this app.  Shows that the BS system has consistency- too bad for all of us customers it is consistent in poor quality.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't paste in password field
text: I have complex passwords that I store in a password manager. Usually I copy it from 1Password to paste in a login form, but the people making this app decided they would disallow pasting in the password field. Well, now I'm not gonna go in and manually type in my complex password, thanks a lot. Almost as bad as banks not allowing me to paste an account number.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Finally!
text: Simple and Easy to navigate, since finding a physician took only minutes compared to the antiquated website which is in dire need of a complete overhaul. Hooray for Touch ID!

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Works great
text: Just downloaded it, signed in without any problem, seems to be working fine.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Does not work if you have Covered CA
text:
I haven't gotten this application to ever work. The website logs in just fine. When using this app with the same credentials, it just says login not found and boots you back to the front page. 

Seems like blue shield has a two tired system for those with ACA and people thorough private company coverage â€¦ totally worthless.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Great improvement
text: There are a few things I'd love to see (like a link to the full website), but almost everything I really need when I'm on the go is here!  Great upgrade!

name: Blue Shield of California
title: No password paste
text: Without the functionality of pasting into the password field to log in, having long, secure passwords makes it impossible to use this app without the long and tedious process of looking up and typing. Please fix this and make it compatible with 1Password.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: I am scared to use this thing
text: After reading all the reviews, and suffering misery on the website, I am thinking, this must be worse. The website has improved, Iâ€™ll give BSCA that. But the guy who said they are stuck in the 90s was being a bit cruel. They are simply stuck in 2005. : (

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Holy cow! Awful
text: This app is too slow and too quirky to be believed. But it doesn't surprise me. Blue Cross Blue Shield does it really matter? The only thing these insurance companies are interested in is their profits. They don't care about our health why should they care about the app they give us! I wish there was an alternative to having to buy health insurance at all.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Terrible in emergencies!
text:
I got multiple login errors while trying to login with one arm in the ambulance the only times you need this app.. you really need it and or course, it doesn't work. Spent 10 minutes loading for me to come back to it and have me logged out already...

Fix this app, it is very important.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Doesn't work...
text: "Connection Problem" "Please check your network connection and try again".... full service bars & wifi. No problem connecting to mobile site (which is frustrating to use with its unreasonable homepage load times and minimal functionality). Get your **** together BS of CA.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Possibly the Worst App I've ever used
text: The app can't remember what data it had 10 seconds ago. Any return to home page locks up the app with a spinner on screen while it refreshes the data. The back button on the ID card display is too small, making it hard to exit that display.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Canâ€™t cut and past password
text: I use 1 password app now for all passwords and your app does not allow me to cut and paste the password. Either change that or come up with another solution. Use touchID, allow to remember password (bad one) or integrate into 1password app extension. This is a big pain and I can not stand logging into your app.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Doesn't work
text:
This app is just a thin wrapper around the blue shield ca website, which doesn't work on iPhones in safari. After logging in, you get a spinner that turns forever, blocking you from using the site.

Disabling paste for passwords just adds insult to injury, since it makes using a password manager extremely cumbersome.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Really great app!
text: Very informative, well designed and useful app. All information related to your healthcare plan is available at your finger tip.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: The most awesome app
text: Blue shield has done an incredible job of getting so much information inside this app. The app is really awesome.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Slow and inaccurate
text: Gives me doctors in my search that don't take my insurance plan.  This can cost you a LOT of money. Also very slow app when you login you have to wait minutes to be able to do anything.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Fast App & Improved UI
text: New improved UI - very user friendly. App doesn't crash anymore

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Excellent
text: Amazing update. Now I can easily access all my information

name: Blue Shield of California
title: What a Waste
text: NOTHING on this app ever works. Thank god the doctors in the network aren't as crappy. If you're going to have an app, freaking maintain it and make it functional. Don't offer a bunch of features that never work. Don't bother wasting the space on your device for this poor excuse of anything useful.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Great Upgrades
text: Touch ID was a great addition. Plus, I can all my claims and benefits within the app. Great design overall!

name: Blue Shield of California
title: ADeveloper
text: Just uninstalled this app. Note to development staff: you need to test apps before you put them into production.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Able to log in,
text: Able to log in, and nothing else. It gets to the page and a loading icon never goes away, and nothing can be clicked on. The website, on the desktop at least, is also horrendous.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Garbage
text: 90% of your users are probably looking for urgent care.  Show us an urgent care that is open now and is compatible with our particular plan. Right now the app is mostly useless. Bonus: app doesn't save your ID card so if the site is down you can't find your member number.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Does not locate providers
text: App is advertised as being able to locate providers. After login and entering all search criteria it sends you to the website (!) while logging you out and deleting all search criteria. This is not even a beta version. Please remove from App Store.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Installation fix
text: After a failed install attempt I restarted the phone and reinstalled. This fixed the issue. App works. 3 stars for this. The app itself seems good enough.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: So much better!
text: So much better!  Loads fast. Easy to navigate

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Can't log in - no pasting
text:
No paste for user name and password field means no log in for people using password vaults.  But that's okay, there was any much interest in password vaults, so why support them with allowing pasting interesting fields.

It's not like anyone would acquire a password vault company for $110 million, right?

name: Blue Shield of California

text:
Design has improved, but functionality needs to follow.

Log in still fails intermittently (the previous version was useless-could not even log in).

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Worthless

title: Poor

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Stuck Logging In

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Loads Forevevrrrr...... And ever......!
text:
This app is not very useful for the productive life. It takes way too long to load.

Update: Would make this better is if you would add "one touch" sign in for Apple mobile devices. It is far easier to sign in with your thumb print.

name: Blue Shield of California

The previous version of this app had its flaws and was pretty basic, but this version is a joke. I cannot even log in. Yes, I checked and rechecked my credentials, reset my password, etc etc etc. 

Did you even bother to beta-test???

name: Blue Shield of California
title: USELESS

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Garbage
text:
Complete garbage. Does not get past first page after log in. Embarrassing and shameful a top tier medical insurance company has such a pathetic tool for their clients. 

Just discovered their app support link is also not working. Paying almost $500 for monthly insurance and this is what Blue Shield provides.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: They killed my original review!
text:
I used to have a laundry list of things I found wrong with this app. Every time an update came out, I simply reposted the same reviewâ€”no edits were necessary because none of my complaints were ever addressed (yes, I checked each time).

Well, they finally did something about itâ€”they deleted my entire review from the App Store! Classy. 

Here's the long and short of it: learn to love the blueshieldca.org website on your desktop browser, because the same website is far inferior in Mobile Safari, and this app is even more inferior than using the website in Mobile Safari.

name: MyHumana
title: Great @ feedback
text:
For starters the bug that was mentioned by other users about the digital ID not saving to photos appears to be fixed even though it was not mentioned in the last update notes. 

This developer is incredibly responsive and open / receptive to feedback. I requested the option to save my digital ID to the â€œwallet appâ€� and the developer was very open about the request and was told it is on the roadmap. 

I know app design is more difficult than most users realize but this team appears to be sincerely devoted to improving their app.

name: MyHumana
title: Great but would benefit from more features!
text:
Hello Humana and Dev team,

Your app is solid overall but lacks some key features. Here is some feedback for features I think customers would benefit from:

- Ability to mark claims as Paid, Unpaid. Would also be nice to have a notes section that customers can flag certain bills to set up a personal payment plan with their budgets.
- Filters for the above suggestion i.e. filtering paid, unpaid, you may owe, flagged, noted, last 30/60 days, last 6 months, current year, previous year
- Prescriptions section that lists any drug prescriptions given to patient by care giver. When the prescription was filled, etc.
-The ability to add/view accounts associated with medical bills like HSA, DCFSA, OptiMed accounts, etc.
- Pay in app feature with above suggested accounts through something like Instamed or other comparable companies.
- Integration with smart devices (FitBit, Apple Watch, etc). I envision a simple step tracker that ties to "feel good" push notifications and maybe paired with some Humana promotions/rewards.
-Ability to show customers which care providers are in-network vs. out-of-network when using the "Find Care" tab. If all are in-network, there should be a message present stating this for better understanding.

Thanks for the current features, looking forward to continued updates and new features to be added for a better customer experience!

- Kyle Heaton

name: MyHumana
title: Useless app, just like the website.
text: I do not have a health insurance with Humana, I have a group short term disability insurance via my work with Humana . First of all, its website: It is hard to figure out how to file a claim from the web after breezy steps of setting up an account. It almost feels like Humana is discouraging you from making claims. Then,  there is not a single phone number you could call and ask on the web until I found the claim form for Express Maternity. Now, this app: I downloaded this app because I was so impressed with other apps related to my maternity leave. However, what a disappointment. At least Humana web site said I do not have a claim history. But the app said I no longer have an insurance with Humana. What???? I deleted this embarrassing app immediately. Whoever worked on Humana's web and app should be ashamed of themselves.

name: MyHumana
title: Totally useless..just like your website
text: I downloaded the app because the website was constantly timing out when I tried to price my prescriptions.  So I downloaded the app, was impressed by the clean looking and user friendly interface, quickly found the "medication pricing" section, attempted to search three different medications and instantly got a pop up on each search that says "bad request". Come on Humana..if you're going to offer this tool to your paying members, make it work. I never normally leave reviews but after the time I wasted not only with your app but your website too, I'm annoyed and could have been doing something much more productive than sitting in front of the screen getting no help.

name: MyHumana
title: Not really an app
text: You know when you get a "General exception" while trying to get your messages that the App is nothing more than a "me too!" effort in app coding. Worthless for everything else as well except seeing what your plan is called. Can't even change your own address, have to email them specifics and ask them to do it. But hey, it's an insurance company. They're only interested in finding ways to minimize their expenses or even to deny payment entirely. Can't even access you Humana email, which is only slightly less useful than the incredibly bad web site email system they've concocted. There should be a law that insurance companies make their sites and apps useful and accessible. But that would cost insurance companies money and Congress won't allow that.

name: MyHumana
title: No Words can describe it
text:
I share the sentiment of those frustrated by this garbage of an app. Their enrollment system is even worse. If I had a decent job and made more money, I would never buy this useless health insurance policy. 
Humana is the Best Worse Health Insurance company I have seen in my Almost 50 years of life. What good is paying for am insurance policy that you can't use due to their system flaws? It takes them an amazing 15 months to update a members residential address. It takes more than 6 months for them to change you PCP, but the worse part is that neither request have been completed yet. I figure they will update my info sometime in the future when I am no longer a member. They should be called: Humana Uninsurance.

name: MyHumana
title: Disappointed and upset
text: I tried to pay online on their website and I couldn't because the system wouldn't let me update my payment info. I tried using the app and the system wouldn't recognize my password. I tried to change my password on the website and it didn't allow me to change it. I tried registering again and it wouldn't let me either. HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO PAY?? I am so upset, frustrated, and disappointed.. I am calling tomorrow to cancel my humana membership. Don't want to deal with this EVER again. I would give it ZERO stars, but I don't have that option in the rating system.

name: MyHumana
title: Good App

I like having everything that was on the 6 page print out they sent me every month on my iPad. The only thing I would also like is how much I am paying. I get an email that says I can go to Humana's web site and see the bill, but I have not found it. It just shows the same things as the app shows. I can only tell what I am paying by what comes out of my checking account.
Susan Hughes

Personally, I think that it is a fantastic app!

I contacted Humana about this problem, and their IT department relayed the following: "I have discussed the matter with the Information Technology team and it was determined that the problem does not lie with the application.  It was suggested that you speak with your phone service carrier to determine where the problem may be."

Really? Come on!  I suggest skipping this app.

name: MyHumana
title: Humana options
text: Humana employees their website that salute Lee terrible they sent the stuff that we didn't even order and we never got the stuff that we did order this is just horrible in there should be some kind of stand or sit there help to us is our second time we've tried them set a few things got better but most of it got worse forget the website although when you call them they'll tell you you need to use the website no way what a wait what a ripğŸ‘�

name: MyHumana
title: Great health insurance app
text: I love the Humana App. It's easy to view my coverage info and deductibles. I love the fact I can get drug pricing in the app and also see what prescriptions my plan covers. You can also view your ID cards easily and fax them to any number directly within the app.

name: MyHumana
title: Humana App
text: What an improvement over the previous version!! I was not able to log into my previous app on Monday. I would strongly suggest experimenting with this version after logging in so as to become familiar with all of the features.

name: MyHumana
title: Love it.
text: Easy to use app. Simple and right to the point. Much better than my old insurance app for blue cross, and the app makes everything much easier to do. Can look for doctors, look up prices of medicine, look at your ID card. Just a good app all around.

name: MyHumana
title: Great for checking claims and sending messages
text: I love that I can send a message ans get a quick response from customer support,  I can check claims and know when I have been overcharged at the doctors office I don't have to wait for any mail 3-4 weeks everything is there usually in 2-3 days!

name: MyHumana
title: Worthless
text: Its a piece of crap. All you can do is look up doctors/ facilities in network thats it. I liked the older version better, you cant do much on this app. I cant look at details as to what applied towards deductibles. i cant see my entire benefits in details either. I am unable to pay my monthly premium thru the app because it says that my ebilling is not set up on the app but when i click ebilling theres nothing there, it gives me this exact same message.

name: MyHumana
title: A Medical App I Like
text: This App I Like. It provides information on coverage I actually have. I am able to my prescription claims that have been filled. Accurate and timely. Anyone with Humana should have this app on their smartphone. I highly recommend it!

name: MyHumana
title: Completely worthless
text: I have a Humana account through work, and I would love to know how much I have in my HSA, but I can't find in the app. I used to be able to see it easily, but not anymore. So, I go to the Humana website, and still am unable to see it. Of course their automated computer system won't tell me how much I have, and they keep poor office hours.  Very unfriendly app to use. Guess that goes hand in hand with their other customer service products.

name: MyHumana
title: Unacceptable
text:
**Update**

New app update still doesn't allow me to log in.  App is a joke, great way to waste a few minutes of your life.

Why why would a good company with resources allow their name to be associated with such failure?  This app doesn't inspire my confidence at all.  I'm shopping for another carrier as we speak.  What other corners does Humana cut if they don't take seriously their customers accessibility to PAID plans.  Where's the quality control,   oversight, accountability?  Unacceptable.

name: MyHumana
title: Very impressive
text: You can do most everything that you would go to the website for like refilling mail order prescriptions. Much better than the last version.

name: MyHumana
title: Login Fails on iPhone and iPad mini
text:
I attempted to log into the updated version of this app for the past week.  Whenever I attempt to log into the app, the following message is displayed:

Your coverage could not be loaded at this time.  Please try again.

I deleted, then re-installed the app on my iPhone.  I attempted another login, only to see the same error message.  I disabled the Touch ID feature on my iPhone, hoping that the login was successful.  Sad to say, the login still failed.

I then attempted to log into this app on my iPad mini.   The same error message appeared.  I am certain it is the app because I am able to log into my HumanaVitality app and MyHealth by Humana app.   Please repair this problem so this app can be used again.

name: MyHumana
title: 5 out of 6 reviews are clearly fake/paid
text: Neither the website not this app work as they should. I turned to the app when the website was leading me in circles and can't even log in due to 'server overload' issues.  Next time you guys should aim for more realistic phony health insurance app reviews. Nobody, and I mean nobody, is going to shout "Thanks Humana!" while giving this basic app 5 stars...even if it did work...which it doesn't.  Thanks (for nothing) Humana!

name: MyHumana
title: Never has worked but lots of promises
text: You Just have to wonder if anyone actually tests this app ? I keep trying it and always get the same message " data not available presently ; please try later " it would be really useful to have my data in hand while at the doctors office but I give up. I guess the idea for Humana is to say they have an app and it sounds good. Maybe Aetna will get a real working app after buyout ? You can only hope. Lol

name: MyHumana
title: Helpful while you're out.
text: This Humana App is perfect when you are out & you need to check your benefits quickly or if you have misplaced your insurance card. This App is easy to use and up to date. I highly recommend this App for all Humana subscribers.

name: MyHumana
title: Not an improvement
text: Not really an improvement over the prior app. Harder to find the medication refill section. I had finally taught my mom to refill her medications on her iPad and they pull the iPad version and prevent you from installing the iPhone version. They encourage using the web browser but the rightsouce website isn't ipad optimized and not user friendly on an iPad. Someone really didn't think any of this through.

name: MyHumana
title: Could be so much better...
text: This app shows info on our coverage and claims.  But, the provider list function doesn't work.  If I need to know the closest urgent care facility or hospital on my provider list, it would be great if I could consult this app.  The app doesn't find any providers near me at all - even while at my house - which is definitely not true.  Please fix!!!!!!

name: MyHumana
title: So far...So good!
text: Everything I've needed or wanted to check out have been easy to access on this app.  Has been helpful from ID cards for not only medical, but dental and vision. I can see exactly what I've paid to date on my medications, claim status âœ….

name: MyHumana
title: Worked for me
text: Not sure what issues everyone else is having but I had no problems logging in. However, my spouse needs to authorize the sharing of her info again in order for her info to appear on my app.

name: MyHumana
title: Great app
text: Very intuitive. Easy to pay premiums. Easy to access card. So far beyond BCBS app I had with last year's coverage that I can hardly believe it's for the same product category.

name: MyHumana
title: Register link is broken.
text: Seriously. What good is this garbage app if you can't even register to use it from inside the app. When clicking register, it brings you to the option to click "not a member" which keeps reloading the same useless page. How does a multi-billion dollar company not trouble shoot basic stuff like this?! Way to go having the hard paying & suffering public do QA on your hack job. Grade: F

name: MyHumana
title: Employee of Humana. Still hate this
text: This app is mostly unfunctional. Rarely retrieves pertinent information when wanted. Login can even be troublesome. The interface with the wellness component (if you have Vitality available) is clunky and makes me just put the phone down in frustration. Hire an external, professional UX team, Humana. I love that you want to employ your own people and provide opportunity of growth, but this is seriously hurting the company.

name: MyHumana
title: Great tool for your Humana benefits!
text: Easy to use and a great tool to keep track of claims and prescriptions. Also has a feature to view your ID card.  Glad I added this app!

name: MyHumana
title: Must have!!
text: If you're a current Humana member... You need to download this app. Easy to use, easy to navigate and very useful when it comes to looking up your claims and participating doctors.

name: MyHumana
title: What's the point?
text: Being told I could access (and fax) my member ID card info through the app sounded like a great idea, only to find that the card isn't available through the app and to check my plan for coverage? Wait... So only 'special' plans get to access their member ID cards? Also, doctor and hospital finder doesn't work. Pointless unless ALL functions are available to ALL members.

name: MyHumana
title: Great App
text: I am able to keep up with my health and what is covered under my plan without having to go to my policy for basic information

name: MyHumana
title: Only good for ID
text:
I have Humana Vision Care and have just downloaded this app hoping to see, at minimum, my plan's coverage outlined and at best perhaps a digital image of my ID card. Hope has failed me in this case-

I gave it 2 (two) stars because at least I could get the policy number and I attempted to fax policy information to my eye dr. (They haven't received it yet...)

name: MyHumana
title: Seems great to me
text: Lots of nice features. Loved ability to see claims, even down to the line item details and what was applied toward deductible. Looking up drug pricing is also key.

name: MyHumana
title: My Humana
text: Great app, both in connivence and accountability. By checking my claims, when a doctors office presented me a bill for a previous service, knew instantly it was incorrect. The Humana app showed claim was paid in full.

name: MyHumana
title: Image Scanning doesn't work
text: I love the idea of taking a picture of my receipts but I called in today and the contact center rep said nothing came through so I need to fax it instead. Keep trying! Also I shouldn't need to hit sign in once I've done it once. Simply use TouchId to log me in and save me the sign in button press every time.

name: MyHumana
title: Crashes when...
text:
The app crashes when you try to use the Drug Pricing feature. The app allows you to enter the drug, strength, and quantity, but crashes once it attempts to search. 

I like seeing all the other information available about my plan. 

Only 2 stars till an update is released.

name: MyHumana
title: Perfect
text: This update is absolutely perfect. Really simple yet beautiful. Much easier to navigate and I love how you can pay your statement straight from this app. Thumbs up.

name: MyHumana
title: Much improved!
text: This new version is much easier to use and much simpler than the old app. Easy access to all my info. Thanks Humana!

name: MyHumana
title: Current version does not support Humana military
text: In 2013, I was able to us this app, but current version does not let me log in. I have Humana military insurance. I can log in online on a computer, but not in the app. Their website is not optimized for a phone screen so I can not access my info on the go.

name: MyHumana
title: Unable to log into app
text:
I have tried to log into my account using this app, and I see the following message:

Your coverage could not be loaded at this time.  Please try again later.

I have seen this error message for the past two updates.  This is seen when using the app on iOS 9.3.5 and iOS 10.0.1.  Please fix this!!!

name: MyHumana
title: Well thought-out!!!
text: Great app!  Very user friendly, necessary information where you need it when you need it. Thanks!!!

name: MyHumana
title: Great Job
text: Interface is fast and simple.  Keep up the good work.  Looking forward as other features are released.

name: MyHumana
title: Work in Progress
text:
One step forward, two steps back. 
1. It has locked me out of my account (Touch ID notwithstanding), and won't let me paste new password from password manager. I think this used to work. 
2. The app (and the web site) needs to include approvals WITH SPECIFICS. Why do I need to call to get this info?

name: MyHumana
title: Broken
text:
As with most financial services apps, Humana confuses inconvenience with security, specifically, no ability to stay signed in and a (apparently purposely) disabled Paste function in the password field. 

I use 1Password to manage all logins & credentials. This permits me to use unique, generated, complex passwords for each site and app. This also means that I need to copy and paste my password from 1Password into MyHumana. 

Since your app doesn't permit that, I have two choices: don't use the app, or choose a weak, easily memorable password. Guess which one I choose. 

You're weakening security by treating your users like incompetent children. Stop it.

name: MyHumana
title: Great company - Great App
text: I have never been more satisfied with an insurance company than I am with HUMANA. The app is great and contains all the info you can possibly need at sign-on!! Way to go HUMANA - I'm a customer for life!

name: MyHumana
title: They fixed my only complaint
text: I can paste my password now!  Thank you for addressing my only concern about this app!

name: MyHumana
title: No maps no way link the address!
text: It need a lot of improvement even the basic how you can get a list of locations and not be able to map the address to get to the place? Is this to practice memory? LOL. Applications does nothing different than a paper flyer. Developers do something smart, we are paying your bills.

name: MyHumana
title: Security issues
text: I've had multiple issues being locked out of my account, and the digital service both app and website are an endless loop to get to customer service you always end up having to call the 800 number and spend 30 minutes on the phone. Not cool

name: MyHumana
title: Anderson
text: I really like this because it's easy use and I have no problems at all looking into my account.

name: MyHumana
title: Awesome App
text:
So easy to navigate around. The Rx app allows for touch screen access. The only thing needed in this app is the touch screen log in. 
App is so much better than other health insurance carriers.

name: MyHumana
title: Love love love
text: I love having the app so I can check out insurance anywhere, anytime. If I forget my card, it is always available here. Thanks so much Humana!

name: MyHumana
title: Great App for All
text: Useful for looking up claims and deductibles. Makes my life easier with up to date information easily accessible.

name: MyHumana
title: Works great
text: I wasn't opposed to the previous look but this version is much faster. It provided the info I needed and I like the spinning ID card.

name: MyHumana
title: No access
text: Just signed up with part D through an insurance/Medicare specialist. All has gone well except for this app. It never lets me get past my log in. Just keeps saying due to an extreme amount of users on the server. Doesn't matter what time of day,night or early morning. Always says the same thing and I can not get in.

name: MyHumana
title: Thanks for listening
text: I can now paste my password in, thank you for listening.

name: MyHumana
title: App Not Working
text: I've had this app on my phone for about a week now, and after I login, it says, "Your coverage could not be loaded at this time. Please try again." If I press ok, it just continues to pop up with the same message until I close the app. Does anyone else have this issue or a resolution for it?

name: MyHumana
title: Worthless
text:
Same problem as so many other reviewers - cannot log in with Touch ID. After manually entering password now I have a new problem. When I search for a physician or urgent care center or hospital, message displays "no provider types available". 
I hope their insurance is better than their app !

name: MyHumana
title: Just downloaded and already having issues
text: Messaging center crashes each time I click on it. The whole reason I downloaded the app was to have access to this feature. Not impressed.

name: MyHumana
title: Convenient
text: This app is easy to use and has always been dependable.

name: MyHumana
title: Nothing more than a digital ID card
text: Forget your insurance card? Great, you'll love this app. Want to see your coverage details or find a provider in network or do any other reasonable insurance action that you'd think an app developer or product manager would think of? Too bad, because then this app is useless.

name: MyHumana
title: Not bad
text: Had a few problems at first, but it got better.

name: MyHumana
title: Getting there
text: App works fine for, no crashing as other people are reporting and i'm on iOS 9.3 beta 4.

name: MyHumana
title: Mrs
text: I really love this app, it's very user friendly & saves me a lot of time since everything is right at my fingertips! ðŸ˜Š

name: MyHumana
title: Great app
text: Love the new mobile app. Everything is right at your fingertips and easily accessible.

name: MyHumana
title: Excellent
text: My girlfriend made this app. 10/10 would use for all health insurance related activities provided I was insured through Humana. A boy can dream.

name: MyHumana
title: Not Good
text: App allows me to use my print to login but after logging in all pages are blank. Logging into the actual website is no better because it continues to say password is incorrect or just keeps going back to the login page all together. So frustrating.

name: MyHumana
title: Faster!
text: Sometimes the other app was slow. So far, this is much faster! I love how the ID card spins!

name: MyHumana
title: Fix
text: App won't open. It hasn't opened in days. Just gets stuck on the load screen. Plse fix......it seems as if the issue is w/ the finger scanner login. Won't login when scanning fingerprints. Works if u manually type in password. Plse adjust and fix.

name: MyHumana
title: Humana App is cool!
text: Easy to use and I love how you can just find a doctor without calling or going anywhere.

name: MyHumana
title: Login Issues
text: Had no issues logging in at all. Could be a 5 star app if they integrated their Vitality program with this app.

name: MyHumana
title: Constant log in issues
text: Every time I try to log in it tells me my password is incorrect. I write my passwords down. When I do get it to work it's great. I'm not always home where my passwords are so it's inconvenient when I'm out and about.

name: MyHumana
title: Like it but...
text: New update has proved the "save ID card to photos" feature useless. Really could have used it today.

name: MyHumana
title: Extremely convenient app to use
text: Great for verifying all medical insurance information at the palm of your hand.

name: MyHumana
title: Humana Making Healthcare Simple
text: This app is simple, easy to use and well managed. Used this on vacation to find a physician that accepted Humana insurance. Excellent app!

name: MyHumana
title: Awesome awesome
text: What a great addition of being able to see the HumanaVitality Dashboard within the updates application.

name: MyHumana
title: Completely new

name: MyHumana
title: Updates

name: MyHumana
title: Really like this app!!
text: Can look up rx refills and find contact info!! Very convenient! Wish it would show pending rxs that are waiting on dr approval from RightSource. Great app though!

name: MyHumana
title: Nice UI
text: I like the app, but the developers shouldn't pander to get five star ratings in the software updates.  It's really weird.

name: MyHumana
title: Terrible
text: Can never login through the app..

name: MyHumana
title: Great App
text: This has has been great so far, however I've only been using it for about a month.

name: MyHumana
title: New app update
text: Not liking it at all! Could not log in then when finally did get logged did a search on Rx providers was all different providers than last week. Made a call to Humana and the info on the app that shows Rx providers give me all the wrong info. Please fix!

name: MyHumana
title: Please fix the bugs!!!!

name: MyHumana
title: Crashes Every Time

name: MyHumana
title: What Happened?!?
text: I don't have medical ins w/Humana, I only have a FSA acct. I am no longer able to log in to the mobile app to view my spending acct balance. I keep getting an error message telling me I cannot log in b/c I no longer have coverage???  I've never had insurance coverage w/Humana!!  I've always only had the FSA card.

name: MyHumana
title: Very Convenient
text: All the information I need at my fingertips!

name: MyHumana
title: Frustrated
text: Took a while to navigate to get signed in I just see where people get frustrated and just get off this website.

name: MyHumana
title: Ease of use

name: MyHumana
title: No doctors listed
text: In the search category, I could not find any doctors in my area. I even search through a number of specialties. I went online and used the Humana network on the website, the app could not provide the same info.

name: MyHumana
title: Easy to use
text: I like the clean, easy to navigate design, well done!

name: MyHumana
title: Crashes!!!
text: I've used the app in the past and has worked fine; however, the past couple weeks I've tried to search for Urgent Care Facilities or Specialists and the app crashes every time. So disappointing. In its current state, this app is virtually useless.

name: MyHumana
title: Promising, but not there yet
text: Interface is clear and navigation in the app is well laid out. But … inability to paste password from a password manager is deal breaker for me. Plus many errors retrieving claims - maybe server performance problems?

name: MyHumana
title: Great + Wallet support
text:
*****I like that I can now save ID card into Photos, but why not into Apple Wallet--makes sense, right?  It goes in one's wallet!!*****

Option to see benefits and tiers for dental displayed nicely in the UI. 

Great!  I love the app. I love that it has TouchID. I also love the fax feature for my ID. 

Wish list:
Chat with Health concierge!  

3D Touch for quick ID access?
Apple Keychain integration

name: MyHumana
title: Great app and service
text: My wife and I couldn't be happier with our insurance and this app.

name: MyHumana
title: Awesome

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana
title: iPad Humany Pharmacy App
text: I have been using the Humana Pharmacy App on my IPad since I enrolled in Humana. Now, I am unable to use it when I go to the app, it says I need to update it. Then when I go to update it, I get the error message that the app is not compatible with this IPad. Don't know what has happened.

name: MyHumana
title: Not much help

name: MyHumana
title: App fails to login

This app is faulty.  If the problem is on my end then this app is poorly designed. It only gives a "Failure to login" message.  Great!  Why?  Invalid id?  Invalid password?  Who knows?  It gives no indication.  It also lacks the facility to retrieve a forgotten id or password. 

Note to Humana:  Hire professional app designers.

name: MyHumana
title: Needs more

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana

name: MyHumana
title: Web site communications
text:
Not user friendly.
Would help that you expose all information, including the drug name on all communications .
Your password protection should include a reset feature, that is in the original communication, that allows the customer, to request a reset be sent to his email address so he can create a current pass word.
My sense is you are not understanding your customer base and should interview 8 or 10. 65+ year old customers.  
Think retail and what this 65+ year old customer receives at his local CVS or Walgreens .    Get competitive from a customer service perspective .
  Bet you will get more Biz.
To even send this message you require a nickname. I’ve tried 6so far and they are all taken.   This is perceived as a knot hole to inhibit feedback.   Not good
Rethink please
